Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lark00
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because of the previous reviews on this site--and we were SO happy with the hotel. The hotel was great and so were all of the staff members. We left a tip for the housekeeper, and she left us a THANK-YOU NOTE! In all of my travels, that's a first. The complimentary breakfast was fabulous as was the evening complimentary weekday "snack" which was more like a meal. The hotel is very well located. I really cannot say enough good about this hotel. The front-desk staff, from the beginning to the end, could not have been nicer. We are all seasoned travelers and cannot wait to return to this hotel. In fact, we found Toronto to be one of the friendliest, cleanest, and most fun place we've visited.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: ChristineB155004
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, well equipped, clean and spacious. i was particularly impressed with the attitude of the staff. Not only were they always pleasant but they actually went out of their way to help you - even when you did not ask. I travel a fair amount for work and rarely encounter this kind of personal attentiveness.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JillMarch2012
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay and within walking distance to everything. Very large rooms and nice decor.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: petrina g
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on a 7-person family holiday to Canada! We were very impressed with the Residence Inn. Rooms were clean and extremely spacious. Ideal location for walking to main attractions. Brilliant view of CN Tower from room, great to watch it changing colour at night!! Staff were very helpful. Complimentary breakfast went down a treat, as did the complimentary evening buffet!! Thanks for having us!

Reviews.Title: “Location...check!”
Reviews.Author: TrentP1
Reviews.Content: I quite enjoyed this hotel. The rooms are standard. New looking and very clean. The staff are great as they give you the best places to eat in the area. I like the location. You are close to everything you need. Short walks to everything. If you want good food, walk. Want to see baseball, walk. Want to see the lake front, walk. Everything is within a six block walk. Younge is a bit of a walk to get to, but on a nice day. It's great. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay for business in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: amzpet
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights (will be staying 3 more times this year because of work) and it was amazing. Smallish, boutique feel, and because I have elite status (more than 10 nights last year) I was automatically upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite! Was wasted since I was alone but the room was bigger than my house at home! The service was great. The breakfast was way beyond the usual continental style - it included hot eggs/waffles/meat/yogurt parfaits and the list goes on. The bartender in the small lounge was very personable and said he has many clients who stay at the hotel regularly, even one who's been "living there" for 3 years except for weekends! That says something...

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Erin045
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a Wag Jag Jaunt for a weekend getaway with our kids. We were pleased with everything from the beginning to the end of our stay. The staff are wonderful...very friendly and attentive. The rooms are spacious and clean with extremely comfortable beds and great showers. The breakfast that comes with the room booking is fantastic with many hot and cold items to choose from. The pool area is well kept, although the temperatures in both the pool and hot tub could be a bit warmer. I can't say enough about the location...a very short walk to theatres, the Rogers Centre, the CN tower etc. We would definitely book here again!

Reviews.Title: “A special place to stay”
Reviews.Author: generalaviationpilot
Reviews.Content: This is my first two weeks in Canada. I have to say I am very, very pleasantly surprised with the hospitality of the staff and location of this Hotel. I have no experience of other places to stay in Toronto, however I do recognise that social evenings and the attention of Randolph behind the bar on weekday evenings is special. I would concur with all of the favourable write ups and do not wish to take up your time repeating them here! Do not hesitate to make your booking before all of the rooms are taken.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: JTraveller_2012
Reviews.Content: Such a great, great experience at the Residence Inn Marriott Downtown/Entertainment district. I love staying at Residence Inn's because of all the great amenities/room size, but this is by far the best RI/Marriott/or Hotel in general I've ever encountered. What makes this hotel so good? THE STAFF!!! They treat you as a "guest" and not as a "dollar sign"....The front desk staff(3 ladies--can't remember their names)were fantastic! So hopefully, granted early check in, and also said hello and smiled :) Such a great front line staff, it makes the guest feel welcomed and special, and the front desk does that! The valet's are super nice too! They say hello, hail you a cab, ect ect ect. Housekeeping are great and efficient too! The thing I loved about this hotel is everyone is friendly and say;s hello. I hate it when you go to a hotel and half the staff ignore you like you are not there. I honestly had no complaints/issues/ect.....Such a great experience, the GM should be proud of their wonderstaff/hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Feels Like We Have Our Own Downtown Condo!”
Reviews.Author: authentics
Reviews.Content: My husband is here on business for a week & it is so great to have so much space it feels like we have a condo! There is a full kitchen in the room so I can make my own lunch for work the next day. The evening socials are such a nice touch and a great way to network! The breakfast options change every day and there are fantastic healthy options too! Good stuff to add to oatmeal! Great place to stay if for a long time! By the way the cleanest hotel room I've had in years. To not see even one hair from a previous guest is absolutely shocking. Which I have come to understand cleaning staff can't get absolutely everything. I've stayed in very high end hotels where you come across one or two, but wow!! I can't believe the cleanliness. No dust ! No hairs! It is unbelievable. And every staff member always says hello in the elevator and asks at least one question to you. This place is great! A home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff - Great for Extended Stay”
Reviews.Author: AndWhere2Next
Reviews.Content: This was a great place for an extended stay. It was central to the financial district, very close to a restaurant district, and the dry cleaner was directly across the street. The hotel had a hot breakfast every day that i could rely on and there were grocery stores not too far from the hotel for other nights. I'd absolutely recommend this place. Rooms are clean, laundry is on 10th and 16th floor (I think) and it's just an easy trip. I was here for about 30 days.

Reviews.Title: “Rocked it!”
Reviews.Author: CherylLikey
Reviews.Content: I'd never heard of this hotel until I saw it on tripadvisor, but let me be among those who say this place is awesome. We arrived, with an early check in, and were upgraded to an amazing two-bedroom, two-bath suite. Our family has stayed in suites before, but this went above and beyond anything we've ever seen in terms of pure comfort and convenience. Our three-year-old son was thrilled to have his own TV with the Treehouse channel, and we were grateful to have our own TV without the Treehouse channel. Staff members were very friendly and accommodating, and the location was perfect-o as it was in a comfortable walking distance from Union Station - even with three bags. My only criticism is the the tiles around the 'cool pool' are very slippery when wet as my three-year-old took a hard tumble and konked his melon and I also slipped, as did another guest that was there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steve D
Reviews.Content: I've got to say, I've travelled all over for business, and never had a better stay than in this hotel...for any price. Even the basic rooms are spacious, with a separate kitchen, sitting area, bed and bath. The place is modern, rate inclues wi-fi and breakfast, and the staff are fanastic. There's a very friendly and cozy feel that the staff give. A couple of additional thoughts: this hotel is just up from the Rogers Centre and, while in the centre of the entertainment district, it is a bit of a walk from the subway (just be warned if staying in the winter). Also, while the rooms stack up nicely to any hotel I've been in, this hotel is usually full of families, so that is more the crowd than the usual business traveler. The pool and fitness area are fine, but on the small side. The bar is pretty tiny and the hotel doesn't really serve food other than breakfast. There's a bunch of hotels and bars in the area though. As a comparison, I've stayed at the Renaissance down the street (typically double the rate and in desperate need of a reno), the King Edward (same price, but very tired rooms), One King West (modern, but TINY rooms), and the Eaton Centre Marriott (more $$$ and basic hotel room) in the downtown core, and this would get my $ any day of the week.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Erica d
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott on Christmas Eve and I thought the hotel was very clean. Our room had a king size bed with a kitchen equipped with everything from clean dishes, dish soap and a dishwasher. I was delighted at how sparkling clean the bathroom and tub was. The bed was clean and very comfortable and the staff was very accommodating. We did have problems finding an ice machine but was provided with ice at the front desk. The breakfast buffet in the morning was adequate except for the small breakfast area and long line up to eat. The location was great if you want to do some sightseeing, it is close to the CN tower and other attractions. I live in Toronto so my trip did not include sightseeing but we were close to some restaurants and the hotel has an Indian restaurant right next door. The valet parking was expensive at $35 dollars per day; they did not have the self park option. I would recommend that you find a nearby parking lot with lower rates and walk the short distance to the hotel depending on the time of year and the weather. We had a great stay here and I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Condom Wrapper on My Bed + Reservation Sucked”
Reviews.Author: badpanorama
Reviews.Content: I really want to give this hotel a 5-star review, because at its core the hotel is excellent. However a couple of things happened before and during my stay that just hosed my experience: 1) Found an open condom wrapper on my bed. They took care of it right away when I informed them, but still I wish I've never seen that thing. 2) They screwed up my reservation a couple of times. I booked 2 months in advance, thought I got a 2bdrm suite for a special rate. Only to found out (when I called manually again) that the reservation didn't go through at the special rate (and they failed to inform me of that)...anyways after lots of back and forth and trying and not trying, I ended up changing my reservation to a studio (which turned out to be a great room, especially when you get another adjoining studio). Other than these 2 things, the hotel is actually very good. The rooms are amazing. Service is excellent. Breakfast is so-so. Internet is good. Location is good. And value for what you pay is very very good.

Reviews.Title: “pking342”
Reviews.Author: gnik
Reviews.Content: the staff at this hotel was excellant. they were always there when you needed anything or asked how things were going. the breafast buffet and socials in the evening were wonderful and the staff were on top of evrything. I would go back there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elmer166
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Christmas break and had a great time. The room was large with a king size bed and a pull out couch. The kitchen was well stocked with dishes etc. The only thing the kitchen did not have was an oven, there was a stove top though. The internet was fast and connected no problem, the pool was well sized and there was a hot tub. The workout room was ok, the cardio machines are starting to show their age. The breakfast in the morning was top notch and one of the best I have had at a hotel. Great location with easy access to the metro. Parking is kind of steep at $35 a day, but there are other options close by that are cheaper. I would stay here again and recommend it to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay!”
Reviews.Author: Rallen58
Reviews.Content: From start to finish our stay at this hotel went beyond our expectations. We wanted to stay near the Princess of Wales Theater and it was just a short walk. The suite was immaculate, beautifully decorated, with a great shower. The beds are so comfortable with soft sheets that we fell fast asleep quickly. The complementary breakfast was over-the-top...great coffee, hot items and very well maintained by staff. We didn't have time to use the pool, however we definitely will be back!

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: 43flutter8
Reviews.Content: Staying at this Marriott in downtown Toronto was one of the best hotel experiences I have had in some time. The hotel was clean and my corner suite was very large with a full kitchen to boot. I was surprised to find that a full breakfast was also included. The staff under the direction of a fabulous GM were so helpful and happy. Randall, the bartender,would bend over backwards to be of assistance to guests. Location was wonderfully central-walk to the theatre, Skydome, and CN Tower as well as the subway. As a Solo female traveller, I felt very safe and 'at home'--didn't feel like a strange hotel. I would definitely recommend this hotel to singles and families...and I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, clean, and good value”
Reviews.Author: moabhikers
Reviews.Content: The Residence Inn is in a perfect location for exploring Toronto by foot. It's blocks from theaters, restaurants, the CN Tower, Hockey Hall of Fame, etc. The service was friendly and our room was very clean. We will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our Needs”
Reviews.Author: Tweetybeets
Reviews.Content: The four of us stayed 4 nights here during Winter break. We had a large corner room looking out at the CN Tower. The room was nice...king-sized bed, pull-out couch bed, but according to my kids this was not too comfortable, the kitchen was well stocked with dishes and cooking pans, which we appreciated. There was a nice breakfast in the mornings, the kids enjoyed the pool every night and my husband and I enjoyed the gym. I rang up the concierge a few times for needed items and they were always delivered in a timely manner. The hotel is close to the trolley and the subway system which we used daily. The downsides would be the $35 parking fee, so we stayed in the underground parking garage behind the hotel at a $20 rate and the only other thing I didn't like was the large power grid that you look down on. Also, there is a building going up which will potentially block the CN tower view depending on it's heighth. That will be sad because the view from our 21st floor was amazing! I would definitely stay again. It was a pleasure!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful rooms”
Reviews.Author: Judith C
Reviews.Content: I am personally a Marriot, hotel chain, lover. This summer I took a road trip thru the States from Vancouver Island to Toronto, Ont and stayed at a few Marriot type hotels and all were GREAT! At least I have yet to be disappointed. This Residence Inn in the Entertainment district of Toronto, once again, did not disappoint. We went to Toronto to watch a CFL game. This hotel location was great if you are going to watch professional sports as they are within walking distance. It is also around the corner from the entertainment district. They had a great breakfast but it was very busy. The room we had was a king bed studio suite, I love those rooms becuase they actually have space for you to relax. Always clean. The parking is expensive, a little more than what I am used but I often stay up near Yonge and College. Marriots sometimes cost a little more but are worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convienent”
Reviews.Author: CastleFam_4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights on points. The room was very nice and quite comfortable for 4. There was a problem with the plumbing that was annoying. They have an apparent water hammer problem (at least in the area of or room (813) When someone was running hot water at just the right mixture it sounded like someone was drilling into concrete. Id have to say this was an isolated problem. We were hoping for the free dinner when we arrived on Wed night but apparently this is the only week they that don't offer free dinner. That would have been nice to know. As it turned out we went to a local restaurant and had a excellent Asian cuisine meal instead. The morning breakfast were good. There didn't seem to be quite enough seating for all the hungry travelers though. Pool area was adequate but the hot tub jets were not working. The deck was very slippery. Too Slippery in my opinion. While I didn't see anyone fall I saw several near falls in the hour I was there. The Valet service cost $35 a day and the Valets are courteous and quick. If you need to you can access your vehicle without taking it out of the heated garage. Hotel is very convenient to the theater district and a short walk to the Rodgers Center and CN Tower. A car is better to get to some of the area attractions (Science Center and Zoo) then Public transit. (Especially when it is cold with youngins)

Reviews.Title: “Bottom line, I didn't sleep well”
Reviews.Author: pnear
Reviews.Content: I have a rule that regardless of the rest of the hotel, if I didn't sleep then the hotel didn't serve it's primary purpose. I didn't sleep at the Residence Inn Toronto. The hotel itself is not bad. Small cramped lobby but large spacious rooms. The room felt modern and well decorated with good kitchenette amenities. The large flat screen TV unfortunately got a snowy low definition signal. The killer for me was the heating/cooling unit which turned on and off abruptly throughout the night, waking both me and my kids regularly. Usually I am able to set the thermostat to just keep the fan on which makes me sleep like a baby, but this thermostat switches back to auto fan after about 30 minutes. Maddening! We used the pool with my kids, which was small, but clean and warm. Overall, this is a nice hotel if you are a deep sleeper. If however a loud fan turning on and off every 10 minutes is a problem then I can't recommend staying here nor will I be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Keimya
Reviews.Content: Planned to visit Toronto for one night. Upon checking in the front desk clerk was so nice and inquired about my one night stay. He convinced us the extending our stay would be worth it. After spending the day at the Eaton Center mall, we decided to extend our stay for five days. Staff, free breakfast buffet, housekeeping, and size/cleanliness of room. Appears to be a new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Did not meet expectations, would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: indiabound826
Reviews.Content: This newer hotel was highly touted in one of the premier travel guides, but fell well short of my expectations. I am a Marriott loyalist and have stayed in RIs many times. The location is good and the hotel is very modern. However, those are the only positive attributes I can think of. There were only two of three elevators working throughout the entire stay, the front desk personnel were not well trained, the room was poorly maintained, etc. There are many places to stay in downtown TO I am sure you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks, but no thanks.”
Reviews.Author: gina021
Reviews.Content: Cheated on my favorite Toronto hotel,The Cambridge Suites, to stay here because of the Residence Inn's proximity to the Air Canada Center for a Raptors game. Cheating never pays. The walk from RI to ACC was too long on a blustery winter night, so we took a cab. Was thankful for the upgrade to a 1-bedroom suite, but our 2 teenage boys still had to share a very "springy" pull out sofa, for which there were no bed linens. After calling housekeeping, we were given 2 flat sheets and a blanket. Gee, thanks. We took pillows from the actual bed for the boys to use. We were unexpectedly visited by hotel staff TWICE during our stay when they did not knock, and entered our room. Once early in the morning while we were sleeping, and another time at night while getting ready to go out. Wow. A little professional courtesy, please. The first day we decided to attempt the free breakfast challenge. But after standing in a very, very long line, they were out of eggs and bacon, forks and knives. Yep. Is true. At least we got a muffin and some cold coffee. Securing a place to sit was another challenge. The 2nd day we opted out of the breakfast. As for the evening snack - well, that was not on the calendar for the week during our stay. Yes, there is a small pool and hot tub (4 people max so plan to wait in line for that, too), and an exercise facility. If you are looking for a place close to the Air Canada Center, stay at the Fairmont Royal York. If you're looking for a nice suite, stay at Cambridge Suites. Way better hotel and location.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Nice!”
Reviews.Author: dtsohio
Reviews.Content: Two nights with two kids. Check in was slow (busy) but efficiency and staff attention was great! Everything was comfortable and convenient. Highly recommend this location! Indian restaurant next door is also VERY good! Great overall value !

Reviews.Title: “It is a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LovesLifeAlways
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great! Rooms are beautiful, breakfast was really good and the staff were friendly. There is a parking lot around the corner that is super cheap. I can't remember the name of it. Thanks for a great stay. I would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: OntarioTrekker
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one-bedroom suite on a weekend. The suite featured a decent sized kitchen area, a 2-seater table, sofa bed and a chair in the living area. The bedroom had a king bed, desk and a second full-sized t.v. There was a sink and a good-sized mirror and vanity with the toilet and shower in a separte room. The shower/toilet room was rather small and cramped. Second floor has meeting rooms and a good sized gym area with lots of exercise equipment. The pool is quite large with a hot tub and change area provided. The pool is one depth only - 1.2 m - so kids will need an adult with them. The breakfast buffet has an excellent selection of hot and cold items and the seating is limited so plan your time there or just grab a tray and take it back upstairs. The hotel is close to several restaurants and attractions and the grandkids enjoyed the up close and personal view of the CN Tower! We were on the 4th floor so go higher if you want any kind of view - our windows looked out into office windows!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for long-term stay”
Reviews.Author: lastfrontier99
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay, esp. for a long-term stay in Toronto: conveniently close to downtown and harbour front, quiet, very spacious rooms, esp. if you book a two bedroom suite, a complimentary breakfast buffet with a above-average large choice of options, work-out and indoor-swimming-pool, guest laundry. All you need, perfect for business and leisure! I will come back with my family!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Hotel on Earth - For the Price”
Reviews.Author: lucastim
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel now for over 2 months. I absolutely love the top line customer service at an affordable price. You feel like you're at the Ritz with the amount of care each employee takes to make your stay satisfactory, and they ALL go above and beyond to make this home away from home special. Thanks! I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: GioAndJen
Reviews.Content: I found the staff at the hotel to be very friendly and helpful. The rooms were wonderful -- very spacious and clean. I stayed for several nights, and my room felt like it had been completely cleaned every day when I came back to it. My room had a separate living room which was very large and had a sofabed and TV, with the kitchenette to the side of the room. The kitchenette had a full-sized fridge, dishwasher, stove top, microwave, coffee maker, and came equipped with dishes and a few pots & pans. The bedroom had a queen bed, tv, lots of dresser drawers & closet space. Breakfast each day was great. There were a lot of options and it was nice to have a variety since I was there over several days. Every day there were scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs, breakfast meat (I think usually sausage), breakfast potatoes, toast, bagels, muffins, prepared oatmeal, waffles, cereal, and fresh fruit. The location was excellent. I was attending a conference at the Convention Centre, which was just around the corner. The walk was short and I liked that I got out in the fresh air each day to come and go from it. There were also lots of restaurants and shops in the area, and of course it was right near the theatres. The hotel had a few "appreciation" nights going on while I was there. One night they had a chef in to make pasta for visitors, and another night they had a cocktail reception with free beer/wine and snacks, along with draws for prizes. My friend and I each ended up winning 2 free tickets (so 4 tickets in total) to a comedy show at "Second City", so it was nice that we also got to attend a free show while we were staying in Toronto. I would definitely go back to this place as long as I am not looking for something cheaper, although the cost definitely reflected what I received in terms of service, comfort, and convenience from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - great location”
Reviews.Author: tracee_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights when we first arrived in Canada. Great location - very convenient to downtown and CN Tower. We stayed in a one bedroom suite - very clean and comfortable and very comfy beds. Staff at reception were very helpful. The breakfast was basic but a good selection and I liked the way you could take some breakfast back to your room if you didnt want to eat in the dining room. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Residence Inns!”
Reviews.Author: YI_IVY
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with husband and kid for a weekend getaway and we were very impressed. The hotel is very clean and updated. The room is spacious and comfy. It's a short walk to the lake shore. All in all, highly recommended no matter you travel on business or leisure in Toronto area.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient and a pretty good continental breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Frireland2010
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on business a few times and can't complain at all. The kitchenette is very handy when you're staying more than one night. The rooms are always clean, comfortable and the breakfast provides a little bit of everything. If you want high end, pay for it somewhere else. I also like being so close to downtown hot spots, red rocket and subway stops. I also have yet to meet an unfriendly front desk employee. Maybe a full-on lounge would be nice for after a long day of meetings, but you have a fridge and a liquor store's within walking distance. I give it the proverbial two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Abraham S
Reviews.Content: This hotel matches expectations of its brand. The central locaion made travel by foot convenient - which is great for families. Receptionist was ready to hand with map and directions. The rooms, were clean, spacious and large by standard. I would recommend - particularly based on location downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Pankaj2768
Reviews.Content: As usual, I found this Residence Inn come to expectations, in fact bit better. This Inn is bang in the heart of the downtown, two blocks away from CN tower and two blocks away from Subway. With shops on the left, Indian resturant in the same bulding and trams one block away, I guess this is one of the most comfortable location to be in. The staff was good, hotel is small though nice. The one bedroom suite was very good. Full loaded and had all what was needed for a comfortable stay. I only wish if the breakfast could have some more options. It was very limited in choice. All in all, I will recommend any one to be a guest at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “More than you expect”
Reviews.Author: DLam57
Reviews.Content: A thank you party for the clients on our first night, staff very polite and room very clean. Close to the CN tower and King street, well located. The fact that you have a complete kitchen and a very nice breakfast included also are some of the reasons to go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very good stay , will stay there agin.”
Reviews.Author: julesbda
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a great location and staff were very attentive . Room was excellent with great views of the Tower . Breakfast was a buffet style and somewhat busy but food was fine and again staff stocked up with new food when needed . Free wi-fi was great and a decent speed so i could skype to call home . All in all a very good stay and would recommend to anyone .

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gdoll
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on business, and were going to a convention at the main convention centre in Toronto. The convention centre is only a short 2 block easy walk from the hotel. It is located near all entertainment centres including the Rogers Centre. An easy walk to the lake and 'Old Town'. Lots of goods restaurants near by, including Italian, Indian, and pubs. The full breakfast included was excellent, and the price we paid (discounted through the convention) was very good. The room included kitchette.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Hootsmon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here only one night, at the end of a week in Canada visiting family. We chose this hotel because of its location - we had planned a night at the theatre. ('Private Lives' starring Kim Cattrall - see it when it transfers to Broadway if you can!) Check in was speedy and friendly, the room we had was on 17th floor - clean, modern and absolutely gorgeous! We also we had a view of the CN Tower. Very comfortable night, and breakfast the next morning was quite comprehensive in its selection. I would go down to eat earlier than we did if I get the chance to stay again, as the seating area was smaller than the number of guests waiting to eat. This hotel has only valet parking, but as we hadn't a clue where to leave our car, I was very glad to have someone come straight to the car, smile, take our bags in and then park the car for me! (Even at $35 a night.) Parking is good there til 2pm the next day, which suited us, as we could wander Toronto the next morning, then head back to the airport. I'm just sorry we didn't spend longer in Toronto - and at this hotel. I will next time!

Reviews.Title: “Very unprofessional... they overbook their rooms”
Reviews.Author: sonic1301
Reviews.Content: I reserved a room 3 months in advance of my trip. I arrived at 10:30pm on the date of my reservation after driving 2 hours to be told that "a large group did not leave when they were supposed to" and therefore they did not have a room for me. They offered to "escort" me to another hotel, located in a completely different part of the city. Not very helpful considering I booked this hotel specifically because it was located close to the conference I planned to attend early the next morning. When I said that was unacceptable they offered to send me to another much older hotel (not a suite hotel) for the same price. While this was going on I saw one other person come to check in who was given the same story, but accepted to be sent to the hotel in the other part of town. Yet another person arrived, was given a cookie, thanked for being part of some special program and told he was being given a free upgrade. I called my husband who called the Ritz-Carlton next door. They told him that earlier in the day they had lots of rooms available, but because this hotel overbooked so many people they had just given away their last room to yet another person who did not have their reservation honored at the Residence Inn by Marriott. Finally after about 20 minutes of this they told me that they could give me a room after all, but it would be a wheelchair accessible room with no bathtub. Really, who cares (now 11pm at night) about having a bath tub in a situation like this! They gave me a key but no information about where to go for breakfast or other basic information one would generally expect. The microwave in the room was broken. To rub salt into my wounds there was a letter in the room from Beth K Osborne, General Manager explaining that this week is Global Customer Appreciation Week. It brags that they have been rated number one on trip advisor for four years running. Sadly, I now know that is at the cost of treating some people very poorly. Not one person could explain to me why if they new some other customers had overstayed their reservation (check-out time was noon), that they did not call me earlier to let me know their would be an issue. I arrived at 10:30pm, tired and just wanting to sleep. Had they called me I would have had the option of booking another room for myself, or even staying home and coming for the second day of the conference instead. I believe they were hoping I simply wouldn't show up so they could keep my money for the night's stay as well. All though the building is new and clean and the rooms are spacious, I will NEVER stay here again. If you can't trust a hotel to honor a reservation, why make one?

Reviews.Title: “will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: SeattleKellye
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for a 7-day conference, plus 5 additional nights for sightseeing. The bed and pillows were comfortable. You could easily adjust the room temperature. We were on the 20th floor and had a great view. The room had a full kitchen. There was free WiFi, which is almost a deal-clincher in and of itself. The free, full breakfast was delicious and had something for everyone. There was often a light dinner offered, also for free. The location was convenient to the subway and to all of the major local destinations. The front desk staff, the bell staff, kitchen staff, and housekeeping staff were top-notch. We got a special nightly rate for staying there for an extended period. We will definitely choose the Residence Inn if we stay in Toronto again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel for its value.”
Reviews.Author: jczar
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my girlfriends birthday with other friends. We walked in the lobby. Checked in. Very nice staff at front desk. We paid less than 200 for the room, which includes breakfast. When we got to the room. We were happy with the size of the room. You get a full kitchen. And sofa bed and a king size bed. Then our view was the cn tower. Also comes with a flat screen tv. We had 5 people and fit well in the room. For the value, this is a great room. And the location was amazing. Everything is around you. I would tell everyone about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not really next door to Entertainment District as I expected”
Reviews.Author: pwrshift
Reviews.Content: The Toronto Residence Inn - Entertainment District is only 3 years old, built as a RI, and still quite fresh. Theatre, restaurants and entertainment are not really next door to the Residence Inn as you might expect from their 'Entertainment District' claim, but if you can walk a few city blocks you'll enjoy a much better restaurant selection on King Street, where I'd rather stay next time for convenience to theatre and restaurant variety. The full service Hyatt hotel on King (former Holiday Inn) is much better located with at least ten upscale 'in' restaurants right across the street. The only really close restaurant to the Residence Inn Entertainment District hotel is a very good Indian restaurant called '259 Host' and it's right next door adjacent to the hotel (reviewed below). The SoHo Metropolitan hotel is also closer to restaurants and entertainment, and right across from the Wayne Gretzky sports bar. The Residence Inn doesn't have a taxi stand so you might have to wait for them to call one to come...service is friendly though. Live theatre in Toronto is very good, by the way...so is restaurant choice...be sure to read through the 'Where' magazine when you check in or book theatre tickets before you arrive...or maybe you can do that online. When we were here 'Chess' was playing, as was 'Private Lives' with Kim Cattrall and Pail Gross. 'War Horse' opens Feb 10, 2012. 'Rigoletto' opera was at the Four Seasons Centre. Second City is a fun show to see. Museums everywhere and excellent shopping at all levels. Lots to see and do in Toronto. We tried the '259 Host' restaurant next door and really enjoyed it...quite upscale and they will deliver the bill to the Marriott which I thought would earn Marriott Rewards points but it doesn't. The whole bill for two came to just $105 plus tip for a shared appetizer Panir, shared garlic Nan, shared plain basmati rice, lamb medallions entree, butter chicken entree, 2 glasses wine, 2 mixed drinks, no dessert or coffee. For downtown Toronto, I thought it very reasonable and would go again. If you are a Marriott gold or platinum elite you won't get the extra benefits staying here and only half the points as you would at the Marriott full service hotels. Local phone calls at the RI are $1.50...even for Marriott Elite members, so bring your cellphone. Room WiFi is free at all lower level Marriott's and worked well. Widescreen TV's are still only analog so everyone looks fat. I hated their TV remotes as they don't have a 'sleep' button, so I was awakened at 4 am by a noisy infomercial as I fell asleep without turning it off. Administrative staff 'attitude' was not very pleasant. Front desk and reception people are rushed off their feet and I found them and the operators very abrupt and not friendly like most 'Marriott' trained people, probably as a result of understaffing. This is a Residence Inn with a difference as it has bellboys and valet parking attendant (you must use valet parking - $30 a night plus tips). Room decor is pleasantly different as well. We had a 1 bdrm suite but on check in the gal told us the better views were in the studios. I am a Marriott Platinum Elite but got no upgrade even though they were far from full. Room A/C was set for 70 degrees but we froze all night, had to turn it off and then we got too hot...why are hotels like this? I was in the room when the maid came but she took less than 10 minutes to clean up with no vacuuming as we were staying 2 nights. We were on a high floor and the elevators are extremely slow even if you don't stop. There's a comfy bar facing the reception area...looks ok but very few people in it at happy hour Friday night...and nobody when we returned at 9 pm from dinner. Each morning breakfast can be had just down from the front desk. Nice seating in both areas. The buffet was quite nice except at the bottleneck for toast and pancakes/waffle you have to make yourself...they need more machines. Scrambled eggs were very plain and tasteless, potatoes were terrible mixed with onions and peppers (no hash browns!), sausages were gluten free-- but after eating I had to rush to the bathroom. A little later my guest had to go several times as well. Hmmm. I'll stick to oatmeal next time. At the bar area they offer some food on some work nights...such as 'baked potato night with all the trimmings with salad and cookies'; 'chili night, dessert and dessert'; 'soup and salad night'; etc. FREE on Monday to Wednesday. I don't know if this is just for hotel guests or walk-ins. Newspapers are NOT delivered to your room as in other Marriott's but available if you go down yourself to the reception area (none on Sunday, but the Saturday Globe&Mail is excellent). So if you like your morning cup of Joe while reading a paper you'll have to get dressed first. :) And go early...the newspapers were all gone when we went down for breakfast at 10 am Saturday...but the bellboy managed to find one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent if you need a place to stay before a hospital visit!”
Reviews.Author: shinystar1300
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and very open. If you have an appointment booked at one of the downtown hospitals and you bring your appointment sheet, you can get a special 99 dollar rate. In the winter or just because of traffic, it is fantastic for anyone that lives outside of the city and needs to come in for appointments at PMH, Sick Kids etc and do not want to use a lodge for various reasons (communal bathrooms = not good for low immune systems etc.). They provide breakfast as well - included in your rate; a classic continental breakfast including a make-your-own waffle station. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “One night stay with upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: strats_w
Reviews.Content: I had a one night stay in late September for business. Without asking, I was given a complimentary upgrade to a 2-bedroom suite. As is usually the case with Residence Inns anywhere, the room was very clean and very well appointed. Kitchen and bathrooms were just right. I always look for a Residence Inn wherever I am going. They are always great. I found self parking at the Vinci Ideal Parking was $15 cheaper than the valet parking at the hotel. Breakfast was very good too and was on the house. I used the fitness room which had good equipment. It is a little small and 1 of the 2 stationary bikes wasn't working (I let the front desk know), but otherwise is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: reasonable_dad
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night but it was very pleasant. Walked with our 4 year old son and 8 year old daughter to the Rogers Centre and CN Tower without any whining - it was 2 or 3 blocks. Room was clean, staff was friendly, they served free dinner and breakfast! We used the valet parking which was pricey but worth the money if you are not familiar with the city. Here's a tip - try not to check-in anywhere close to morning or afternoon rush hour, there is no place to park during check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: DFWMOM
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Residence Inn was great! The location is superb! You can walk to the waterfront, CN Tower, Rogers Centre and lots of restaurants and night life. The rooms were spacious and impeccably clean. The entire staff was helpful and friendly. We did not use the valet parking, we parked in the building next door for less money. Overall, great stay! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: 30-StateTraveler
Reviews.Content: I booked here instead of the â€œ4-Starsâ€� that were picked by the convention folks and this was a great choice. A short 2Â½ block walk to the convention center, restaurants and ABC store nearby. One block from where the Toronto Airport Express shuttle bus drops off at the nearby Hyatt. Everyone very friendly, big rooms with updated baths, welcoming light meal in the evenings and a wonderful breakfast with something for everyone: cereals, scrambled eggs, specialty breakfast sandwich, bacon or sausage, yogurts, fresh fruits, oatmeal and waffle machine. 24 Hour lobby coffee & tea. This hotel also gets my award as the fastest high-speed internet I have ever encountered in a hotel: according to speedtest.net I had a blistering 29 Mbps download speed in my room and you have a choice of both wired and wireless. As with all Residence Inns youâ€™ve got a full kitchen and great amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: joyceadrianne
Reviews.Content: We went on this trip to scratch off ballpark number 10 off of our list and it worked out great. The hotel was literally 1 block from Rogers Centre. It's location in the entertainment district was great too. A lot of restaurants to choose from and great sight seeing things to do. I would definitely stay here again which I hope I do cause I LOVED Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELCOUPLESANDIEGO
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently for 2 nights and found the hotel to be excellent and exceeded our expectations. The room was large and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel felt like it was very new and the rooms were clean and the staff were very nice and helpful. The breakfast buffet had many choices hot and cold and was served until 11 am on weekends which was very nice. Valet staff arranged for a cheaper flat rate taxi to take us to the airport, which was a $25 savings compared to what I had researched, so we appreciated his help. Close to lots of attractions, would stay here again if we make it back to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “I was surprised- considering the previous reviews”
Reviews.Author: Julie S
Reviews.Content: My party of 4 stayed for 3 nights & 4 days. Positives: - the 1-bedroom suite was decent. Please note that you will have to ask for blankets or what-have-you. -the 2-bedroom suite was gorgeous! No view, but stunning and well- equipped. -the breakfast is YUMMY. -Close proximity to club district & CN Tower (walking distance) -Some of the staff are incomparable!!! They MADE the stay-- Julius, Maria, & Regan are just a few of the phenomenal staff! Negatives: -Some of the staff is UNprofessional. (seriously, members of our party OVERHEARD them making derogatory & prejudicial comments about another member of OUR PARTY. and the management team attempted to call us liars. *Please note, I don't mind being talked about, but... I shouldn't hear it in the dining room, when the worker is at the front desk. Take that to the employee break-room Thanks*). -Some of the staff will ignore you as you pull up (ie. the valet will not open the door, move to get a luggage cart, or even ask if you are parking). -Please don't dare to have an issue while there because the management team will ask what will make you feel better (and no matter how reasonable your request is), they will choose to not give it to you. (in our case, the reason was: the manager had worked with that disrespectful employee for years, so we must be lying.). Bottomline: Nice facility, poor staff. For suites that cost more than $400-$500/night, one would expect all of the staff to have professionalism.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location to theatres”
Reviews.Author: stghockeymom
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night (Oct 1/11) since we were going to a play at the Royal Alexander Theatre. Approx. 3 blocks to the theatre and nearby there were lots of choices for eating. Easy check in and had no worries about the valet parking. They asked upon check in if we were celebrating or staying there for any particular reason. We shared that it was our anniversary and that we were going to a play. While we were out at the play they delivered a nice basket of "goodies", bottle of wine and water to us. The room was spacious, clean and quiet. With the room rate came an "American hot breakfast". Lots of choices on the breakfast buffet. Highly recommend this hotel it due to its location to the theatre district and for their great hospitality. We will return there next time we are visiting the Toronto area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Residence Inn, Awesome Hotel!! Great Downtown Location!”
Reviews.Author: MorganLuv
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay, had a corner bedroom on the 16th floor. Beds are soo comfortable!! We had a king bed room and everything was perfect, nice and clean. Rooms are a nice size. Soundproof windows help alot, you don't hear much of anything outside. We will stay here again. Had a geat dinner at "The Keg", awesome lobster and steak!! The Baton Rouge restaurant was excellent, located close by so we walked to it. Enjoyed visiting the CN Tower too, it's one block up!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - everything just lovely and beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: robundle
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed at this hotel on vacation in Toronto. The staff is very nice and friendly. They go the extra mile. The breakfasts in the morning were outstanding. The valet parking was expensive (35/night) so do without a car if you can. The subway system is very good, and we felt safe using it and walking at night. Our queen size suite was perfect for the two of us. The bed was super comfortable and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for a comfortable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jag1988
Reviews.Content: Just finished a 2 weeks stay at this hotel. I chose it based on other people's review. Hotel is very clean and staff are friendly and helpful. Location is excellent if you want to be near the lake. Free in-room internet was great except they do charge for local calls. The included breakfast was excellent, I'm not crazy about eggs but their scrambled eggs were delicious! Lots of other healthy choices if you don't like the greasy stuff. Their evening light meals (only twice/week) sometimes were more than "light" and they were not bad. The ony thing I don't like about the hotel are their doors, which tend to slam really loud. Not an enjoyable thing for light sleepers like myself. Their in-room internet was also down one day during my stay and caused a bit of inconveniences. Otherwise, I had a wonderful stay and will definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, ground floor?reception can get crowded”
Reviews.Author: MichaelTravelling
Reviews.Content: We spent five consecutive nights here in early September 2011. We had spent nearly a fortnight here in Aug/September 2009 (when the hotel was about six months old) and this year's stay cemented the favourable impressions which we formed two years ago. The hotel is ideally located; just off the tourist bus routes, an eight minute walk from the CN Tower and the Rogers stadium (Bluejays); 20-minute walk from shopping at The Bay, Yonge Street and the Eaton Centre (big retail mall in the middle of Toronto); 15 minute walk from the main train station. We drive enough in the UK, so we always aim to walk/bus/train/fly when we are overseas. We took a suite on the 19th floor. Peaceful, spacious, comfortable, well-appointed. With the fridge/freezer, microwave and cooker, you could easily set up home here. The welcoming pack of microwave popcorn was a nice touch. Excellent bathroom with a nice deep bath. If you take a suite on the East side of the building, you look out on a huge electicity sub-station and, to the right, on a new construction site in line with your view to the bottom of the CN Tower (which is your navigation point ANYWHERE in the city). Big deal, we never heard a thing from these two sites! Breakfast is served on the ground floor, adjacent to RECEPTION. This is a city-centre hotel, and the value of land is reflected in the small-ish dining area. This dining area is adequate, but expect a five-minute wait for a table at peak times. On the ground floor also is a small bar; this has a habit of closing before 9pm but this is solely dictated by the level of patronage; if the bar is busy, he'll stay open. If not - "use it or lose it". The Reception staff were universally helpful, as were the door staff and the cleaning crews. Negatives - there are only three lifts ("elevators" for the yanks in the Colonies!) and, EVEN WHEN ALL THREE LIFTS ARE WORKING, there can be queues for the lifts. This shows up the Achilles heel of this hotel - the reception area is long and narrow, from the entrance to past the lifts. When were there, the middle lift got stuck on, I think, the 4th floor on at least two occasions. Memo to Mr Marriott - next time, this size of hotel needs four lifts and a squarer reception area! This was our second trip to the Marriott Residence Inns Toronto Downtown Entertainment District - or "255 Wellington Street West " for short. Travelling back to the Airpor? for two of you, let the hotel book a taxi - a Limo rolled up, and cost us CDN55 for the trip back to Pearson; less than the CDN39/head cost of the Airporter service. We'll be back! Mike Lifts reception

Reviews.Title: “would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: jtkJakarta
Reviews.Content: Great location if you want to visit the CN Tower or attend an event at Rogers Center (both are a 5 minute walk away). The main shopping street, Yonge Street, is a longer walk, but still doable. As usual in Residence Inns, we had a very spacious room with a small kitchen. The propert seems to be a bit old, so decor and style are not really up to date; however, good service makes up for this. Especially front desk staff is helpful, and provides plenty of good sightseeing advice. Valet parking (with in-out-privileges) is 32 Dollars per day, which is slightly more expensive that public garages, but still acceptable for downtown Toronto. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Instant Hit”
Reviews.Author: Rolayna
Reviews.Content: This is one of several hotels that I have stayed at on visits to Toronto. It was not the most extravagant, but it was great for my extended stays of up to a week or two, and the added dimension of a great location at a great price gave it the edge over the others. I initially stayed here only because I travelled to Toronto for work, and my company had a discounted rate agreement. However, on my first visit, it became an instant hit. The hotel has a very modern feel, and the first time I stayed here was shortly after some kind of construction/renovation. However, the convenience of the kitchen on extended stays was great, and the breakfast was actually pretty good, with a decent selection of alternatives. Addditionally, the proximity to King Street (along with all of its entertainment and restaurant options), the Financial District, the sports arenas, and the harbourfront was exceptional. I have since stayed at this hotel for pleasure and it remains my hotel of choice when in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “suprisingly upscale, great location”
Reviews.Author: dbdbmv
Reviews.Content: stayed here for the Toronto Film Festival and was pleasantly surprised although expensive. Suspect the price may have been driven by the event. I had a huge room, well appointed, bright, recently deocrated, full kitchen, two person bath, more than comfortable. Good service and more than ok complimentary breakfast. Would definitely stay there again, within walking distance to many theaters, lots of small restaurants a few blocks away

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: dorothy0
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay in Toronto. It was very clean and comfortable. Breakfast was good in the morning with a very helpful staff. The hotel was only a couple blocks away from a subway statation, Union Station, and the CN Tower.

Reviews.Title: “We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: oboist
Reviews.Content: We've been to Toronto several times before but this was our first visit to the Marriott. We loved the location. Great for walking to lots of places downtown like the CN tower, the Eaton Centre and lots of restaurants. Our room was the Studio suite which we booked because we wanted a view of the CN tower. We were told via reservations that the King studio was the best room to book to get the view ... and did we get a view :-) !! Toronto was even kind enough to host a magnificant storm during our stay and we watched as the CN Tower was hit by lightening about 20 times. The room was a great size, in fantastic condition, with a comfortable bed, sitting area, dining table, desk and full kitchen. The bathroom was spotlessly clean and with nice towels. We had a perfectly adequate breakfast each morning (that included a hot breakfast that changed each day) and we didn't queue as we rose early enough to beat the crowds and line up's! We would definately return to this hotel. The only sad thing is that we weren't sent a followup email when we returned home so that we could give the hotel our feedback.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the Entertainment District”
Reviews.Author: swfguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Residence Inn the week of Sept. 12. I found the rooms to be quite nice with a small kitchen, dining table and sofa. There are grocery stores and an LCBO nearby if you need a few supplies. The hotel staff will also delivery groceries to you if you're too busy to go yourself. The hotel is one block off King Street with quick access to street cars and the subway. The staff is friendly and helpful. My room was on the top floor ( 22nd ) but the ground view was of an electrical substation on the side of the building. There was a nice view of the CN Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Meh...”
Reviews.Author: OverThereOverThere
Reviews.Content: Very clean. Good sized rooms for certain. Great views of CN Tower. Other than that...meh. Mediocre breakfast at best with lines to Siberia and beyond. Poorly designed lobby causes huge backup of people. During stay 1 of 3 elevators was out of commission, though at times it seemed like 2 of the 3 were not working. A 12 minute wait for the elevator to bring you down 12 floors. Longer wait to go up. Walls are pretty thin, can get noisy. Front desk was surly on occasion...concierge? I don't think so. You have a hankering for a late night soda pop? just head downstairs to the meager selection in the "hotel store" and be prepared to hand over your whole wallet. I stayed in a top of the line hotel in Vancouver and even they had a lousy vending machine down the hall and didn't cost you more than a lousy loonie! The icing on the cake of course was the 4 charges of 5 dollars each charge for attempting to make an international phone call. Dialing a number and having a recording almost immediately tell me the call could not go through each time evidently costs 5 bucks! Gee, i wonder why they wouldn't clearly state right there on the phone that simply initiating....no not even initiating...just attempting to initiate an international call will cost you 5 dollars right off the bat. I give this place 3 stars merely because of the cleanliness and even then, i am being very very generous.

Reviews.Title: “Mother-in-law RAVES about the breakfast.....”
Reviews.Author: AllyNYC1
Reviews.Content: This past August was my family's second visit to this hotel. My mother-in-law traveled with us both times, so we reserved a two-bedroom suite each time. The suite was HUGE with a full-sized and fully-equipped kitchen which is perfect for families. There was even a small dining area with a table for four -- perfect for dining in when we didn't want to eat out. Each bedroom has its own bathroom which is a true luxury. The complimentary breakfast buffet was my mother-in-law's favorite part of the visit. Great food, great service -- we all had a leisurely and satisfying breakfast before we embarked on our day. A few nights during the week, the hotel serves a complimentary small dinner based on a different cuisine each night. Although described as "small," the meal was actually filling! The hotel is located downtown and is easily accessible to the CN Tower, Rogers Center and many fine restaurants. The staff is friendly, helpful and accommodating. My daughter even got to enjoy the indoor pool a couple of times -- it is very child-friendly. We've had two wonderful experiences at this hotel and will return for a third time the next time we're in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_Beach_Baby
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last month and really liked the suites! Excellent for travelling families with infants! The fact that the suites include microwave and full size fridge made our stay very convenient. This hotel also offers free breakfast and free internet! But parking is very expensive---$35/nite!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location with well-appointed suites”
Reviews.Author: wjames5
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here, this time overnight en route to Chicago. It was convenient and comfortable during the 12 hours we were there, with a spacious room and a breakfast that gave all that we wanted. We got to view repeated lightening strikes to the CN Tower that evening fro our 22nd floor room during a spectacular storm. We enjoyed the stay and would return. Two (minor) gripes: 1. At breakfast one employee spent an extended time loudly complaining to a co-worker about a third co-worker. This went on in full hearing and view of customers in the breakfast room while they partially blocked access to the coffee. After a time the listening co-worker suggested they move to a more private location, this time partially blocking the exit. Found this conduct unprofessional and of course preventing customer service (presumably the reason they were there in the first place). 2. The doorman helped us into a waiting limo for the short ride to the Island Airport. We probably should have been offered a taxi as an alternative as a $7-8 ride became a $15 ride. That fixed rate is likely a good deal for many rides within the city, but not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: rc246
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfect on my recent trip to Toronto. The hotel is located in the downtown entertainment district and is a short walk to the CN Tower and the Bllue Jays/Bill stadium. Public transportation is close as well. The rooms were comfortable and spotless. The staff and valet were friendly and accommodating. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Justin W
Reviews.Content: Best place to stay in Toronto with access to all the city offers.

Reviews.Title: “"Best place to stay for Toronto Film Festival ", I told Mr. Marriott”
Reviews.Author: doctoryes
Reviews.Content: We flocked to Toronto last Sept along with thousands of other for the International Film Festival -- wanted a convenient place to stay downtown and preferred a suite or condo arrangement. This Marriott Residence Inn was fantastic. Of course, the location was perfect, and it was alsomwhat I assumed it would be -- really clean, first class (though not opulent); and all the dishes, appliances, kitchenware, etc. were in excellent condition. Great value as well. We shared with another couple -- relaxed in our living room in the evening. Staff was great. When I was leaving I complimented the manager and she asked me if I wanted to pass the good words on to "Mr. Marriott". Sure enough, a few minutes later some big, black cars rolled up; the legendary Bill Marriott got out to make a tour of one of his hotels. I did pay the compliment and he appreciated it. The big boss checks things out -- wow -- that's a pretty good start.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: hrmomx2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn for 5 nights this August with our two children. The hotel is located in a nice, quiet area near the CN Tower. The location provided easy walking access to the harborfront and other city attractions. This is a good property for people traveling with children who want to spread out a little. We had a one bedroom suite with a king bed and a sofa bed that was located in the living area. We also requested a rollaway for one of our children that we used in the living area (beware, there is a $25 additional charge for the rollaway which really irks me). The hotel is quite clean and fairly well maintained. However, we didn't love the bedding. Our king bed probably needed a new mattress and the sofa bed was very uncomfortable for our ten year old son so don't plan on having an adult sleep on it. It's one of those sofa beds that you can feel the springs popping through. I had to cover the mattress in 3 blankets to get him to sleep on it. The towels were of the quality that feel like sand paper. When I called the front desk to ask for additional towels (they left 3 small bath towels for 4 people) they actually asked me how many we already had in the room. I was pretty shocked. That happened several times when I had to keep calling down every day for additional towels. In general, the staff was fairly helpful and pleasant. A nice breakfast buffet is included with your room each morning which again makes this a good choice for families. There is a small pool which the kids enjoyed after a long day of touring the city. Overall, I would recommend this property for those who are not looking for frills or luxury of any kind.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: Mikko M
Reviews.Content: Over a period of 2 years I stayed at Residence Inn Downtown Toronto and being a frequent traveller, staying at various hotels, none of them rank anywhere near the experience that this hotel provides. Staff is amazing, friendly and will not take shortcuts to make sure your stay is as comfortable as possible. In particular hotel management who often in other properties are nearly unreachable, are always making their precence known by way of entertaining guests and assuring your needs are met. If you travel to Toronto, you should highly consider staying at this property not only due to it's location in downtown but also because of the staff who are by far the best in business!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home! A great place for a long stay in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: luckystravels
Reviews.Content: Was here on tour for a show and it was a happy surprise on a long tour. The atmosphere, pristine rooms, and super friendly staff made it feel like staying with friends in a comfy yet upscale hotel setting. The family food nights were a yummy and money-saving bonus and the bar staff was incredibly cool

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel & Staff in the city”
Reviews.Author: KMGD
Reviews.Content: Beautifully appointed suite & the staff is beyond polite & helpful. We would recommend this hotel to anyone coming into the city. Perfect location to see the best downtown attractions, restaurants etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fit the bill perfectly”
Reviews.Author: me3nisie
Reviews.Content: We needed a conveniently located, reasonably priced, clean and comfortable place to stay. This hotel did not disappoint us. Even though it was almost sold out the noise level wasn't a problem. However, I noticed there was a line at the breakfast area after 9 (food was fine, but if you want something else there's a diner that serves an excellent breakfast around the corner). Rooms were very roomy, clean, and up-to-date.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay for the price that we paid...”
Reviews.Author: volvoc70m
Reviews.Content: This is a brilliant hotel and for the price that we paid, its defintely more than worth it! The rooms were huge, we had a kitchen to ourselves, it was more like a studio apartment than anything else, bathroom were huge, just in front of CN towers, free wifi, water was provided free daily, breakfast was brilliant! I mean we are talking about bacon, eggs, beans, the usual and all freshly made, very very good. The airport shuttle was just a 5 min walk from us, which happened to be at the intercontinental hotel. Overall the hotel is brilliant for business people as the hotel is smack in the middle of the business district, for the price that it is, its defintely worth it and would come back here again to stay if i am in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious , cosy family rooms , great free breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: TerrieM4
Reviews.Content: Great location , walking to most attractions Rooms very spacious and clean , they have mini kitchen in it , great for families with children Hotel staf very nice & friendly , the barman whos there most of the time , has some great jaw dropping magic tricks , he does talk alot though but full of great advice Dont miss free breakfasts , there fab , just try miss the work 7.30-8.30 slots as its taken up by business people

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: zerokarma
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the other Courtyard Marriott on Yonge st but choose to try this place instead this time as it was closer to the event we needed to be and also I got a excellent rate for the night. This place is brand new, everything about it is very nice, the service at the lobby desk was very good and the rooms were excellent. We are able to check-in early with out any troubles and got a higher floor easily even though it was booked pretty solid for the night. We only stayed one night but this place would be great if you needed to stay a week or two as it has kitchens in the room, I believe that is the intended purpose of the hotel for longer stays but they still rent out daily. The included breakfast in the morning was ok, not great but not bad either. The only real thing I can complain about is the elevators in the morning, seemed like everyone was trying to leave at the same time in the morning and the elevators got jammed and took a while to pick people up. Other than that its a great location and the price is excellent for such a nice new place. I'll definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT OPTION FOR FAMILIES”
Reviews.Author: FIVEFAMILYFUN
Reviews.Content: We Stayed For Two Nights In A 2 Bedroom Suite - Great Set-Up For Family With Three Children. Very Large Living Space - Kitchen Area A Must Have To Avoid Paying For Many Expensive Meals. Hotel Breakfast Was Awesome - Staff Was Very Friendly. Pool And Hot Tub Were Clean And Great Way To Relax At The End Of The Day. Nice Workout Room. Hotel Is In A Great Location. Have Only Good Things To Say. This Hotel Was A Great Last Minute Find.

Reviews.Title: “Large suites, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: suzkal
Reviews.Content: We were able to check in fours hours prior to check-in time, and we received a room upgrade. We were on the 14th floor in a 2 bedroom suite. It was very spacious! The only downfall of the room was the lack of city views. Some rooms did have views of the CN Tower. We were very surprised by the variety and amount of food that was provided during the manager's reception. We stayed on a Monday night and it was salad night. There were enough different types of salads (lettuce, bean, pasta), bread, and sodas that we didn't need to spend money on dinner in the city. Breakfast also provided a variety of foods, but was a bit crowded. There was a hostess there to seat you. I think that helped with traffic. I wished we stayed in Toronto for more than one night so we could have enjoyed the hotel longer.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller5000
Reviews.Content: You truly feel like you're walking into an exclusive apartment home when you arrive at your guest room at Residence Inn (We can see where the name comes from). Suites were well equipped kitchen, separate living & dining area & a guest wash basin outside the ensuite would lend these rooms to entertaining. A short walk to the trams, metro and the main station, Toronto is at your doorstep. Several sights such as CN tower were moments away. The room was quiet & well appointed, the breakfast (included on our rate) was nice and the gym surprising for a hotel sport centre. Have already highly recommended it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: rpascoedes
Reviews.Content: The rooms are terrific - all are suites. Marriott beds are extremely comfortable, in my opinion! Given that we only stayed for 2 nights, we didn't make too much use of the kitchen. However, access to a refrigerator is always appreciated! Lots of variety at the complimentary buffet breakfast. Friendly staff and wonderful location. Wireless access in the rooms was included.

Reviews.Title: “It's good but don't understand the raves”
Reviews.Author: LMC55
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 4 night stay. We liked the hotel but are surprised that it's rated #1. It's in a good location and our room had a nice view of the CN Tower. However, the only area of excellence is housekeeping; our room was kept spotless all week. Everything else was just OK. The water pressure in the shower was inconsistent and went off completely a couple of times. The outrageous charge of $35 per day for parking helped us to decide to use public transportation in lieu of car rental (which worked out fine but be prepared for a combination of walking, subway and streetcar). We thought the breakfast buffet was weak overall (runny eggs, bland potatoes, no pancakes or waffles, and not enough tables). I'd rather pay for a higher quality breakfast. Recommended overall but not as highly as most in this forum.

Reviews.Title: “It is as good as the reviews say it is”
Reviews.Author: HarpendenSmiths
Reviews.Content: We had read the reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We had a two bedroom suite which was very spacious and comfortable. The rooms were spotlessly clean. The real icing on the cake was the complementary breakfast which was excellent. If you are staying in Downtown Toronto we would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly, Very Clean, Very Convenient!”
Reviews.Author: coolseb
Reviews.Content: We had an extremely comfortable and happy stay at the Residence Inn in downtown Toronto. The staff were all overly and sincerely helpful with every need that my family had during our 3-night stay. We were pleasantly surprised to receive a room upgrade and a complimentary roll-away bed upon our check-in to help ensure a hassle-free vacation with our two teenagers. The suite was immaculate and had every amenity that a family of four might need...full fridge, microwave, complete set of dishes, pots, pans, and utensils, two televisions, sleep sofa, plenty of seating and free internet! Each morning we were treated to a very civilized breakfast (hostess seating) with amazing fresh fruit salad, eggs, breakfast meats, oatmeal, baked goods, juices, tea, and coffee and one evening we enjoyed a manager's reception with hot foods, snacks, and soda. The hotel's concierge offered us great advice for sights and meals, listening to our interests and steering us in the perfect direction. The location is absolutely wonderful, allowing us to park our car in the hotel's garage and use foot-power for the duration of our stay. We highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Love ti...the perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: swissteamHamden
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spacious, The hot breakfast buffet was terrific.The staff was terrific.. from the desk to housekeeping to the restaurant,. I had some special room needs and there were on top of everything.The best part was the entire hotel. The worst part was leaving. I'm a frequent traveler and it would be my only choice in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: GettinErDun
Reviews.Content: Me and the wife stayed here for one night for the U2 concert. Hotel could not have been more convenient, literally 5 min or less walk from the Rogers Centre. The room was spacious and the bed comfortable. The bathroom DID leave a little to be desired, but nothing really wrong with it (Just wanted a bit more luxury). Kitchen and fridge were great. If we had to stay in Toronto again for a few days, I'd be back for sure. Valet BTW was fast a friendly, and hardly more than trying to find parkling for less yourself ... do yourself a favour, get a package that includes it! Oh and the buffet was actually AWESOME! There was no place to sit in the diing room mind you as it was packed, but we stole a tray that held the coffee cups, loaded it up and ate like a king and queen back in the comfort our our own room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. I would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: risteard
Reviews.Content: Close to everything. Lovely breakfast, nice staff, nice lobby bar.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: NewcastleHappyGuest
Reviews.Content: The staff here were outstanding friendly and helpful .good welcome and send off took a hotel car/limo to hotel .breakfast is very busy tho...the rooms are immaculate and bathroom and kitchen are very good .. ideal for a city break .. very central to shopping and entertainment ... the concierge service they provide in the lobby is excellent the young lady had all the information to hand.. and discounted tickets for the Tower. book a dayout to the falls on a saturday if you can ... we were told its much quieter.. only waited about 10 mins to go on the maid of the mist .... wow .. awesome. can get a tour bus 2 mins from hotel recommended to get a feel of the differnt quarters before embarking on foot in the heat of summer...5mins walk to Blue Jays ( amazing cheap supermarket across the road ) stadium... just buy one of the cheaper tickets on the higher tiers unless you are a real fan cos the tickets can be very expensive a really good break made better with a comfortable welcoming and friendly base to come back to .... oh and there was FREE food some evenings!!! a little bit of a free for all scramble but what-du-expect

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service great location”
Reviews.Author: weliketofly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while this hotel was packed and the weather was scorching hot. Despite this, they were extremely quick and edi corny with the car, bags and checkout. The breakfast is superb and the whole hotel is clean and well maintained. Not a bad price either! Great location for Toronto. I would say the could use more seating in breakfast area, and elevators are sometimes a bit slow. But overall value is fantastic, and the quality of staff attentiveness was the best I have ever seen at any hotel including many "luxury" hotels We have stayed at

Reviews.Title: “One unexpected charge can change your entire perspective”
Reviews.Author: travelsome1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and centrally located. We stayed during the summer season and so it was very crowded. Therefore, there was frequently a wait for a table at breakfast during peak times and for the evening reception, I saw quite a few tables with one member from each party staking out their claim of a table by sitting there while the others stood in line for the food. But this was a small sacrifice for a very nice breakfast and evening reception. Parking was rather expensive at $35 per night. It was relatively easy to find someplace nearby that was cheaper, but the there were two advantages to the higher price -- valet parking and in/out privileges, so there was one $35 fee no matter how many times you used your vehicle. If you do not plan to use your vehicle for the time you are there, it might be cheaper to shop around. Having stayed in quite a few Marriott Residence Inns, this hotel was comparable to the others -- nice staff, clean, and good service.
