The pool was clean, but since it was summer, it occasionally did get crowded. The fitness center had good equipment and was also kept clean and the equipment worked well. The free internet was easy to use and worked well. I did however leave there on a sour note when we received our bill. Since we were from the U.S., we opted to use a phone card instead of paying roaming charges on our cell phones. We were shocked to find out that there is a $1.50 charge per phone call, even for local calls to a phone card number. Unfortunately for us, we made many calls home over the course of a week for a variety of reasons. Charging for local phone calls seemed to be quite a contrast to free internet. We stayed at two other Residence Inns in Canada over the past year. The previous one did not charge for local calls. After leaving this hotel we stayed at another Residence Inn in Niagara Falls and saw that they charged $2.00 per call. Although this amounted to a relatively small charge relative to the total bill for our room and parking, we definitely left feeling taken and this one experience shifted our entire perspective of what would have been just another good stay at a Marriott Residence Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted!”
Reviews.Author: lilmissgiggles1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the residence inn over a weekend. After a Long drive from chicago we were assigned a room on a high floor as requested with a lovely view of the cn tower! The hotel is in the perfect spot for exploring the surrounding area and has lots of pubs and restaurants in close vicinity also! Book it, you won't be dissapointed :)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Hamster_Huey_11
Reviews.Content: We've traveled a lot recently and stayed in both lower end hotels and higher end ones -- this is without doubt one of the best hotels I've stayed at for the price point. Super clean spacious rooms, kitchenette with large fridge, and ultra comfy bed. Wow, super! The entire hotel is clearly very well maintained. In comparison, there are a lot of hotels out there, such as the Congress Plaza in Chicago, which carry a similar price tag and which look nice in photos, but once you arrive you realize the building is much more dated and poorly maintained than the photos suggest. Not so with the Residence Inn, it looks better in person even than in photos. Excellent service, and quite a good complimentary breakfast I must say! All in all, would absolutely stay in again, no questions asked.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to stay longer...”
Reviews.Author: pgo
Reviews.Content: Great place! It's on a street with a mix of business and residential, within walking distance of the CN tower and the entertainment and financial districts. The breakfast was good and efficiently run, despite a crowd of families and others visiting on the weekend. The room (a king suite) was more than spacious. Would recommend to anyone looking for the usual Residence Inn setup. IME, this is one of the nicest in the chain. Tip - eat at BLD, a bit of walk, but you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way.”
Reviews.Author: tbajardi
Reviews.Content: This newer hotel is right in the thick of things. We walked to the Skydome, CN Tower and to some great restayrants and bars. The service was incredible and breakfast and light dinner was included. Bishop the bartender was a great ambassador for Toronto and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best!”
Reviews.Author: LauraGooner
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel regularly since May 2009. What makes this a great hotel? Rooms are spacious, make it easy to relax, modern and very comfortable beds! The people! The staff at this hotel are among the happiest I have experienced - and I travel for my job on a regular basis. To prove my point - in the 2+ years I have been staying at this hotel, they still have the same staff...this is very rare in the services industry - so kudos to the management team. This Residence Inn has a very nice bar where you can sit, relax, watch tv - and meet interesting people. I have had the pleasure of making many new friends here. A big thank you to all the staff for treating me like one of the family. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, friendly well trained staff!”
Reviews.Author: kkrm1104
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at this property and overall very happy. Great location to the CN tower, Rogers stadium and eateries. Our main criticisms but not sure Marriott could change at this point is the Lobby is too small for hotel, the concierge needs a proper spot (wedged in between the bathrooms on main floor does not work) and the elevators are not enough for the size of the hotel as well as the doors close too fast on people. ( we are thinking elderly, disabled and small children are going to get hurt at some point.). Great city though, staff is super friendly and the room was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and well located”
Reviews.Author: Twogreynomads
Reviews.Content: A fresh, modern studio room with kitchenette was perfect for our overnight stay. Staff was very courteous, mannered and friendly. Breakfast was a little crowded with a wait for a table but buffet offered something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: sdufdl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite--it was huge. The size of an apartment. Plenty of room for us the kids. Decent continental breakfast, but sometimes hard to find a seat, so come early. light dinner provided Mon-Wed. The service was very friendly. Valet service was quick, but it is the only option for onsite parking. very pleased with my stay. free wireless. Adequate pool and hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Spacious Room”
Reviews.Author: Flackie
Reviews.Content: Location very good for sightseeing, 5 min walk to CN Tower and restaurants within 10 mins. Staff were friendly and room was clean and spacious. We had a lovely view of the CN Tower from our room. Breakfast buffet was good with plenty of choice from fruit, and cereals to hot food, waffles and muffins. Breakfast room gets busy so best to be there by 8.30ish.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Rekyes
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Residence Inn for a 5 day vacation and was pleasantly surprised by the location of the hotel. Centrally located, we walked to the Phillies/ Blue Jays game, the CN Tower, the Theater District and Kensington Market, we never needed public transportation, though there was plenty. Our most pleasant surprise, however, was the exceptional assistance provided by Ms. Charlene Dong. Approxamately 6 days prior to our arrival I called the hotel and asked to speak to the concierge and was told there was none, but Charlene asked how she could help. I explained that we needed dinner reservations at the CN Tower for 5, 3 tickets to see Billy Elliot and arrangements for a day trip to Niagara Falls for 5. In less than 24 hours she had arranged everything. Charlene did all of this for us while working the front desk assisting onsite customers. The theater tickets were fabulous, and the Niagara Falls trip, hosted by Hassan, was delightful. Should we plan a trip to Toronto again we would happily stay at this hotel. The room (#414) was immaculately clean and spacious. Thank you for a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION, GOOD ROOM, GOOD SERVICE = GOOD CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: PMATT914
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were visiting Toronto for 4 days of sightseeing. Not being familiar with the city, naturally I wanted a hotel that would be convenient as well as comfortable. Using the Trip Advisor reviews here coupled with having used Residence Inns before, we chose this one. Proved to be a good choice. The hotel's location worked out to be a very practical "base" for our sightseeing. We visited various attractions in different locations around the city. Some, such as the CN Tower, were eaily "walk-able". Some we drove to. That was easily done since this hotel is 1 block way from a major north-south street, parallel to some major east-west ones and close to the expressway. We also used a taxi one night and a "hop on/hop off" bus. As for the comments in other reviews here on the cost of parking, yes, it is expensive. But in that, Toronto is no different from other major cities, so it did not shock me. The parking here was "in and out" meaning you pay the daily rate but could take your car in an out as needed which is what we did. The valets were friendly and efficient. Because the hotel is just up the street from the stadium, there are public lots in the adjacent blocks. But should you consider them, keep in mind whether or not there is a home game being played or the few dollars you save may cost you in lost time getting acess to your car. We booked a one King bedroom and at check in, were given a choice of floors. We opted for a top floor corner room. The room was nicely furnished and I especially appreciated that the sitting room furniture had been chosen for the comfort and convenience of us guests, not just the convenience of the hotel. Where that made a noticeable difference was at the start and end of our days. It was really nice at the end of the evening to be able to come back to the room and sit and relax in comfort in a nice setting versus having to choose between flopping on the bed or using a hard back desk chair. Likewise, my wife and I normally keep different morning schedules. And whereas she pops out of bed in the morning like a piece of toast, I start up are more like an old car on a winter's day. So we took advantage of the sitting room and the daily free breakfast buffet by her bringing a selection to our room where I, not having had to make myself presentable for public viewing, was able to sit and enjoy her company over coffee, etc. Then to her added delight, we just left the dirty dishes in the sink and voila! Housekeeping took care of the rest! The front desk staff could not have been more helpful to us in making our visit a pleasure. They gave us concierge type assistance in "sequencing" what we saw each day based on what was close to what and when each was open. They were especially helpful with practical advice on the best ways to get around town; not just directions but whether it was easier to drive or take a cab. For the former, they looked up the nearest parking (enormously helpful to an out of town visitor!) and for the latter, what the fare would be. Let me note that this was not just one person but a dfferent staff member each day. All in all, we felt like this Residence Inn contributed a good dealto our having an enjoyable stay in Toronto. So that made it a good deal in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel. Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: cdnhart
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel in a great location. Easy access to major attractions, venues (CN Tower, Rogers Center) and restaurants. Breakfast is plentiful, service excellent and manager's reception on Tues/ Wed's are a pleasant surprise. It lacks a proper concierge but the valet and front desk staff are very helpful. Despite the $35 Valet fee, the convenience was well worth it. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite which was perfect for our family stay as the bedrooms are separate and each had their own bathroom. The full kitchen and pool area were great features too. You will not go wrong by booking this hotel for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Third Time's a Charm”
Reviews.Author: djraiche
Reviews.Content: This was our third time at this hotel. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are so nice and comfortable. The breakfast, which is included, is always good with lots of choices. We stayed in room 514 which had a kitchen, living room, two bathrooms and two bedrooms, each with a king sized bed and their own flatscreen t.v. I must say that this hotel, in my opinion, has the best staff ever. They always acknowledge you when walking by, either with a nod or a hello. The valet people open the door for you when they can. The front desk staff is always helpful and polite. They never seem to be annoyed by the guests' questions and are kind and patient towards them. It is always a pleasure to stay here. This is the only hotel in Toronto for me. Keep up the great work! I can't wait to go back to Toronto and stay here again. Also, the housekeeping staff is amazing and very well trained. Obviously, very hard workers, as everything is spotless, including the hallways and elevators.

Reviews.Title: “All in All, a really nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jreilly2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the Canada Day - 4th of July weekend. Room was well appointed and clean. Hotel is well located for the Rogers Centre and CN Tower and near grocery stores if you need to fill the refrigerator for the family. Only minor criticism is the small area for morning breakfast - gets crowded and stays crowded if you don't get there early. Staff seemed a bit frazzled at trying to keep up. Oly other incident was one of the elevators going out of service on Sunday - since the hotel has 23 floors, it got to be a bit of a problem, especially at check-out on Monday morning. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good--but can't say it is #1”
Reviews.Author: servicecomesfirst
Reviews.Content: I regularly travel to Toronto on business and am always looking for a good hotel in the downtown core. I decided to try the Marriott this week based on the very positive reviews at TA. I am guessing the building was not a hotel originally, as there is no driveway like you find in other hotels. I pulled up to the curb and no doorman was in sight. Not a major issue, but it forced me to walk inside to the front desk and wait in line, only to be told to go back outside and wait for the valet parking guy to appear. I prefer to always park my car myself, but valet parking is the only option, and $35 a day is a rip-off! Plus, the guy was not very friendly. So, my first impressions were not that good. I didn't find the lobby very inviting -- lots of dark wood and it consists of a very narrow hallway in front of the main desk. Once on my floor, the decor was brighter and much warmer. As other reviewers have noted, the rooms are large and very clean, and the beds/pillows are very comfortable. The front desk and dining room staff were friendly. All in all, an OK stay, but, again, I don't think this is the number one hotel in Toronto. I am guessing the main reason for the high rating is the free breakfast. Most of the guests appeared to be families on vacation, and they would be saving a lot of money by not having to pay for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay! Just costly.”
Reviews.Author: surfergirl84
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Clean and nice rooms. Bed is comfortable. A nice bonus is the free wifi and the continental breakfast in the mornings. The kitchenette has everything you might need for longer stays and you want to make a few meals. The location is great.. Walking distance from the CN tower, Rogers centre, restaurants and shopping centers. There were a few times where the front desk was so busy that certain things were neglected or forgotten. For example, we phoned down to the valet to get our car, and when we got downstairs, the valet was not alerted. Or there was some dry cleaning dropped off- they never delivered it and we had to phone down to find out where it was. Otherwise, the staff was very friendly and welcoming. I found the rates quite expensive but that's what you get for downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal downtown location for leisure and business”
Reviews.Author: Kendoerr
Reviews.Content: Big rooms but an intimate ambience make this a unique hotel. Location is superb as you can walk to just about anywhere in the city centre, CN Tower or the lakeside. There are some building activities directly next to the hotel where a new block is going up but this did not affect our stay one bit. Parking is available with the hotel but there are plenty of other, cheaper, options all around. The breakfast dining is very homely and even though you may have in room cooking it is very convenient to grab a breakfast and walk with it or take back to the room. Gym and pool facility is very serviceable. All the staff were very pleasant and attentive from reception to room service.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds Marriott standards!”
Reviews.Author: Gundi
Reviews.Content: Residence Inn by Marriott as a brand consists of nice properties, with good amenities and perks such as free internet, breakfast, etc. This hotel in the entertainment district of Toronto exceeds the usual standard in many ways. The Residence Inn is a relatively new building located close to shopping, theatre, galleries and great restaurants. The suites vary in size and configuration, but each features a kitchen area, sitting area and flat-screen tv's. This is standard Residence Inn -- this hotel as new, contemporary furnishings and large windows looking out over the city. Beds are comfy and the room was blissfully quiet despite being in the heart of the city. What really sets this particular hotel apart is the service. Every employee greated me and wished me a nice day. Valey was prompt and courteous, even greeting me when I came back to the hotel from dinner. Breakfast was complimentary but excellent, including wonderful scrambled eggs, scrumptious potatoes -- with toppings, toast, waffles, fruit, yogurt, etc. etc. I travel to Toronto frqequently on business and often get to stay in some very nice hotels, this Residence Inn competes successfully with much higher rated estabishments.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located and Well Appointed”
Reviews.Author: RickNP
Reviews.Content: My early arrival into Toronto allowed me to use public transportation from the airport. The Residence Inn is only a few short blocks from the nearest trolley stop and I thus showed up at the front desk only a few minutes past noon. Needless to say, I was more than pleased to be told they could get me into my room right away, and, within a half hour, I was enjoying an excellent lunch in the Entertainment District. The primary purpose for my trip was to attend baseball games at the Rogers Centre, and that too was only a few short blocks from the hotel. The next evening, I decided I wanted to eat Chinese food, and Chinatown was an easy ten minute stroll. There is little I can add to what others have said about the facility and staff other than to affirm it. (One nitpick is that I could not get the icemaker in my refrigerator to work, but, then again, I didn't feel the need to bring that to the staff's attention.) I'll be in Toronto again, and will make the Residence Inn my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tazzaha
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderfull! The room was nice and big, great shower, free wifi and complimentary breakfast. The location was excellent, our room had a beautifull view at the CN tower, and the staff was so friendly!! I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “some rooms don't have any views.”
Reviews.Author: StarwoodBoo
Reviews.Content: I was given a room with views of walls from another building (like 2 feet apart), so no view at all.. Noise coming from hallway can be heard from the room sometimes because the hallway is quite narrow. Room is clean and modern for family with kids, maybe too large for solo traveler (a feeling of emptiness).

Reviews.Title: “It pays to be a Marriot member!”
Reviews.Author: LovingSunandSand
Reviews.Content: When we check into this hotel, we were pleasantly surprised when we were told that they were giving us a free upgrade to a 2 bedroom room for being a Marriot member. It was just my partner and I and we were amazed when we walked into our room to find the main bedroom with a bathroom and tv, a large living room area and kitchen, and then another bedroom just steps away with its own bathroom! It was bigger than my apartment. I was wondering how we could rent the second bedroom?! I did appreciate the second bathroom though so we wouldn't be fighting over the shower and sink space. Everything was clean and I appreciated the free microwave popcorn too! The breakfast buffet was wonderful with lots of options. The only issue is it can get busy and limited seating available as with most hotels offering this option. The location was very convenient to walk downtown, to CN Tower, and the train station. Great hotel and I would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A lot of space to bring my family next time!”
Reviews.Author: nukefluke1
Reviews.Content: The one bedroom room was amazing and i would definitely return to this hotel for a family stay. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay - but don't pay for parking with the hotel”
Reviews.Author: paddling_kiki
Reviews.Content: Great stay in a beautiful hotel. They let us check in at 10am, and upgraded us to a two bedroom suite free of charge! The beds were extremely comfortable, and the location was within walking distance to restaurants. We were in town for a competition so seeing the sights wasn't high on our list of priorities. That being said, we went for a 10km paddle with Outrigger Performance Advantage around Toronto Harbour - it was wonderful! My only piece of advise is not to bother paying for valet parking with the hotel. There are plenty of outdoor and underground lots around the hotel that charge significantly less.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Consultantgal
Reviews.Content: This is everything you'd expect from a Residence Inn - nice room, very clean, comfortable, great kitchenette etc...... It even had extra interesting furniture - very modern with unique shapes. The staff and the location make this an above average choice for a place to stay in Tornoto. You are steps away from all the major theaters and terrific dinning. We really enjoyed our stay and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: netgeek
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to get this hotel through Priceline and got a great deal. We arrived at the hotel around 1:30PM and were greeted by very friendly staff. We were promptly given a room on the 22nd floor. The Room: One word... FANTASTIC. It was spacious, clean, modern and very functional. It has a full kitchen (well everything minus an oven). It even comes with plates/cutlery and a dishwasher! Wow. All the appliances/kitchen area were kept in a great condition. Our room had a queen bed and a pull out couch. A nice big LCD TV. Clean bathroom. Awesome view of the Toronto skyline! Perks: Free breakfast buffet and free internet!!! Staff: Friendly and willing to go the extra mile. Parking: Valet parking for $35 (a bit steep, but i understand the price given the area) Just wow!! Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, spacious room and great location”
Reviews.Author: shpap
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights while visiting our son who is working in Toronto. The hotel is in a great location -- we walked lots of places plus took cabs to further away places. Hotel staff were very friendly. The buffet breakfast was great and one morning we took food up to our room for a more relaxing meal. There also was some nearby street parking for our son when he came to visit for an hour or so since valet parking was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “If you are visiting Toronto - this hotel is fantastic”
Reviews.Author: markdgoddard
Reviews.Content: We have just completed a 9 day visit to Toronto. We picked this hotel based on the other reviews and it was as good as every one said. The location, the rooms and the staff were top notch, and nothing was too much trouble. The staff were able to recommend some of the better things to do and our trip to niagara using BEST tours was absolutely fantastic. Don't waste money on 5 star hotels as you will definitely get the 5 star treatment if you staff here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FLYDL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night while visiting Toronto for our son's birthday. Hotel is clean and in a perfect location for a Blue Jay's or Leafs game. CN Tower is right across the street. Hockey Hall of Fame a few easy walking blocks away. Area is clean and safe. Plenty of tourists walking around. The only negative is the hotel only has valet parking at a cost of 35 dollars a day.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive room, great location”
Reviews.Author: TJandTR
Reviews.Content: The open floor plan of the basic king with kitchen was ideal for our 3-night stay. Facilities were very clean and well maintained. Our room was beautifully decorated, efficient, comfortable and roomy. Thoughtful details like a shelf over the dining table made the room feel homey. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Chuck539
Reviews.Content: Not what you typically think of when you hear Residence Inn, this chic high rise in the middle of the Entertainment District had it all: large, well-appointed, comfortable rooms, excellent service and a location one block from the CN Tower that had me right in the middle of everything. Whether it was a ballgame, great restaurants, shopping district, heading to the conference or a movie - this hotel was always just a few blocks from it. It was the perfect downtown hotel for me.

Reviews.Title: “So glad I looked this hotel up. All of the reviews were right!”
Reviews.Author: Ferno78
Reviews.Content: This hotel was incredible value. All if the great reviews were right. This hotel really is this good!! Be sure to book here, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Liz92
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in an excellent position for the Rogers centre, CN Tower, Steam Whistle Brewery and the Harbourside. Only a short walk to enter the PATH System. Across the road was a Starbucks and just around the corner was several Food shops and Subway store. Concerning the hotel my husband and I booked a 1 bedroom suite. The suite was immaculate and after a few teething problems with the air conditioning which was sorted very quickly we had a very enjoyable stay. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and a special mention must go to Me An Vera Fudge and Renee Delavigne at the friont desk who went out of their way to make our stay the best possible. Only one point to mention concerning Niagara Falls tours paying with a credit card beware of hidden extras.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sherman26
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel during half term last October..(apols for the late review). What a fantastic hotel...staff are excellent (both helpfull prior to our arrival and during our stay)....It seems nothing is too much trouble for them..breakfast was included in the price and was of excellent choice and quality and there were also social evenings where hot food was available (a nice touch if you are with a large family)....Location is great...just round the corner from the CN tower and also the Rogers Center...Rooms are clean and spacious and WIFI is included which is great when you are booking excursions that you see when you are in Toronto..If you dont want to take a laptop, there is a business center which allows you to access internet free of charge..Having a pool area is a great bonus for an inner city hotel and the fact its indoors is even better (if you visit in October like we did)......The hotel and its staff thoroughly deserve its number 1 rating (at the time of writing).....A GREAT PLACE TO STAY !

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in the Entertainment District”
Reviews.Author: WorldExec
Reviews.Content: First I am now a long term stayer at this particular hotel assigned by my employer. As a business traveller, the hotel has all the amenities I need. The only drawback is that it is not on the PATH and my office is in the financial district not the entertainment district! It is short walking distance to all the attractions (Rogers Centre, CN Tower, many theatres, Roy Thompson Hall, and lots of restaurants). There are early week "socials" for the guests including free food and non-alcoholic beverages. The rooms are large, clean and well appointed and suitable for longer stays. I have stayed in the two-bedroom suite and it would be extremely suitable for a family, with a full kitchen, large central area as well as two full bedrooms with ensuite baths. Other than that it is a standard Residence Inn with all the same amenities as one would expect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - friendly and competent service, nice location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Polarbecks
Reviews.Content: Almost everything about this hotel was perfect - excellent, well equipped and spacious rooms; very friendly and competent staff and a good location. Perfect for families. Our only complaint, is that we were located close to the elevators and the housekeeping station - this could get noisy at times particularly when we were trying to get our toddler to take an afternoon nap. This is a broader issue with the Marriott system however, the account preferences allow you to specify "near an elevator", but not "away from an elevator" - will remember to ask in the future.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Richard3150
Reviews.Content: This is one excellent hotel. The room was very spacious with a fully functioning kitchen . It was very comfortable and quite. Good breakfast and different evening events including such things as pasta nights to be enjoyed by the fire. Don't forget to have a drink at the bar and meet the very amusing and energetic person, Randolf, who runs the bar. The hotel itself is well located in the entertainment area of Toronto. The first night we thought we made a mistake as it seemed so quiet and out of the way but we walked around the corner and there it all is. Just great. Free wifi is all just part of a great deal. As for the staff, well how friendly and super helpful they all were. Could not have been better. A number of much more expensive hotels could take a good lesson from this place. This place is highly recommended for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: sandpiperII
Reviews.Content: We live in Buffalo, New York and had reservations to fly out of Toronto to Mexico. We decided to make the vacation last longer so we went up to Toronto two days before our scheduled flight out. What an awesome hotel! Sort of "off the beaten path". Having directions directly to the hotel helped. We were eight adults and a one year old. We had reserved two one bedroom suites. We simply asked and one of the rooms was upgraded to a two bedroom suite. If you had to, you could comfortably live at the hotel. Staff was awesome - could not do enough. Rooms had every convience and we so pretty. Three flat screen televisions in the two bedroom suite. Terrific lighting and was nice to have a microwave and refrigerator. Poor area was very nice. Breakfast in the morning was very good. Lots of selections. Everything was very clean and nicely decorated. Bravo Marriott! From the hotel we sort of "toured" the city. Went to the Saint Lawrence Market. Amazing - well organized city. Had a terrific time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and service”
Reviews.Author: milchek
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights during our Toronto visit and were extremely happy with the location and high level of service. There is complimentary high speed wifi, breakfast, a gym, pool, business centre and all the usual trimmings. We had a suite which was excellent for a longer stay, as it had a full kitchen and living area. Location was perfect for us, walking distance to the CN Tower, Yonge and Dundas, and harbor front (ferry to Toronto Island). Highly recommended and would stay here again without question.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for those with young families”
Reviews.Author: Prairiegirl075
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn for 6 days with our 2 children and my parents. We booked two rooms (one a studio, the other a suite - actually my husband and I were bumped up to a suite at no extra cost) and both were outstanding. We especially loved the fully-equipped kitchenettes and the roomy seating areas, and modern decor. It felt like a home away from home and gave the kids lots of room to play. The rooms were also very clean and well designed. The hotel also included numerous little touches like in-room safes, complimentary beverages and appetizers on certain nights in the lounge, complimentary breakfast and valet parking (at daily rate). They also even offer a grocery shopping service at no additional charge! The location of the hotel was also very convenient. We were in Toronto for a convention at the Metro Convention Centre (only a block away) and for pleasure, so we were close to many of Toronto's prominent attractions. The staff were also all very friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again. The only issue we had is with the Wi Fi service. My husband needed to do some work and kept dropping his connection, repeatedly. We're certain it was not the computer as we could not keep the connection on our 2 other wireless devices.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, Very Friendly, and Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Durango4x4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending a conference. It is only two blocks to the convention center and the area was very safe. The rooms were very clean and like all residence inns, a lot nicer for a long stay. They will also exchange your currency for you at the front desk. Also, the morning free breakfast is among the best I have ever experienced for free at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Clean Family Hotel in the Heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: jcs20
Reviews.Content: Large suites - with full kitchen - huge plus when traveling with small children. Great hot breakfast buffett included, very friendly staff. Hotel and our room were spotless. Walking distance to major attractions - Rogers Centre, CN Tower, Sony Centre. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: smithclan72
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during March break and loved it. It was clean and the staff was very helpful. The room had a full kitchen and lots of space. We had a studio king with a pullout for the kids. We even had a view of the CN Tower. The pool was small but the hot tub was nice and actually the temperature of a hot instead of the usual tepid bubbly water. Breakfast in the morning was excellent. We booked through a pakage that gave us a $25 gas card and free valet parking ($35 usually) we were able to check in early at 11:30 on Friday, parked our car and kept it until 2pm Saturday for the same free rate. There were in/out privileges but with everything within walking distance there was no need to get the car.

Reviews.Title: “Valet Damaged my car and denied it”
Reviews.Author: Sniper_11
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel on a Friday night and used the valet parking (as there is no self park available) and it became a two month ordeal. that Friday night there happened to be a murder out front of the hotel to start my stay there off just right. When I get my car back on the Sunday morning my friend was standing outside the car having a smoke before we were leaving and noticed the paint missing on the drivers side bumper. When I got out and confronted the valet (the same valet that parked it the Friday night) he tried to deny it and was trying to tell me that it was old damage. I then got a manager from inside and they took pictures and then he tried to bring over a valet card to try to show that the damage was there when I brought it in (still denying that he did it). I was in contact with the front office manager the following day and she took until Thursday that week to review the tapes and determine that he did it and then she gave me the run around for 2 months trying to screw me over the whole way. She had me get 3 quotes and was only going to pay for the least expensive one and wasn't going to cover a rental car for me and I had to pay for it up front and then they would send me a check in about 2 weeks. Well I sent her the invoice about a week after she determined it was their fault and she conveniently didn't get it. So I emailed it to her (including rental car) before Christmas and when I finally got a hold of her she was questioning the rental car and replacing the headlight (which showed on all 3 quotes) but then said that they would send out a cheque on Jan 4,2011 and that it would take up to 2 weeks. Two weeks later i called her and told her that if the Cheque wasn't there by the Monday that i was going another route. When she called me back she told me they had sent it out on the 7th but she would have them cancel that one and reissue a new one and ship it over night. They never did send out a cheque at the beginning of January and cheque that was supposed to be overnight got there 4 days later. Don't believe anything they tell you there.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay - and close to nearly everything in the downtown area”
Reviews.Author: Generic90
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property during a long weekend in Toronto. Having not been to the city before, I chose this property based on brand (I am a Platinum Elite member), reviews of it and other properties, and - based completely on a guess - location in relation to area attractions. A minor point to note right up front: the pictures of the building exterior's on both the Marriott site and here are nothing like the actual building. Not that it means anything in the grand scheme of things, but I was mildly disoriented when I first arrived since the picture didn't jibe with reality. The lobby is surprisingly small, a bit worn and dirty due what I can only surmise to be a combination of high traffic and the winter weather, and not very brightly lit. It exudes a feeling of the facility being much older than it might be. The elevators also were worn, and - depending on which one you rode - were sort of slow. Check in was quick and efficient, although the front desk staff seemed less than friendly and very hard to understand. Throughout the stay, the front desk staff I encountered mumbled, or spoke in broken English, or some combination of the two. The "Market" commonplace to most Marriott properties was just inside the main entry doors, next to the front desk. It seemed well-stocked, but with a small grocery store less than a half-block away, it was easier - and cheaper - to walk down there to stock up. There was a bar area opposite the "Market", though - despite the promotions on TV - I never saw it open for evening social hours. Adjacent to it was the breakfast area. I cannot comment on the breakfasts, as - due to the frequency of my stays in Marriott properties for work - I largely ate off-site for variety's sake. As for the room itself, I had a corner studio room with a king bed on the 15th floor, with a view facing east towards the CBC Broadcast Centre a block away. The room was the best part of the entire stay. It looked and felt new, and was quite a dramatic difference from what you experienced walking into the lobby. Lighting was more than adequate throughout the room. Everything from fixtures to appliances was clean and in good working order. There was a large-screen TV on a console/dresser that divided the living and bedroom area, which could be rotated around easily to wherever you were viewing from. The bathroom and vanity area was spacious with everything in a functional place. The bed was well-appointed and extremely comfortable. Free internet access was available via both wired and wireless means. If there was a negative with the room, it is that the walls - particularly closest to the hallway - were thin, so noise from there easily carried into the room. Fortunately, the noise was not constant, though if a guest or housekeeping let a door slam, it sounded as if they did it right in your room. I did not use any of the other facilities at this property during my stay, so cannot comment on their quality. Customer service on this stay was mixed and overall could be best described as "unremarkable". I am typically more sensitive to customer service anyway, but given the frequency with which I stay at Marriott properties for both work and leisure, I have come to expect a certain standard. I already referenced the front desk staff, which was average. The housekeeping staff was very friendly. An especially nice touch came on the first full day of my stay there, after I left the "no service" sign on my door. I returned later in the day to have a very pleasant voicemail message on the phone from the housekeeping supervisor saying that although I didn't request their service that day, I could feel free to contact them if I needed fresh towels, bedding, or any "touch-up" service in the suite. The concierge staff was also mixed in terms of customer service; the ones present when I checked in and checked out were quite friendly, responsive, and courteous. The ones present during the rest of my stay seemed to barely acknowledge anyone coming in or out of the hotel; on my last night there, I actually saw one a couple doors down from the hotel grabbing a quick smoke. In terms of location, I could not have chosen a better facility for this travel. My primary reasons for visiting Toronto were to attend a show taping at the CBC Broadcast Centre, which - as already mentioned - was a block away. I also had a ticket to see a performance at Second City, which is roughly two blocks away, next to Gretzky's Restaurant (a great place for dinner or socializing). The CN Tower and Rogers Centre were a short, easy walk (definitely under 10 minutes by foot). Other downtown attractions were an easy walk for those who are up for it. Otherwise, cabs are very plentiful, and the nearest Metro (subway) station is about 2-3 blocks away from the hotel, which will get you throughout downtown and to other attractions just out of the downtown core. Numerous restaurants, clubs, shopping venues, and theatres are also within easy walking distance. On the subject of cabs, I chose to take a cab to/from Pearson International Airport. In rush-hour traffic, it was about a 40-minute ride; in early-morning weekend conditions, it was about 20 minutes. The fare - without tip - for both rides was approximately $54. All in all, I was pleased with my stay at this Residence Inn. I suppose with some of the other unremarkable factors - lobby/general facility, customer service - I could have been swayed to give an overall rating of "Average". However, the room quality/cleanliness and location were so much a positive that I have given this stay an overall "Very Good" rating. When I visit Toronto again, I would be very much inclined to stay at this facility again because of the room and location, and my hope is that the other factors would rise to the same outstanding levels by that time.

Reviews.Title: “Deserving of No1 spot”
Reviews.Author: roseoakhil
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop on our 3 week trip to canada, Its goes without saying we chose this based on the reviews, location and price, im glad to say it all lives up. we had a fantastic suite overlooking the cn tower on the 19th floor (my 1st high story hotel experience, little scary) the i kitchenette & good size bathroom. There are so many excellent touches with the hotel, like the organised evenings with food (such a money saver) and popcorn etc in the rooms. The staff are all so good, your always greated with a smile and a welcome by reception and the door guys. This hotel was perfect for us after a little time on vacation we had started to feel less like tourists and more like we were living in canada so while in toronto and the marriot started doing more day to day things like order pizza or go catch a movie, all in all our stay was really enjoyable and i wouldnt hesitate recomending people to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A great Stay enjoyed by all !”
Reviews.Author: sauvysue
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home from a 6 night stay in Toronto staying at this hotel. We had taken our daughter for her 18th birthday pressie as this was where she wanted to go. The hotel was excellent we had our room on the 19th floor looking out at the CN tower. View was good. The suite was clean with loads of space even for 3 of us. The staff are very friendly and nothing is too much trouble for them ! Toronto is a nice city but we found it just dosnt have the buzz of say NY and found it quiet probably due to the time of year. We done all the usual sights walked about a lot, Niagra trip but the highlight was having dinner at the top of the CN tower - yes it was expensive but worth it once in a while, it was New Years Eve and we dont have a building high enough in Northern Ireland and the view was spectecular ! All in all a great trip even if we did leave all the snow behind in the UK - we didnt even see a snowflake in Toronto !

Reviews.Title: “Great location with great view!”
Reviews.Author: Helen711
Reviews.Content: This hotel has every amenity you could ask for when you're on vacation. The room we stayed in had a separate kitchen/eating area that faced the large, flat-screen TV in the sitting area. There were dishes, a refrig, microwave, dishwasher, corkscrew, knife, cutting board-everything. The bed was very comfortable. There were drawers under the sink in the washbasin area (there was a separate toilet and tub room), which would have come in handy if you were staying more than a day or two. We couldn't find public parking that was less than the valet parking, so we swallowed and payed the $35. It's a bit difficult to get in and out of because the main entrance is right on the corner with no area to pull off the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jrr54
Reviews.Content: Just a mini vacation but very enjoyable indeed. The studio room was fantastic. Everything that you could possibly need was available in the room.The breakfast was very good and the staff we dealt with were very very friendly , cheerful and helpful. We did miss the evening receptions during our stay but it was between Xmas and New Years so there were less staff on duty than usual. Great Stay nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: Codroy
Reviews.Content: I had recently spent 4 days at the above hotel and it is without a doubt, one of the best for service, atmosphere, and overall enjoyment. The staff were so helpful. The bartender was terrific. Would have no qualms in recommending this establishment for its' location, service and the excellent atmosphere of hospitality the staff strive to maintain.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ideal hotel for short break in Toronto, poor breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: DriverCheshire
Reviews.Content: We selected the hotel as always from Tripadvisor recommendations and were not disappointed, great location right in front of the CNN tower providing easy access to all that Toronto has to offer. We chose to visit Niagra Falls on the first day which is only a couple of hours away and well worth the effort, however unless you like a cross between Ls Vagas and Blackpool on bad day keep away from the main street after the falls, nothing good to say about it. We were disappointed with the service and breakfast which could best be described as a free for all with little choice, that aside the hotel provided excellent value for money and I would use it again if visiting Toronto, try and book the shopping package which provides free parking which is $35 a day and a $25 voucher to shop.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: stephhawaii_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded my expectations. The room was perfect for our family. The breakfast had a good selection but it can be very busy and the seating area isn't that big. Location was great and we had a great view of the CN Tower from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for families exploring Toronto.”
Reviews.Author: Travelingfamily15228
Reviews.Content: Short walk to subway and CN tower. Our room had no view, but was spacious and very clean. Layout of our 2-bedroom suite allowed those staying in second bedroom and living room to access the second bath from the hall without going through a bedroom. Breakfast was busy, but fully-staffed to keep supplied. Pool and hot tub a good break after a day on our feet. Parking rates are a bit steep. If checking out on a weekend, don't bother paying the extra fee if you need to stay past 2 pm, there are better deals out there if you are willing to move your car.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need or want for your trip, and no snootiness”
Reviews.Author: Pete3145
Reviews.Content: An all-round excellent hotel for an affordable price, but with a warm, friendly environment and pleasant staff, with no pressured up-selling. Rooms are a good size and the kitchen is great, but hotel "social nights" with complimentary meals are an added bonus. Comfortably set out with business, adult and family groups slotting in together nicely. Easy walking distance from the city centre and subway. The room I stayed in was quiet, and sufficiently dark to allow a decent sleep in. Would suit different people's needs with both a guest laundry as well as same day drycleaning service.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Places in Toronto Downtown to stay”
Reviews.Author: anujspgoel
Reviews.Content: The Rooms are very comfortable. Good option in breakfast for vegetarians. At the center of the city. Easy availability of public transport, shopping streets 2 minutes away. Hotel staff is very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Had a very pleasant and comfortable stay - Would recommend & return”
Reviews.Author: hrmelness
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice with my boyfriend and enjoyed both experiences. The only let down I would say is the lack of free public parking (we had to pay $25 overnight in the open lot across from Coraâ€™s & the Metropolitan), but that is to be expected when staying in downtown Toronto. Because thereâ€™s an office tower right next door the view is somewhat limited (we could see peopleâ€™s cubicles from our window) if youâ€™re facing south. Front desk service was friendly â€“ mention itâ€™s the first time youâ€™re staying there and you could get a free movie comped. We had trouble getting our TV to turn on and a service tech came promptly to fix it. We stayed in a king suite the first night and enjoyed having the bedroom separate from the common area and kitchen. You can tell this is a longer-stay hotel as thereâ€™s a dishwasher in the kitchen(!) We ordered take-out and had it delivered and was happy to find glasses, crockery, paper towels and even a little dishwasher soap on hand in the kitchen. The bed was soft and cozy with ample pillows. The second room we were in was all-in-one but still very spacious and comfortable. We tried out the hot tub & pool (which is open until 11pm) and noticed that the fitness room is open 24hrs, which is convenient. I didnâ€™t hear any hallway noise overnight and in the early morning, so if youâ€™re a light sleeper tha's some reassurance. The hot breakfast spread in the morning offers standard (scrambled eggs, bacon/sausage, variety of toast) and healthier options like yogurt and hot oatmeal. The dining floor was quite busy when we came down around 7:30am both mornings. All in all, we both enjoyed staying here and would definitely recommend it and return given the opportunity. Pro -Wifi high speed internet access -Spacious, comfortable, quiet rooms -Pool/hot tub/fitness room/business centre -Hot breakfast -Pool & hot tub, fitness room open 24hrs -Convenient, central location Con -No free overnight parking (hotel valet parking is $35 overnight) -Limited view if youâ€™re facing south

Reviews.Title: “Always fantastic”
Reviews.Author: KikiTee
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 separate 2 bedroom suites. It is phenomenally huge. The two rooms had different layouts and beds. The first was an L shape with the bathrooms connected to the bedrooms. The second was better, the one bedroom was more like a master suite and the other bathroom was in a common area (no one had to walk through a bedroom in the middle of the night.) The staff here is always great, nothing seems to get to them, even on a Bears vs. Bills weekend when the entire hotel was full of rowdy Chicago fans! The only complaint I have about the 2 bedroom suite was the sofabed was not very comfortable. I think this was a fluke, cause I've been in the studios and the sofabeds in those rooms are great. The hotel is also very well soundproofed. With the exception of the "Marriott door syndrome" (they slam--loudly) I never heard the bachelor party in the room next door, as long as your door is closed, no one can hear you. As far as parking goes, you can drive behind the hotel and park underground for $25. You can also do outdoor parking less than a block away for $11!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location when visiting Toronto”
Reviews.Author: gapper
Reviews.Content: If you are going to see a game at the Rogers Centre, it is literally next door. We also walked to the Air Canada Centre, CN Tower and Eaton Centre Mall and a few other areas downtown so it is centrally located. The hotel is very clean and rooms are spacious and look new. They only had available a king studio and we had our two teenagers, but there was still plenty of room and they slept on the pullout couch. There is a small kitchen also if needed. The breakfast is very good and we received a package which included free parking, 15% off at one of the malls and a $25 gift card for the Eaton Centre so the price was right. Definitely recommend this hotel if you want to be in the middle of it all.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Canada!”
Reviews.Author: nativeNYCityer
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel that we stayed at during our entire Canada Vacation. The staff were all friendly and welcoming. The room was clean, large, had a full kitchen, and was close to everything. We were traveling with an infant, and the full kitchen was very helpful. When we visit Toronto again, we will definitely stay at the Residence Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Sparkling Clean - Great Location - Over all Great!”
Reviews.Author: DuffBeerMan
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend here. The bathroom actually sparkled it was so clean. Everything else was perfectly clean too. No problems.. great staff.. absolutely wonderful stay. Only complaint is breakfast area a bit too crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: fussylady001
Reviews.Content: The property offers a great location and value. We walked just about everywhere and there is an entrance to PATH (the underground network) two blocks away. Don't expect upscale accommodations but it is clean and comfortable. Views aren't great. We were on the back side with a "sliver view" of the CN Tower and an office building. But it was quiet. The suite worked well - with plenty of places to sit. A full breakfast is included in the price and it is more than adequate. Some items change every day so you don't get bored with the same thing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: fastdan
Reviews.Content: Nice and very friendly staff! Nice and clean rooms ! Very good breakfast !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: elmac40
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a stay at the Residence Inn - it was excellent. Rooms were comfy, clean and included free wifi. Breakfast was good but try and avoid peak time such as around 8.30am as it's very busy. Staff were all very friendly. The location is ideal - we looked out of our window on to the CN tower. It's only a short walk to there and also where you pick up the city tour buses. Highly recommded hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: verdenrundt
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. My parents' had a connecting room, so the kids could run back and forth. The rooms were very nice, clean, modern and spacious. The bed was very comfortable (kids slept on the sofa bed). The kitchen was well equipped and had a stove, refridgerator and microwave. The hotel is very close to the CN tower and within walking distance to everything else. Valet parking was $35 per night, so we decided to park the car in the parking garage around the corner (same block). They charged only $5 per night on a weekend!

Reviews.Title: “All round exceptional service in a convenient downtown location”
Reviews.Author: Miconstab
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights. Surprise upgrade to a 2 bedroom suite...seemed like it was newly decorated...very clean. Staff throughtout the hotel were super responsive, including front desk and cleaning staff. Exceptional service, great buffet breakfast, convenient downtown location and much more mad our visit memorable

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: vlukewi
Reviews.Content: This hotel has all of the amenities that you could need. The rooms are clean and comfortable, with modern decorations. The hotel breakfast is GREAT too! Only bad thing is the parking is very expensive. $35.00!! We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MaDKipling
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in great location! Staff were very helpful. Room lovely, large, good view and very clean. Nice pool. We would return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel For Family Vacations”
Reviews.Author: Neilsnz
Reviews.Content: Two Bedroom Suite Absolutely brillant hotel! Great for family vacations and overall good value for money with the free breakfast that is provided. The service was of an exceptional standard from all staff. The breakfast provided was always of a high standard. More than could be expected for a free breakfast. The room decor was model and trendy. All facilities that you would expect were in the room. The room had two bathrooms that was handy. There was even a basket of kitchen supplies on the first night to allow you to use the kitchen. The hotel also offered a free grocery shopping service. The beds were among the most comfortable that we experienced. The hotel is located close to the tourist attractions and is also close to a building on the PATH network. Overall, I have no hesitation recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every cent”
Reviews.Author: leisuremanchicago
Reviews.Content: Spent more on this room than I usually would but it was a great value based on free breakfast and large room. Staff was excellent and made the stay a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely deserves a thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: helpfiji
Reviews.Content: So many good things have already been said and they are all true! I can't think of one single fault with this fantastic hotel choice in Toronto. So glad we stayed here. Rooms are spacious and beautifully fitted out. We loved that we could open the windows for some fresh air at night. Breakfast was excellent, front desk staff friendly and helpful. They obviously work hard at keeping to such a fantastic standard! Well done everyone at Residence Inn for making our short stay (2 nights) in Toronto one to remember.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: marcel dam
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at other Residence Inn's we decided to go to this one while in Toronto. It's location is good for down town, the railway station, Cn tower etc. Also easy to get to the high way and on to the airport or to Niagara. The rooms are very spacious clean and well kept. The kitchen are handy and the bathroom comfortable. The beds are excellent. The breakfast is very good and so are the free dinners on social evenings during the week. The staff was very friendly and helpfull always smiling and lending a hand. This even whilest it was a busy time during our stay with the Toronto Film Festival on the way. Having a living room, bed room and bathroom makes it feel like home with all comforts at hand. We will certainly return to this place when we are in Toronto again and to other residence inn's when getting the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, I could live in those rooms”
Reviews.Author: twasbrillig4
Reviews.Content: The glowing reviews abound so I just wanted to add my praise for this outstanding hotel. We just loved everything about it, but especially the size and decor of the rooms. Two armchairs, a coffee table with a welcome footstool beneath, a sofa and a desk and chair still left plenty of room for the king bed and kitchen area. We had lunch at the CN tower restaurant, which is a very easy walk from the hotel, and enjoyed the experience as the food was much better than we expected and of course, we didn't have to join any lines. We had booked online the previous day. The hotel's breakfast was excellent with really fresh fruit salad as well as all the other items you expect and the early evening light meal we had was good with delicious carrot cake for dessert. No negatives at all. We could have happily stayed much longer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: sisi123
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean and offered a buffet breakfast every morning. It also had snacks at dinner time on some days. I felt the location was convienient for our needs. There were plenty of restaurants around. Unfortunately for us the Toronto Film Festival was in full swing and many restaurants were booked...

Reviews.Title: “Everything they say is true - fantastic hotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Zeddog
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with some trepidation, all the OTT reviews made me think people must be paid to write them !! However, I'm now a convert to Residence Inn. From reception to the cleaning staff and the restaurant crew - this is a fabulous place to stay. The free breakfasts in the morning (varied and plentiful) were a huge plus and my friend and I hardly ever ate lunch as a result - we simply didn't need to. Cannot recommend this highly enough and if I'm ever back in Toronto, I will be staying right here at the Residence Inn. :) :)

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location, great rooms!”
Reviews.Author: lilio74
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this property. The front desk staff was very helpful with all questions at all hours of the day. Valet guys were very helpful and gave great tips for the area. There is a steep $35 daily rate for valet, but it seems to be standard for the area. The room was very spacious and well equipped. All furniture is new, nice plasma t.v. on a rotating stand, sofa bed in the common area, and free wi-fi. The complimentary breakfast buffet every morning was extensive, hearty, and very filling. We were surprised that they even offered a "social" every evening we were there. They served a full dinner buffet.... one night they had hot dogs and bratwurst, another they had falafel and chicken tenders. Not the fanciest selections, but if you are travelling with children or on a low budget or simply not a "foodie", it will do just fine. Besides, the kitchenette in the room is also a nice feature to have. The hotel is very well situated... we had a GREAT view of the CN tower. I would definitely stay here again if I returned to Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly1971
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in August to see the Blue Jays play at Rogers Center (which was only a two block walk). Room wasn't ready when we arrived at noon but we had our car valet parked any way. Upon check in at four, the front desk clerk told us to let the valet know our room number and our bags from our car were brought to our room in less then five minutes. My husband and I were VERY impressed with the room and were very disappointed that we were not staying longer so that we could utilize the great kitchen. Room was very clean, spacious, and had a nice view of the CN Tower. We walked to Young Street (quite a long walk, but doable if you are somewhat fit) and had dinner right around the corner at Wayne Gretsky's restaurant (food was decent, atmosphere was great for hockey fans). Breakfast in the morning was good, large variety of hot and cold foods (was pretty busy on Sunday morning and we noticed that some people had to take their food back to their rooms). We got a pretty good rate on the internet (due to being non-refundable and paid in advance) and would definitely stay here again, in fact, we hope to bring our three kids with us next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary Get Away”
Reviews.Author: loveit023
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were both pleased with the service, cleanliness and helpfulness this hotel had from the moment we walked in to the time we left. We had a flat tire on arrival and the staff did everything to help us out including the use of their tire pump to get us to a garage. The manager even came out to see if we were being looked after..What Service!!!.We enjoyed the free brealfast buffet and the pleasant atmosphere of the lounge at night...The room was beautiful and the CN Tower was stunning at night. We were also informed that walking around at night was completely safe in this area..We will definately be returning to this hotel on our next trip to Toronto.Thanks for making our 9th anniversary a memorable moment! (The one thing to remember was you have to pay extra for parking)

Reviews.Title: “great place!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cardtraveler
Reviews.Content: We had at studio suite and it fit us great.A full kitchen a living area and bed with flat screen tv!! We would stay her again.

Reviews.Title: “Now I understand it's populaity”
Reviews.Author: benthere
Reviews.Content: This inn's #1 rating on Trip Advisor piqued my curiosity, so I decided to stay here for 5 days in August. I couldn't have been more pleased. Beginning with the friendly greeting and on to the impressively sized room - complete with fully stocked kitchen with full size fridge and dishwasher. There was more than enough space for 2 and even 4 would be comfortable in the room. The room was very clean and I slept very well in the comfortable bed. The free buffet breakfast was consistently delicious. They also offer evening socials with food. They will do your grocery shopping for you, if you leave them a list. There is a fitness center and a pool and a small business center for guest use. All of these amenities are FREE! Very rare! The inn is in the entertainment district and is a short walk to the waterfront, theaters, Air Canada Centre, Skydome, the Hockey Hall of Fame, Wayne Gretzky's restaurant, Second City, the CN tower, Chinatown and many other attractions. I rarely give a 5 rating, but I was impressed across the board with this inn. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay - clean; friendly & convenient”
Reviews.Author: bayfld
Reviews.Content: We visited Toronto to take the kids to the CNE. We took the train from Stratford & walked from Union Station over to The Residence Inn. We were going to just check our bags since it was early, but our room was ready. That was a nice surprise and just the first of many during our stay at the hotel. Our room was lovely and very clean. It was perfect for our family as it had a kitchenette. Refreshing fruited water in the lobby and a great little evening social hour that was dinner for us - chicken/ rice/ salad/ bread/ dessert - all you need for supper. Plus they have breakfast each morning. The bedding is lovely - like sleeping in a cloud. The kids loved that there was a pool. The boys walked over to the Blue Jays game in the evening. We had no trouble walking to Chinatown for lunch either. We took the subway back from shopping at Eaton Center & we took the streetcar to the CNE. Easy to get around - across the street from CBC and close to the CN tower. We had a view of the CN tower from our room. Very nice. Would highly recommend and would stay again w/o a doubt. Very friendly staff too by the way. Just a great stay !

Reviews.Title: “High standard rooms, excellent service, would definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTeenageKids
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn Toronto Downtown as we thought it would be well situated to access all that we wanted to see in Toronto. It certainly lived up to expectations with the CN Tower, Rogers Centre etc only a block away and with a short walk to the harbourfront. The standard of accommodation was very high throughout the hotel and was exactly as can be viewed from the hotel's website. The service from all staff was expceptional. The breakfasts were plentiful, with great choice and they offered free evening meals to guests on a Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday each week which you could either eat in the dining area, or take to your rooms. We would definately stay again at the Residence Inn if we were visiting Toronto again.

Reviews.Title: “Great apart from the confusion”
Reviews.Author: hobozo
Reviews.Content: Ok - so the confusion could have been my fault... We booked a junior suite with two rollaway beds. When we arrived, there was only one rollaway bed. If someone had explained to me (in my jet lagged state) that the sofa converted into another bed, then there would have been no problem and the stay would have been perfect. Instead, we had a series of broken promises assuring us that the second rollaway bed would be with us by 7, then by 7.30, then by 8 o'clock. My eventual complaint was dealt with efficiently by the housekeeping staff and the matter was resolved - but, come on guys, you could have just told me I could make a bed out of the sofa.... Fantastic breakfast (the children really loved the waffle maker and we liked the hand's on approach). Outstanding cleanliness - wow, the cleaning staff here are awesome. The room is a bit cramped with children, but as a couple the kitchenette would be a great bonus. The location is fab. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: GuestManc
Reviews.Content: It;s no wonder this hotel is no. 1, it's great value & location is second to none. The staff are superb & could not be more helpful. All other hotels should send their staff here just to see how to do it right!. The rooms are excellent very well equipped. Breakfast is good with a large choice to cater for everyone. The next time I go back to Toronto, I will definitely be staying here. Well Done - Hotel manager 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Great view of the CN Tower (if on the right side)!”
Reviews.Author: familytravel4x4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and had a fantastic room on the 21st floor overlooking the CN Tower. Room was fabulous with an enourmous bed and a double futon for the children. Weren't too impressed with the check in staff at first - we were an hour early for check in and she certainly let us know that check in was at 4pm. The bell boys were very helpful and stored our luggage for us. When we returned later that afternoon we were greeted by friendlier and much more helpful staff. Good breakfast in the lobby with as much as you can eat - need to get down fairly early though or else you'll end up queuing. If you want to go up the CN Tower it is worth getting up early and getting there for 9am. We were the first people of the day up to the Sky Pod and it was great not having to queue.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel again and again”
Reviews.Author: mizzie
Reviews.Content: We recently travelled to Toronto and have again stayed at this Marriott. It is our hotel of choice when visiting this area. This was our 4th or 5th stay at this property and again the service was excellent from the courteous and friendly front desk staff to the great housekeeping. You cannot enter the hotel without being greeted by staff and they really are a credit to this place. The rooms are wonderful, beds very comfortable and the kitchen equipped with most of what you need. The complimentary breakfasts are great and so beyond your basic continental style. My only query would be the reduced evening snacks. I'm quite sure they had offered evening snacks that were quite delicious more than 3 nights a week previously. Perhaps its a sign of our economic times, but it is something we looked forward to after a busy day and often would suffice instead of going out for dinner. All in all, we will definitely stay at this property again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect getaway to Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: Snoopy200579
Reviews.Content: We came to Toronto as the first part of our honeymoon and stayed at the Residence Inn Toronto for 2 nights. We were quite jet lagged when we came there but the luxurious bedding made it all the more comfortable. We booked a Studio which has everything you can ask for, including an equipped kitchen. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. The breakfast was delicious, a great combination of continental breakfast with American touch. All in all we can only say good things about the hotel and we would stay there again any time we go back to Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “The best Residence Inn I have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: PeggyM72
Reviews.Content: What an exceptional place. We arrived early (10 am) and were greeted warmly even though check-in was not until 3 pm We were told a room was available, or we could wait a couple of hours if we wanted a room on one of the higher floors. We opted for the second, checked our car with the valet and went out into the city. We were returned, the valet obtained our luggage and we went to our room. The room was outstanding...exceptionally clean, beautifully decorated and bed very, very comfortable. We were advised of the 'light meal' that was served during the social hour and decided to try it. The food was excellent, with a large variety items ranging from salad to dessert. Needless to say, our 'light meal' was so substantial that we decided not to go out to dinner. The morning we experienced the very same thing again with breakfast. Incredible! Now... the dining area was a bit small for crowd that these meals attracted, however, the staff did an excellent job of cleaning tables quickly, and moving chairs to accommodate different size families. The location of course was perfect, right across the street from the CN tower. We loved everything about this place. What made us unhappy was the fact that we were only there one night.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: lsmout
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights from 12 July and have only good things to say about our stay here. Our room was a King suite and was a good size and well equipped with everything we needed including a really comfy super king bed. The location is great just a few minutes from the CNN Tower which we could see from our room and the hotel is within a short walk of plenty of bars and restaurants for the evening without being on top of them so it was also very quiet.. The hotel was pretty busy whilst we were there including lots of families staying but we never had any trouble getting a table at breakfast and the food was always hot and plentiful with a good selection. They even had a decent cup of tea which is often a rarity for a North American hotel! The free tea and coffee throughout the day is a nice touch and very welcome in the afternoon or when you come back in the evening. They also had a complimentary early evening 'taster' Mon-Wed which we tried just the once as it was a bit early for us to eat and it did tend to get full of people loading up their plates because it was free only to leave half of it. We would agree with other comments about the staff in this hotel as they are all very cheerful and extremely helpful. We had some queries when we were there about pick up times for pre-booked excursions and airport transfers and they found the phone numbers of the agents, rang them and sent faxes for us without any fuss and everyone seemed genuinely friendly and happy to chat and help with maps, directions and tips on where to go. If you are staying in Toronto for a few days we would certainly recommend the open top hop on/off London style red bus as good value. The tickets are around CSD $35 but include a boat trip and last for 7 days. The guides are very knowledgeable and we used the bus a number of times to get around the city and to get to places we wanted to visit. The breeze on the top deck was also very welcome as the weather was really hot and sunny during our stay. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to others and would definitely stay here again if we ever come back to Toronto - which we loved by the way!

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good, comfortable and clean...”
Reviews.Author: alexander_lakey
Reviews.Content: Overall very good, comfortable and clean but the wifi / wired network sucks! I am booked in for 27 nights but have yet to make a successful skype call without dropouts... Not great when you have a young family 3000 miles away. Otherwise it is a great hotel and very very good value.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: colinCORK
Reviews.Content: hotel was excellent.from the staff to the hotel roooms.i thought the staff could not be more helpful

Reviews.Title: “The best ever...”
Reviews.Author: directconnect
Reviews.Content: We stayed just two nights at this wonderful hotel. Actually got the best rates on the Marriott website where they offered senior discounts. And with a full breakfast buffet and a "social hour" in the evening which amounted to a full dinner, we saved a lot by staying at this hotel. Located in the heart of Toronto--walking distance to the top attractions in the city and close to the subway system, too--the hotel offered all amenities including a full business center (2 computers + 1 computer at the bar) with printer so that we could even print out our boarding passes, swimming pool, exercise room. Suites were spacious, beds very comfortable with an additional sofa bed, plus a fully equipped kitchen--even providing dishwasher soap and dishwashing liquid. We didn't need all the extras on this trip, but those families who are traveling would really appreciate the extra details. As busy as this hotel was, ALL of the hotel staff were attentive, courteous and friendly--from the front office team, to the valet service, to the housekeeping staff. And that speaks volumes about the type of service they provided to all of the customers! The Residence Inn in downtown Toronto is one top notch hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “A treat and a gem!”
Reviews.Author: MissElainey
Reviews.Content: If there was one complaint that I have about the hotel is the lobby feels very congested. And the free for all on Monday Tuesday and Wednesday with the free food is a bit scary. It would be nice if the masses could be kept out of the bar area as those of us who are on business need to be able to have a wind down and not get wound up by small greasy children. But once the food disappears calm does take over again and the bar returns to a bar. Room very spacious and very clean. Staff are very helpful and friendly. It would be nice if there were robes to use to go to the pool area for a swim. One down side was a hit and miss wireless connection. Very annoying when trying to Skype but overall a terriffic hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel â€“ not sure why it is rated the best in Torontoâ€¦?”
Reviews.Author: Wembleygal
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel, donâ€™t get me wrong. Check-in staff were amazing â€“ very friendly and helpful. Doormen were a little pushy. While I booked a studio suite with a king-sized bed, I was given one with a queen-sized one. Not a huge problem as I staying by myself, but this lacked attention to detail by the staff. In my Marriott profile, it also states a room away from the elevators â€“ I was given a room right next door to one.
