While the bed was okay, the quality of the linens and towels was not up to the usual Marriott standards. Both were very thin and they only provided 3 towels. My shampoo, conditioner and moisturiser (in very tiny sizes) were never replaced, despite staying 3 nights. I sampled the free breakfast 2 out of 3 mornings as well as the finger buffet on 2 out of 3 nights. Quality was okay, but I found some of my fellow guests to be very greedy and pushy so the â€œfreeâ€� became a very stressful experience. My room was modern and the LCD TV had lots of channels. The washer & dryer (on the 17th, 10th and 9th floors) was efficient and cost 4 dollars. Shower pressure in the room was okay in my 20th floor room. In-room Wifi was strong and easy to connect to. The safe was big enough for my Netbook. The bar was small, but the service was very friendly. I managed to get a fabulous rate at this property, but Iâ€™m not sure I would pay 169 to 220 for this room. Location was a little off the beaten path of a downtown hotel. If I could get a good rate, I would certainly stay again. But I think this property is aimed more at large families rather than business or solo travellers.

Reviews.Title: “great for families”
Reviews.Author: christine2008
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights in July. centrally located about 25 minutes walk from harbour front, 5 minutes from CN tower, 10-25 minutes walk from most of the shops and within a 5 minute walk from the theatre district, bars and restaurants. plenty of room in the suites for a family and an adequate breakfast for most people, although there was always a short wait for a table in the morning due to the small size of the eating area. I would not hesitate to use this hotel again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Nice Rooms, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Jaybird9520
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on its rating on tripadvisor and we were not disappointed. It's ideally located for heading to the theater, which was the purpose of our trip. We were only a few blocks away from the shows and the nearby restaurants on King Street. It's also within a short walk of the CN Tower and Rogers Center. The Eaton Center is a bit further, but still close enough that you don't need to take a cab. The room itself was spacious and nicely decorated. It was more like a small bachelor apartment than a hotel room really. We enjoyed the living room area and all of the kitchen amenities (full fridge, microwave, dishes, dishwasher, etc). Our stay also included a free breakfast buffet. There was a good selection of food and was quite tasty. Over all we found the hotel to be a great value in a great location. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “top hotel”
Reviews.Author: a visitor from ireland
Reviews.Content: A superb hotel. Could not find fault with it. Location is excellent, walking distance to CN tower, Rogers Centre and Harbour. Few minutes walk from the subway and the tram lines. Loads of restaurants nearby. Big, bright, beautiful room with well equiped kitchenette. Helpful staff, great breakfast. Coffee and Iced water at reception during the day was a welcome touch. Deserves it's No.1 spot with Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Get a suite - great for families”
Reviews.Author: HoustonTXFamily
Reviews.Content: I strongly recommend the Marriott Residence Inn Toronto to anyone travelling with kids. We had a two bedroom suite, a fold out sofa and kitchenette. With three kids, this was just right. A surprisingly extensive breakfast buffet is included in the price. The staff (especially Saba in the restaurant) was very friendly and helpful. Compared to the cost of two adjoining rooms at Toronto's Four Seasons or Grand Hyatt, the Marriott proved a terrific value. Location was fantastic too - we were 2 blocks from the CN Tower. Nearby restaurants Little Anthony's and Verona were delicious (and fancy enough that you'd go there even without kids in tow). This hotel is the way to go for families visiting the sites in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “A spacious suite with large comfy beds & excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Mookie27
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Residence Inn for 3 nights in a 2 bedroomed suite which was more than adequate. The bedrooms were large with extremley comfortable beds and plenty of storage for our luggage. We were travelling around Canada for 3Â½ weeks so had lots of clothes to hang etc and the rooms provided plenty of hanging space - including coat hangers, which I usually find are in short supply in most hotel rooms. The suite had a kitchen and living area which was also well equipped if you wanted to cook a meal in, we didn't as only there for 3 nights. We actually stayed at this hotel during the G20 Summit and security around the City was unbelieveable, we have never seen so many police but even though there was some trouble in the City we never saw anything only whilst watching the news! Many shops and restaurants had closed but we always found somewhere to eat and drink and found the whole experience quite exciting really... Breakfast was provided in the hotel which always set us up really well for the day with lots to choose from like fresh fruit, yoghurts, cereals, pastries and bread Oh! and even waffles... as well as cooked breakfast like scrambled egg, bacon and sausage I think I even saw pancakes!! There was also plenty of fresh fruit juices as well as tea & coffee. This was certainly more than adequate for what we needed and was positioned well with access to many bars, restaurants, shops, CN Tower & Steam Whistle Brewery.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect value”
Reviews.Author: ZrhWorldtraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Residence Inn with friends for 5 nights in July, we got a very good rate and I was very happy with the style and the overall equipment of the room (some of the equipment is quite noisy such as ventilation and ice machine) The view though was not nice. A suprisingly fresh and good breakfast, friendly staff - location fine. Definitely a hotel to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff disappointing”
Reviews.Author: SKKF
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, amenities are good with breakfast, pool and evening snack. We have stayed here before with great luck but this time I found the staff to be a big disappointment. The front desk was not at all friendly at check in. I found the staff in the eating area to be quite miserable and even saw one staff member roll her eyes at a guest.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding perks for family with kids”
Reviews.Author: wetakethekids
Reviews.Content: we were in town for a conference with kids in tow. residence inn staff were extremely friendly. the breakfast is great and so convenient. room was standard, wished it were a suite but still comfortable. pool was fun. free internet and the small but never full business printer area super. we happened to be around for he happy hour/mini dinner which picked us up. my husband had to practice oboe and the staff gave him an empty conference to use.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want and Need.”
Reviews.Author: Hosta_La_Vista
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty decent hotel for travellers. The suites have everything in them from a kitchen with cutlery/dishes, etc., wine glasses, coffee-maker, microwave, etc. Upon arrival, there is a little welcome kit with coffee and popcorn. They also have comfortable beds and a TV that swings that can be watched in the bed area or in the sitting area. Most importantly there was a small window you could open to get outside air. Well, I say that is good, however, the night we were there, the City of Toronto was setting up for the G8 and the sound of fencing being put up and dropped at 4 am was a real pain. Location: One block from the CN Tower and the Rogers Centre. The Entertainment is actually a few blocks away closer to the Eaton Centre. A great city to walk or to get hop on-hop off tour bus. You can see everything in one or two days. Don't forget to take the ferry over to Toronto Island park. The breakfast has lots of options plus there is an afternoon appetizer - both free (well part of your room price). One day they had Indian food from the restaurant next door - well needless to say, we didn't need to go out for dinner. Only paid for lunch that day. My only criticism is the price of alcohol (especially wine) at the hotel bar. I don't get why hotels want to rip you off so you don't buy a drink instead of making them affordable or by having a happy hour at the least. I did not drink here because of that. It would have been nice to have a drink with our appetizer, but very few even bothered. The Airport is a $55 ride either by taxi or limosine (town car). Watch it though, when you order a limo, the doorman contacts his friends (gets $10) and the other limo driver, unbeknownst to you, waits there and is told the customer took a cab to the airport. Not really fair, but I've seen this in many hotels in many countries. The real positives for travellers at this hotel is the free business centre, free wi-fi in the room and an onsite laundry mat. The gym is also very nice and open 24 hours per day. the pool and hot-tub, although I did not go in them, looked really inviting. This hotel has everything you need. Check on-line for specials - we received free valet parking (not that we had a car) and 4 tickets to the ROM Museum inclusive in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and breakfast but staff is uninformed”
Reviews.Author: Familytravelmaven
Reviews.Content: Overall we enjoyed this hotel with my three boys, ages 13, 11, and 10. The room was spacious enough for all of us and they devoured the full hot breakfast every morning. We also could walk to all major spots in the city or take the subway. We didn't need our car once while staying in Toronto. Hotel is conveniently located right near the CN Tower and the Rodgers Centre. My only disappointment was with the front desk staff who on three occasions gave me the wrong information - which I was trying to confirm with information I saw on-line. They didn't know much about what was happening in the city or even how to find the information. If you know what you want to do, then this is a fine hotel for staying in Toronto. I found the beds weren't as comfortable as other Marriotts we've stayed in recently so we didn't get the best night sleep.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: DorothySuley
Reviews.Content: This has got to be the best service I have ever had at a hotel. The staff went over and beyond and really appreciated our business. It was the first time travelling that I wish we would have had more time to spend at the hotel. It was one of the highlights of our trip. If you are staying in this area . This Hotel is a must !!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: iritsht
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the hotel. The room and the kitchen were comfortable. The beds were very comfy. The staff was friendly . I forgot one of my possessions there and they sent it to my house with no additional charge. The breakfast was tasty and the location was great.

Reviews.Title: “I want to live in this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SoozR703
Reviews.Content: I was in Toronto to attend a conference but the room rates at the host hotel were well beyond my means, so I booked at the Residence Inn instead. From the first moment of arrival, I was hooked -- the staff was friendly and accomodating, the room was beautiful (like an exclusive studio apartment in a metropolitan area), and the location was close to bus stops, tram stops and lots of restaurants and shops. The free breakfast is fresh and offers a variety of choices and the afternoon (6 - 7:30) social features foods from local restaurants. Best of all, the front desk staff was very accomodating when I asked about extending my check-out a couple of hours so I could book a lunch appointment with a potential client. My favorite anecdote from my stay: I awoke to rain on Wednesday AM, and knowing that I needed to walk to the tram stop and that my umbrella was still in my car, I asked the valet if I could go down to the parking garage to get it. Not only did the valet get my umbrella for me, he brought it over to me while I was having breakfast! I'll definitely stay at the Residence Inn next time I'm in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeeJoMaldives
Reviews.Content: I would strongly recommend this hotel! Fab view of the CN tower from the 20th floor. Well equipped rooms, generous breakfast choices, social evenings (especially nice when on business), welcoming staff, who are accommodating, small gym and pool but but in good condition, a variety of extra's included a good laundry service as well as laundry facilities to do your own washing and the option for someone to do your grocery shopping. I loved the freedom this hotel allowed me to have and after staying in lots of hotels on business and having to dine out, having the option to eat in was a welcomed relief.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Entended Stay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chattes
Reviews.Content: I have been staying in Residence Inn for the ast 5 months and its by far the best extended stay hotel I have ever visited. Excelent location,Food and Guest Services

Reviews.Title: “Hurrah for Manager Shaun!”
Reviews.Author: thirdroom
Reviews.Content: This manager must never sleep. He checked us in, offered an upgrade (without being asked), seated us at breakfast during a rush and then checked us out. The hotel was perfect - clean, modern and quiet. We couldn't have asked for more. Thanks for a wonderful weekend Residence Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great value! Friendly people! Great service!”
Reviews.Author: travelKingston
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Residence Inn Toronto Downtown on a regular basis over the past three years. It is far and away the best hotel I have used in Toronto over the past ten years. The all inclusive breakfasts, the snack theme nights and the friendly bar are all great reasons to stay. The rooms are all spacious and great value. I now call it my home away from home for business and pleasure. We have recommended it for the hotel of choice at our daughter's wedding later this year!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Sielah
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying in a residence type hotel, and we are converted! The room was comfortable, clean and very spacious - probably larger than some Toronto starter condos! It doesn't have the amenities available in a full service hotel like the Fairmont or Hilton, but that made it feel quieter and more private, which we loved. No piano player in the lobby (because there is no real lobby) no hordes of party girls clogging up the lounge (because there is no real lounge), no room service at 11pm, but you can buy stuff at the grocery store across the road and cook it yourself in your private kitchen. A really great choice for self-sufficient people who just want to do their own thing. Good points : 1. Breakfast is included, so don't have to waste an hour every morning figuring out where to eat. 2. Rooms have kitchens, so you can do your own thing if you don't want to eat out. 3. Excellent location, only a few blocks away from great bars, restaurants and entertainment options. 4. The main thing you see from the window is the CN tower. It looks really beautiful at night, when it's all lit up. 5. King size bed was SUPER comfortable. 6. No noise pollution that we noticed, either from outside or from surrounding rooms. 7. Room had free wireless, although we didn't need it. Can't really think of any bad points!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the City and loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: HAPATRAVELER80
Reviews.Content: First time in Toronto and Canada, went with the Residence Inn with help from the reviews here on TripAdvisor. Hotel is on Wellington St. West which is pretty calm and quiet. Not too many places to eat right next to the hotel except for a Indian restaurant right next door that I didn't try. The hotel is approximately a block and a half away from the Hyatt Regency Toronto (on King) which is the stop for the Toronto Airport Express (good way to get to and from Pearson Airport). Staff was really professional and check-in and out was quick. The daily breakfast that starts at 6:30am was pretty good. The room (#301) had more than enough space for me and was very clean. Location wise its great if your in town to see the Blue Jays play with the Rogers Centre within easy walking distance as is the CN Tower. I was able to walk from the hotel to the St. Lawrence Market, City Hall, Royal Ontario Museum and Queen's Park Legislative Building with no problems. All in all it was a great stay and when I return I will be sure to use the Residence Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “CrÃ¨me de la CrÃ¨me”
Reviews.Author: buttons78
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that I travel quite frequently and I have stayed at many hotels. This property has just skyrocketed to the top of my favorite list! I'm an Elite Marriott Rewards member and I used points to stay at this hotel for one night. From the outside it doesn't look like much. Once you step inside, you're welcomed by the friendly front desk staff. I requested a room with a view of the CN Tower. I was told a view couldn't be guaranteed but there was a room on a high floor available. Room 2112 not only had a awesome view of the CN Tower, but the room itself was everything I needed and wanted. Very modern and contemporary decor and very spacious for a downtown hotel. Not to mention the full kitchen and free internet access. The bed was extremely comfortable and there weren't any bed bugs. The hotel offers complimentary hot breakfast buffet also. I experienced a few minor problems during my stay. 1) The cable tv went out and wasn't fixed before I went to bed. However, there is a clock radio/cd player/mp3 dock that I used for entertainment. 2) The vending machine took my change and didn't dispense my soda pop. They weren't able to refund my money because they don't own the vending machine. But they did give me a free can of soda from the bar. 3) The walls seem to be really thin because I could hear loud music, yelling, screaming and laughing coming from my neighbors room. 4) Parking is ridiculous $35 for valet service. Luckily, I found overnight parking nearby for $20. None of this took away from the overall great experience I had at the Residence Inn. Easy to see why this property is #1.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: unclespike18116
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel in Toronto since it opened 3 years ago. I probably stay 3 to 5 nights per month. I have been staying in Toronto for about 12 years now and until I discovered this hotel I would never stay in the same location very long. Now when I am greeted at the door with welcome home they mean it and I fell like this is my home away from home. Everything about this hotel says "first class". I would never stay anywhere else when in Toronto. I like clean, predictable, friendly and attentive to detail. This hotel has all that in spades.

Reviews.Title: “I cannot wait to get 'home' to the Residence Inn again”
Reviews.Author: djwtor13
Reviews.Content: With some pride, I think I was surely among the first people to stay in the Residence Inn, Toronto, downtown when it opened 2 years ago. I have not since, and will not, stay elsewhere when in Toronto . (see my ratings). I have found that I am returning to the city (Toronto) on business again next week (mid May), and, as opposed to dreading the travel, as I do most trips, I can hardly wait. The staff, to a person, are as close as family can be to me (sometimes much, much kinder and more considerate). The rooms are spacious (try for a corner 05 or 10 room). My business involves meetings, conferences, promotions, and has, on four continents for the past 25 years. The Residence Inn on Wellington Street has become, and remains, my favourite property of any. I send all my friends and business associates there, should they find themselves in Toronto. Simple truth David Walker

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Suelookout
Reviews.Content: My room was infested with bed bugs. it was room 405. I do not think they had changed the sheets from the previous guest. Woke up with many bed bug bites covering my arms and legs. T

Reviews.Title: “Great Room & Location”
Reviews.Author: Dondotca
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here one night on May 8, 2010. We had tickets to Mama Mia and this hotel was close and rated #1 by this site. I would agree that this is an awesome hotel for what I paid. Senior rate was $161. The pool and spa tub were very clean. I followed others advice about parking. I checked the surface lot at Front and Windsor and they wanted $30 overnight. I then went to the underground parking on Windsor and the overnight charge was $10. The breakfast buffet was excellent. They had a hot buffet with just about anything you might order at a restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “awesome room”
Reviews.Author: jimbits
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five days where we went ot the final home game for the Leafs and the Nickelback concert. We checked in really late and Sarah helped us. We had booked a single room but she saw how tired and exhausted we were and offered to upgrade us up to a king and queen two bedroom unit for only $50 a night. This location is great for acccess to Roger's Centerr, ACC, Union Station and the CN Tower. The rooms were fantastric, clean and lcd tvs in every room. The night we went to the Leafs game my wife and I sat in the lounge having a few drinks while our kids (12,14) waited in the lobby.. The bartender(I am so sorry for not remembering his name) called the kids in and then performed card tricks for them. One day we all felt sick (Jack Astors, I think) and Sarah again offered ginger ale to settle our stomaches. Great hotel and great service. The rooms are huge with lots of room. We really hated Toronto but this hotel made our experience tolerable.

Reviews.Title: “Finest hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: AlfromKearney
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 2 nights at the Residence Inn on Wellington St. in Toronto together with our son who is a soldier deploying shortly to Afghanistan. Our stay at this hotel was entirely excellent. The facilities and location were good but what stood out was the high level of service and the fantastic attention to detail by all of the staff. Our room was bright and comfortable. The property was immaculately clean and well maintained. The morning breakfast buffet was fresh and tasty. My wife and I recently spent 2 nights at a 5-star Ritz Carlton in Las Vegas attending our other son's wedding and our Toronto experience was in most regards far superior in terms of service and value. My wife and I are both retired and we travel as much our our resources allow. We spend a number of nights each year in hotels and motels in various locations and I make it a point to comment on both the good and bad of most of the places we stay. I generally throw compliments around as if they were man-hole covers. That said, I would rate this Residence Inn as an 11 on a scale of 1 to 10. My wife and I usually stay in hotels close to the airport but in future we will attempt to stay at the Residence Inn if at all possible.

Reviews.Title: “first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: colg1
Reviews.Content: This is a superb hotel in a very convenient location. Was given a 1BR suite, which was huge. Staff is excellent. Location is excellent --- just 3 blocks from convention center, 1 block from sports arena. Quiet in spite of being in center city. Able to walk to about everything, including subway. Fitness center is fine - nothing special but everything works and is clean.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing city”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter19_83
Reviews.Content: I came to Toronto for a Supplier Conference. This city is one I'd go back to in a heartbeat. Great food, great nightlife, great service (at the hotel I stayed in).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Better for Business Stays Than Familiy Weekends”
Reviews.Author: COCOFromOttawa
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers, we stayed at the Residence Inn with our kids for Easter weekend. The hotel measures up well - rooms are clean and nicely decorated, beds comfy, the kitchen came in handy for kids' bed time snacks, staff are nice enough and the breakfast buffet was a good deal if somewhat chaotic. There are some good restaurants within an easy 5 - 10 minute walk. It's far from the subway though and access to the highway isnt great. Dont go for the rip off valet parking - there are many surface lots within a block or so offering in and out privileges. Prices vary a lot and deals can be had - so try a couple before you park. We came away puzzled though about why this hotel gets Toronto's #1 ranking from TripAdvisor for families. There isn't much to recommend this suites hotel over others of this format. True there is a hot breakfast. And a small pool. But in our view this would be a much better bet for a business stay. Not sure we'll be back with the kids but it's on my list for my next business trip to T.O.

Reviews.Title: “Great service a walk away from many Toronto attractions”
Reviews.Author: HolaSunnyD
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our 13 year old son recently stayed at this hotel during Easter break. I was very happy with the cleanliness of the hotel, in fact our room looked brand new! We had the king size bed studio suite, which is exactly as the photos show. My son slept on the sofabed which he found very comfortable. Breakfast is included with real scrambled eggs, meat, fresh fruits, and breads. The rooms have a full kitchen with all the necessary acrouements needed to prepare meals. One drawback and it seems to be the theme around toronto was the parking. It's steep at $35/day, valet service. Walking distance to CN Tower, Rodgers Centre, Train station. Although there is no general restaurant located on the premises (Indien next door), there are many within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: supermom46
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about the great experience we had at the Residence Inn, The staff was freindly, attentive, and professional. The room was perfect! We were happily surprised to be treated to a full dinner on our evening of arrival. The food quality was great. The loacation for touring sites like the CN Tower, Rogers Centre, Steam Whistle Brewery could not be beat. We are already looking forward to another chance to stay at this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: CorporateAdvisor
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed with this Marriott hotel as I was in town for three nights with two other collegues on business. At first when we checked in the clerk looked like we were bothering her as she was chewing gum and had a distressed facial expression. As it was close to dinner time we just wanted to check in and go out for a bite to eat. As we have never been to Toronto before we needed some restaurant options and when we asked the clerk for reccommodations she seemed very weak in this area and did not exercise further investigation to our requests. We asked if there was anyone who could help (concierge) and she said that the hotel was short staffed and that the manager on duty was on break. I travel quite a bit and I feel that my collegues and I did not want to hear excuses or discuss the hotels staffing issues. As we were already disturbed by our first impression we decided to check in and quest our own dinner plans for the evening by doing a search in their complimentary business centre via internet. When I checked into the room it was nice and spacious and clean as I must credit the hotel for their decor. Further on to my experience.....the evening we came back from dinner we stopped by the front desk to ask for a wake up call as it was around 11ish and was surprised to see two clerks arguing with each other about who was going to stay on later. I guess they did not see us coming in which is surprising as the hotel lobby is very small and intimate. We asked for a wake up call and moved onward to our rooms as we had a very early presentation the next day. To put it precisely....only one of my colleges received a wake up call out of my group. Luckily I used my in room alarm clock and was able to rectify my early start but it did put a very bad taste in my experience. I approached the front desk in the morning and had asked to speak to a manager. A new clerk said that she had not arrived yet. I asked was their anyone else I could speak with that was a higher rank than her and her reply was that the Assistant General manager was assisting the staff in the breakfast room. So I asked if she could come and speak with me and the clerk said that the Assistant General manager couldnt because the staff levels were low that morning. Surprise Surprise.!!!! At this point I simply expalined my issue with the wake up call and wanted the Assistant General Manager to call me on my cell in the afternoon as I was in a rush to appear for my meeting. At this point i was just so upset as it was the straw that broke the camels back. As the day went on I did not receive a call from anyone at the hotel level and when I returned to the hotel I thought that maybe i would have received a voice mail in my room phone. NOTHING!!!!! I called the front desk and asked to speak to the Assistant General Manager and the clerk told me that she had gone home for the evening. I was asked If I wanted to speak to the front office manager and I jumped at this opportunity as it was a miracle that I got to finally speak with someone so that I could address these issues. As I introduced myself and my means of choosing the hotel and my schedule on business in Toronto I explained my distress from the beginning of check in up till my current experience. The lady seemed to be very helpful and offered me Marriott rewards points. First and foremost this is not why I was calling. If i wanted points then I would have asked. It seemed that she had no recourse and wanted to just offer give aways instead ...what I was looking for was for someone to take ownership of the situations I addressed. Now this was over the phone and she seemed to cut me off almost everytime I was trying to talk or suggest anything. It was quite frusterating and at this point I simply replied with "Thank you for trying to breed the situations at hand but i dont think you simply understand what you are able to do" and I wish you a nice evening". Again I must stress that I travel quite abit and I chose this hotel because I saw the spacious rooms and wanted to try something new. Yes the hotel offers breakfast and internet and dinner some nights of the week but all of these perks are not going to over compensate service. I would rather pay a full room rate and feel welcome and respected. I guess this is what you get when you pay a low rate. All I can say is that I tried this hotel and I will never use it again or reccommend it to any one of my family members, friends or trusted corporate partners. I hope for anyone who travels like me and decides to choose this hotel receives a more professional trial than my collegues and I received. Best of luck!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Blockrockinbeats
Reviews.Content: I don't have many bad things to say about this place to be honest. Starting with getting there - very easy to find, pulled up outside and valet parking attendant was there to take the bags in and park the car. So far so good. Reception area was large, clean and friendly - reception staff were efficient, well presented and polite. Check in took no time at all, and we were in the room on the 8th floor before you know it. The room was large - we paid for a double plus a sofa bed, and the cost was very good value for what we got. The sofa was adequate, after all it is a sofa not a bed, the en-suite is a good size and there is a kitchenette there in case we fancied making a brew or some kind of midnight snack! Breakfast was the only slight let down. The room isn't really that big considering the size of the hotel, and the food wasn't regularly stocked up (buffet style). This is by no means a reason not to go as this is a small gripe - my colleague was more than happy for example, I just like to be given the full range of food available when I want it. This is the only (small) thing that stops me giving it 5 stars. I would stay again, and would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best hotel anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: IntheLight
Reviews.Content: You would not know it from the outside, but Residence Inn is the very best hotel we have stayed in. It has excellent beds and rooms, always spotless. The rooms have fully equipped kitchens, flat screen tv's. The pool, spa and exercise equipment rooms clean and spacious. It is the staff that make RI so unique they are so genuinely welcoming. We had a great hot breakfast buffet each day and, MTW a heavy appetizer party in the lounge. This trip we took our 9 year old grandson. He spent most of the time in the pool. The M-Th bartender is Randolph, he is also a magician and a tireless performer. Thank you Randolph for explaining about the Webkins and showing us how to register the Porcupine! A super visit, and Toronto is pretty nice too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff handled our problems efficiently and promptly”
Reviews.Author: MargaretPowell
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights...on arrival put our food in fridge and did not look at it for 24 hours only to find it spoilt as previous room occupant had turned temp to warm! Staff offered and replaced spoilt food...also only hotel we have stayed at in four weeks holiday that I had to ask for shower cap at reception! Spider web in room..dodgy tv remote and reception...staff here though are fantastic and very cheerful and obliging...in the end I feel this hotel is suffering because of its success nearly 100% occupancy and things start to slide...looking a little bit worn although generally clean...bed ok too! A little out of the way in entertainment area 20 mins walk to shops and market!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Kawdia's attitude at the front desk - NOT TYPICAL MARRIOTT”
Reviews.Author: ITBiztraveller2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked out of this hotel this morning and felt that we were a bother to the front desk person working that morning. I stay over 75 nights per year in hotels and never had attitude like I had checking out. this morning. This was NOT your typical Marriott service. Hotel is very nice, comfortable and great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “great stay in toronto”
Reviews.Author: needhelpwithtrip
Reviews.Content: stayed in hotel for a quick march break getway--we are from toronto but wanted to experience the downtown lviing without driving--great hotel and wonderdful staff-they all were friendly and more than accommodating--great free breakfast and warm pool-they have everything you need and a clean and safe area--would definately stay here if looking for a place to stay to check out the city!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time and better than the first”
Reviews.Author: KarlosPerth
Reviews.Content: Brilliant for business travelling. Large rooms with good internet access. good work area and lounge area. Kitchennete ideal for staying in at night and working. Will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: tallcanadiano
Reviews.Content: I have found myself a home away from my own home,by staying in this hotel.The entire staff is so friendly,helpfull and courteous.The rooms are new,bright and fresh.The room i had on the 19th floor was like condominium with a great full view of the CN Tower, Skydome,and the city skyline.The location of this hotel is great for anyone who wants to be close to the King Street theatre and entertainment district.The price i paid for my room was excellent and i appreciate the free upgrade the friendly front desk attendant gave me to one of the king size rooms.The breakfast is delicious and everything fresh.The pool and fitness area is so clean ,as is everywhere you go in this hotel.I can,t say enough how nice it is to finally have a hotel like this in downtown Toronto.I can,t wait to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: holidaygirl57
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights. Studio apartment was much better than I expected. Had a view of the CN tower, and looked down on Wellington Street. Staff were very friendly. Choice at breakfast amazing, and always topped up. Free coffee and tea all day in takeway paper cups, which I thought a nice touch. This was my first time in Toronto and if coming back will definately stay at the Residence Inn. We booked for the Niagara Falls day trip with Niagaratorontotours.com, and got picked up and dropped off outside our hotel, which was ideal as it was snowing when we arrived back. Plenty of nice little cafes and restaurants in the vicinty and can order takeaways to be delivered to your room

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: rosweed
Reviews.Content: I was so pleasantly surprised by this hotel. I rented it based on price and location. We were going to the Eric Clapton/Jeff Beck show February 21. The staff is very helpful, the hotel is very well maintained, the rooms were large with a full kitchen, big flat screen TV and quiet. The free, full breakfast is buffet style, pretty good and a large selection of things to eat. The bar is small, but Darryl the bartender, was very pleasant, gave us several ideas of things to do and turned us on to Steam Whistle beer. It's a local, organic beer that is even better than my favorite, Heineken. He recommended the Steam Whistle Brewery tour which we enjoyed. The hotel location is within walking distance of everything downtown. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay at the Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: MSUFamily
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 spent 2 nights at the Residence inn and it was one of the best experiences we have had in a big city hotel. The rooms were large and the furniture was very comfortable. One bedroom looked out onto Wellington Street and the other bedroom and living room looked out into a little alley by the hotel. While the views were not great (we couldn't see the CN Tower), we didn't hear any outside noise. All 4 of us enjoyed the buffet breakfast -plenty to choose from with eggs, pancakes, sausage/bacon, cereal, donuts, toast, muffins, yogurt, fruit, coffee, juice, and milk. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is perfect, we walked from the CN Tower and the subway station is only a couple of blocks away. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “FIRST RATE FOR THE SECOND TIME AROUND! SIMPLY INCREDIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter905
Reviews.Content: I have had the opportunity (and fortune) to stay at the Marriott Residence Inn Toronto two times now and both times it has been nothing short of excellent. I couldn't give it higher praise. It is a 3-star hotel that presents itself like a 4-star. From the kitchenette to the free internet to the free hot breakfast buffet (and we ain't talkin continental, we're talking the meat and potatoes, literally) you cannot go wrong. If you are in Toronto be sure to give it a shot!

Reviews.Title: “Great, but...”
Reviews.Author: enzo4me
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at this hotel for family/valentines day weekend based on reviews with my significant other. We arrived at approx 5pm,(check in time is 3) our room was not ready. The front desk had to call housekeeping to ask if there were any studio rooms available on any floor, even though I had asked for a room facing the CN tower. We finally checked into our room 20 minutes later (1st disappointment). We then asked if there was any parking other than the valet parking (at $35/day), they said no, unless we park at another parking lot (2nd disappointment). We noticed that there was a client complaining about the service at check in; at no time time did we hear an apology from staff (3rd disappointment). When unloading our bags from the car at the front of the hotel, the valet staff asked if we needed help, we said no, because we were parking ourselves elsewhere... He then informed us we had to hurry and move our car, which was fairly rude. Our first nights stay, we found the hotel to be a little noisy compared to other downtown city hotels we have visited. We could hear music blasting from an adjacent room. We had finally fallen asleep when at 2:45am the fire alarm went off. Had to walk down 21 flights half asleep. False alarm. Monday, our last day, decided to come down for breakfast later than usual (9:20am) to find that most breakfast items were taken away. The breakfast closes at 9:30am! Although, the did have a sign posting the breakfast hours, this is not the standard due to the long weekend and due to other hotels. Check out process was quick. Glad to be home. Rooms and general property are very clean, and most staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Nivonia
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a number of hotels in Toronto, and this is the best downtown hotel for the money I've found. The hotel is new and clean with fantastic, bright rooms. Because this is a Residence Inn you get a kitchenette as well, but you won't be needing it; the area has some of the best restaurants in the city. In addition, breakfast and an evening "snack" are included in the price of the room. The "snack" can easily be your dinner, too. The only thing I could find to complain about was the lack of Canadian newspapers in the morning. Still, I'd rather stay here and spend the $2 for a newspaper at the corner store.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TheBluetac
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights from 30th January to 5th February with my girlfriend after using tripadivisor. The staff were really friendly and helpful. The room (1912) was hugh and had a great view of the CN Tower. Very Clean. Breakfasts were of a very high quality and basically we couldnt find any faults. It is easy to see why this Hotel is rated No1. Totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, expensive parking!”
Reviews.Author: Sandstorm2010
Reviews.Content: Like the title says, this is a great place and when I found there was a Residence Inn in downtown Toronto, I was thrilled. I love Residence Inns for my family with a kitchen and big rooms, it's ideal. We checked into our 19th floor room and to our surprise, out our window is the Rogers Centre and CN Tower, what a view, especially at night. Room was nice and big as expected and the pool was also very nice. It's a busy hotel but staff were very nice. We did not have breakfast there the next morning, it looked very busy but it's usually very good. We had breakfast at the Hot House CafÃ© on Church St (extremely busy but what a spread!). My only negative (and it's pretty much the same as everywhere downtown) is the parking. Valet only, 35$! At least give me an option to self park for 25$ or something. There are public lots around but with a small child, I can't be looking for a spot. Overall a fantastic place and will surely return again!

Reviews.Title: “So easy to see why its ranked #1”
Reviews.Author: Gina-Gina-Bo-Bina
Reviews.Content: Our family (myself, the husband, and our teenage son) spent three nights/four days at this property in January 2010. We selected the hotel based on the rave reviews it had received on TripAdvisor, and we were not disappointed. The trip to Toronto was to celebrate our son's 14th birthday (taking in a Leafs game, a Raptors game, and some shopping at the Eaton Centre during our stay). We booked a basic king suite, the least expensive room offered at this property. We arrived at 10:30 a.m., well before the hotel check in time of 3 p.m., as the Raptors game started at 1 p.m. We decided to find out if we could park the car before we officially checked in, to avoid having to search (and pay) for parking at the Air Canada Centre. Parking was included with our package rate of $209 per night (this included the room, valet parking, buffet breakfast, and $25 Petro Canada gift card). To our delight, the very friendly and accomodating staff member at the front desk offered to secure us a room right at that moment, so we could unload our belongings and get settled in without having to wait until after the game. Fantastic! She even placed us in a corner room with a view of the CN Tower, to ensure we had as much space as possible. The room was (as others have said) as well laid out and equipped as any apartment I've ever been in. The room was very spacious and had a very "homey" feel. The quality funishings in were in excellent shape, and the full kitchen had everything you could need, including a dishwasher. It was spotlessly clean and maintained. Probably one of the most immaculate rooms we've ever stayed in. We frequented the pool and hot tub area daily. It is small but perfectly adequate, particularly since we never saw another single soul in the pool or hot tub the entire time we were there. Fitness area adjoins the pool, which seemed to be utilized by guests at all times (pool is open until 11 p.m., however the fitness room is 24-hour). Again, these areas were maintained to a fault....they were spotless. Showers were well stocked with shampoo and shower gel, and again immaculately clean. Tons of towels were on hand at all times. Plenty of seating for those not swimming. Beautiful bright lighting overhead. The hot tub was piping hot (sooooo nice!) and the pool temperature was very, very comfortable. The buffet breakfast was absolutely fantastic. Make-your-own waffles (with syrup, fruit sauce and whipped cream for toppings), breakfast potatoes with cheese sauce on the side, bacon and/or sausage, scrambled eggs, hard boiled eggs, hot oatmeal with multiple toppings, fresh whole fruits, fruit salad, cold cereals, yogurt, muffins, donuts, every kind of bread you can think of were unlimited each day. Day two also included pancakes in place of the bacon (sausage was the only meat offered that morning). Three kinds of juices, white milk (with Nestle Quik on the side), coffee and tea were offered as beverages. We always found seating (no difficulties there, as others have reported) though some mornings it was reasonably full. The buffet was replenished quickly and efficiently as supplies dwindled, and the staff was very attentive in cleaning away plates and prepping tables for the next guests. The room itself is very welcoming and inviting, with a large TV set to local news and traffic. We found the valets to be fast, friendly, and extremely helpful in loading and unloading our belongings. Our car appeared within moments of requesting it. Always a genuine smie and a kind wish for a good day in Toronto. Location wise, it was perfect. A very easy 10-15 minute walk to Union Station and the Air Canada Centre. The walk to the Eaton Centre was longer, but still doable (cold in January though, would recommend this for warmer weather!!!). We saved ourselves a bundle on parking by simply walking where we needed to go. Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday evenings, there is a light buffet served in the breakfast room in the evenings. We frequented this "Manager's Reception" on the Monday evening, and induldged in mini hamburgers with all the fixings, grilled chicken skewers, falafel, cold pop, coffee and tea, homemade cookies, and nanaimo bars. The menus for each Monday/Tuesday/Wednesday night for the current month are handily listed on the fridge in each room, so you'll know ahead of time if you're interested in what they're serving. The Tuesday evening we were there, it was "Sports Night" and they offered bratwurst, pretzels, veggie dogs, etc. Other themes included soup night, fajitas, etc. All complimentary to guests. Wireless internet was free, easy to connect to, fast and reliable. There is a small business centre next to the Fitness room with two computers available, and a 15-minute time limit posted. Children are prohibited from this room. The day we checked out, we chatted on the way home about what I would say in our review of this hotel. We gushed to each other about how bright and clean the property was, how perfectly is was located in the downtown, how friendly everyone was (from the cleaning staff to the front desk). So when I asked the hubby and son what NEGATIVES they could come up with, the car became very quiet. After a few moments, my son said quiety...."well Mom, I guess if I could find one bad thing, I'd say that the cheese sauce on the breakfast buffet could have been warmer". If that's the only thing we could find wrong, I'd say we picked a winner. Congrats Residence Inn Toronto Downtown, you have three more loyal customers. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and stunning view”
Reviews.Author: Coffeaddict
Reviews.Content: We had a room overlooking the CN Tower and skyline views of Toronto Harbor. The kitchen was great and there are numerous food stores nearby as well as fantastic restaurants. We also appreciated having a laundry on-site. It was a short walk to the train station to hire a car to drive to the Niagara Falls area. The staff were very friendly and obliging and quickly provided any extra items we needed. One note for travelers. Bottle shops close on Thanksgiving Sunday at 6pm and we were surprised to find that the bar near the lobby closed as well.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: owensyb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel from 18th December through to 2nd January 2010. We met the most friendly and professional staff who could not do enough for us. This trip was a surprise for my son and the hotel assisted us in every way they could to make it special. We had a suite [king size bed and queen size pull out and kitchenette] on 18th floor looking out at the CN tower. It was spotlessly clean, lots of lovely fluffy white towels every day and the housekeeping staff were great at getting extra towels if we needed them. Breakfast was buffet style with plenty of variety to suit all tastes. It was busy over the christmas period with an Islamic convention and it was difficult to get a table for the couple of days, however it was possible to bring your breakfast to your own room if you didnt want to wait for a table. Leisure centre with pool and separate exercise room was small but well maintained and very clean. Again lovely fluffy white towels. No restriction on hours of use - pool was open till 11 pm and exercise room open 24/7. Access is by your room key card. There was a wash room on the 17th floor with 2 washers and 2 dryers and a detergent dispenser - wash and tumble dryer cost 2 dollars each and powder dispenser was 1 dollar for each product. It was also accessible by your room key card. The hotel reception staff were wonderful and helpful in every way - from maps of the city,suggesting places to see, eat, ttc information, taxis etc. They also stored my 11 yr old daughters christmas present for us till christmas eve. Yan at Reception was Mr. Wonderful and helped make our holiday very special. Shawn, Paul & Kevin were also wonderful as were all the staff but these 4 were our main contacts throughout our holiday. We had a bit of a scare on New Years Eve/Day at 2 am when the Fire Alarms were set off on the 11th floor [by young revellers staying at the hotel]. My 11 year old was a little upset but the staff handled the situation with calm professionalism and everything settled down as soon as the Fire Chief had given the all clear. This incident was not of the hotels making but they dealt with it without fuss and kept us advised of what was happening. The area is quiet but exactly what we had wanted. Within a couple of minutes walk to the entrance of the CN tower and Rogers Centre and a further 5 minutes walk to the Quay area. Our nearest subway was at St. Andrews and was easily accessible by the path just a few hundred metres away from us in the Metro /Roy Thomson Hall. We did ice skating every day at the Queens Quay Natrel Rink and a couple of times at the Nathan Phillips Square. Hire of skates was $7 CAD at the quay and $9 at Nathan Phillips. Both well worth the money. Family day pass on the subway was only $9 and it was a great way to travel. Did all the sights on the City Pass. Again well worth the money. Will definitely re-visit and will definitely stay at the Marriott Residence Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property and Outstanding Staff”
Reviews.Author: crango
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the other reviews capture the hotel's ambiance, but what they can't convey is the professionalism of the great staff at the Residence Inn. Started with check-in, when seeing that we were a family of four (two daughters in their 20's wanting to do a mini-vacation with parents...nice), guest services representative offered a complimentary upgrade to a two-bedroom suite, and he did so with great pleasure. Later, I thanked him for doing so, and he replied, "If I can make someone's stay better, I'll do all I can to do so." That attitude carried over to every staff member I met over three days, from desk, to housekeeping, to maintenance, to management. Award winning approach to customer service. The hotel itself is very comfortable. Our suite was the biggest hotel room in which I've ever stayed; two-bedrooms (one with King bed, other with Queen), two bathrooms, two vanity areas (important with two "20-somethings"). Had to have been close to 1000 square feet. Breakfast was, as others noted, indeed crowded at times, but that's pretty much the norm at most Residence Inn's, if they're running close to a full house. Hotel is two or three blocks from most restaurants, small grocers, and the Provincial liquor/beer/wine store. About 1 1/2 blocks from the nearest subway stop, which will whisk you all over Toronto. Parking is expensive, but I found a parking garage about a 10 minute walk from hotel for $12 per 24 hour period. For me, a 10-12 minute stroll is worth saving $23 per night on a three night stay. With a wonderful staff, comfortable rooms, a full kitchen in suite, why would anyone stay anywhere else in Toronto?

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at the Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: Kappa1991
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Residence Inn Toronto Downtown. We arrived after a grueling 8 hour drive from NY to the hotel. We were greeted at the door by the doorman who helped us with all of our luggage and advised us about parking options. We decided to valet our car, but there are numerous parking lots all around the hotel. I checked in at the front desk quickly and we were then directed to our room on the 20th floor. The room was HUGE! The room had a king size bed, 2 lounging chairs, a desk and chair, a pull out couch and a full kitchen with a dining table and chairs. The room was spotless and smelled fresh and clean. The heat was up very high when we arrived. We turned the thermostat down to 67 degree F, and we were still quite comfortable. The bedding was clean and warm, and the bed was roomy and comfortable. The bathroom was large with an amazing shower head. I have very thick hair, and it was so easy to rinse the soap and conditioner out of my hair with the water pressure from the shower head. My children swam in the pool. It was small, but good enough for a swim. My husband enjoyed the hot tub, which he found very relaxing. There was a gym right off the pool area which was small and had a couple of machines and some weights. There was also an office with a couple of computers in the same area. I only had two complaints about the hotel ... One was the towels in the room. They consistantly left only 3 towels in the bathroom when we had 4 guests. Two was the free breakfast. It;s a great concept, but unfortunately, we never got a chance to enjoy it because it was so crowded. We could not get anywhere near the buffet area. The room where breakfast is served is VERY small and cannot accomodate the number of guests in a 22 floor hotel. Parking did cost $35 per night if you valeted your car. Wayne Gretsky's restaurant is right around the corner, and the Hockey Hall of Fame is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. We ate dinner at Jack Astor's Bar & Grill where we had delicious food in a fun and festive atmosphere. Beyond these two complaints, I have nothing bad to say about the hotel. The staff was friendly, the rooms were spacious and comfortable and the facilities were modern. I wou

Reviews.Title: “Our Hockey trip visit”
Reviews.Author: bhballbzhom
Reviews.Content: There is a reason this place is #1. It is well-deserved. Great location for hockey fans, within easy walking distance to the important stuff. The game, Hockey Hall of Fame, and Wayne Gretzky's restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better!”
Reviews.Author: paulstevo1978
Reviews.Content: All the other reviews say it all! We stayed for 4 nights in a studio room. Room was huge with fully fitted kitchen, lounge area with large flat screen TV, huge bed and seperate wash facilities and bathroom. Staff were very friendly recommending places to eat and drink. Being in the entertainment district its a short walk from many bars and restaurants (would recommend Jo Mamas for good food at a reasonable price with live music). Breakfast was great. I nipped down every morning to pick up a selection of sausage, bacon and egg to make McD style muffins in the room to fill up before a long days activities. In a nutshell I wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else in Toronto and will definately stay here again when I return.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELENTE - AMAZING!!! NEED TO STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: PaoBA
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Location is unbelievable. But even better is the staff in the hotel. Absolutely everything was perfect during our stay. Extra friendly staff, complimentary breakfast, free internet, very clean and comfy bedroom. We definetely LOVED it. You have great restaurants within walking distance. A place we will always remember!

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel!”
Reviews.Author: przybylski1
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly, breakfast was good, rooms were reasonably spacious for a city, also very quiet

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay again!”
Reviews.Author: vividexpression
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel for one night the weekend of Thanksgiving. We were placed on the 15th floor which had an awesome view of the CN Tower. The location is perfect - close to the train and bus stations, 2 subway stations, the CN Tower, and restaurants. Everything about our experience at The Marriott was excellent. The doorman hailed us cabs, the front staff helped us with directions to the subway, and the staff even provided a sticky roller for my boyfriend's cat-hairy dress shirt. The room was immaculately clean and the amenities were great. There was popcorn, tea, and coffee in a basket in the room. There is no room service, but there was a huge booklet of various take-out we could have ordered in, in addition to the few snacks available to purchase in the downstairs lobby. We also made use of the ironing board and iron. Everything in the room was clean and looked brand new. We also liked the pool and hot tub. There was a work-out room and a room with computers as well. The breakfast buffet was fantastic. It had a huge variety of food and we did not leave hungry! It was a little busy, but I was able to grab us a table and we didn't care too much that the room was packed. I kind of enjoyed the buzz and excitement of breakfast. If you're looking for a quiet, sit down meal, take your breakfast upstairs to your room. Overall, A+ service, room, and food. I can't wait to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: drewie79
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in October at this property and glad I did!! Ellen greeted me upon my arrival and checked me in, she was fantastic. Every staff member who i encountered greeted me with a smile, including the housekeeper on my floor who would ask if I required any extra amenities when she saw me in the hall. Fantastic breakfast buffet in the mornings and a small, but great fitness center and pool to work it off in. The location is in the heart of the Entertainment district, close to all the theatres. Its a 10 minute walk to the TTC (subway), and about a 20-25 minute walk to Eaton Centre. *Travelling TIP: Transportation to the hotel from Pearson can be $$$. Taxi is about $50cdn,... If you do not have a lot of luggage, I recommend taking the Airporter $18/19 one way) to the Intercontinental Hotel on Front Street. and walk 3-4 blocks to the Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous rooms”
Reviews.Author: Aissum
Reviews.Content: We only stayed in this hotel for two nights but really wish we could have stayed for longer. We were in a suite on the 21st floor and have to say it was amazing. Huge rooms, very clean and a superb view of Toronto down town and the CN Tower. The hotel does valet parking which is very good and came included in our rate. Also they do a cars eat free deal which included $25 of gas with your stay. Well recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: davidkaren86
Reviews.Content: We visited Toronto for my husband to attend a conference at the Toronto Convention Centre, less than two blocks away. We enjoyed our weeklong stay at the Marriott Residence Inn Toronto / Entertainment District immensely. This hotel is a treasure in many respects, but the location is PERFECT. The location is easily accessible to subway stations (four blocks), streetcar (one block), grocery store (one block), drug store (two blocks), restaurants, local theater, the Rogers Centre and CN Tower. Second to the excellent location would be the high quality of the staff - - incredible! Every interaction with each employee was friendly, professional and helpful. A clear negative would be the $35.00 daily hotel parking fee. We found Toronto's public transportation to be efficient, clean and safe, and we didn't miss driving in the Toronto traffic madness! Our guest room was on the 21st floor and offered quite comfortable accommodations. The room layout is ideal and spacious for a hotel room. We did not utilize the kitchen fully, but we did enjoy using the refrigerator and microwave in our room. A small kitchen table, coffeemaker, business desk with free high speed internet, reclining lounge chair and ottoman, sofa, movable wide screen tv, luxury bed linens, room safe, iron/ironing board, blowdryer, and complimentary toiletries rounded out the comforts of home. Spotless and clean throughout. Hotel lobby pluses included daily dispensers of fruit infused ice water, complimentary coffee and hot tea, complimentary daily newspaper, cash bar and large screen television, comfortable seating, complimentary daily breakfast, occasional evening hospitality snacks and drinks, and always helpful staff. We would enjoy a return trip to this hotel on our next visit to Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Simply a great choice in Toronto...”
Reviews.Author: MikeH98
Reviews.Content: Lots has been written about this hotel so no need to repeat. All I would add is that I went with high expectations and was not disappointed. To me it meets all the criteria - great location close to downtown, CN Tower and restaurants, extremely friendly staff, clean and spacious rooms, a gym/pool, ok breakfasts and reasonable city value. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “eat-in-kitchen hotel”
Reviews.Author: urufenta
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very new and clean. The room has a full kitchen, mine had a very comfortable king bed. Service was excellent, and breakfast above what you expect for a chain hotel, below standard for a good, non chain establishment. It belongs to this new trend of sleep-in-kitchen. I do not want to move in, I am only there for a few nights, thank you. That way I will avoid finding mothers with heavy pots full of soup in the elevator. If you are moving in with your kids, definitely a good choice. If you are an adult traveling with adults with no interest in cooking while away from home, I would stay away from it.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service! great location!”
Reviews.Author: josieontheroad
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 2 weeks while visiting relatives in toronto when after a few days i fell ill with influenza! and while i had to stay in bed for more than a week, housekeeping kept me going with cans of soup! they just brought it in without my asking for it and free of charge! i'm a seasoned traveller but have never experienced such a dedicated housekeeping team! we had booked a two bedroom suite with a pullout sofa , the suite was well equiped , big comfy beds and even popcorn for the microwave! we go back every two years to catch up with our relatives and are already looking forward to staying the the residence inn again in 2010!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FloridaBeaconess
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not listed in our convention brochure and most of our collegues stayed at adjoining hotels. The short walk to and from the Convention Center was well worth it to stay at the Residence Inn and our friends envied our choice. The rooms were spacious and quiet. It was wonderful to have a kitchen area, although I didn't prepare any real meals. The free breakfast and the afternoon snacks were always great. It was obvious that the staff were dedicated and cared about the image of the Residence Inn. It was easy to get to the airport shuttle stop, right around the corner. We found several restaurants we enjoyed within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding property!”
Reviews.Author: cooltool74
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in a queen suite. Very spacious, clean and modern. No room service, but kitchen facitilities in the suite and a free, amazing hot buffet breakfast and free wireless internet. The staff is great and personable. It's in the business/entertainment district and within walking distance to all major attractions (and hospitals which was the purpose of my visit). I would highly recommend this hotel for any type of traveller and really looking forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!”
Reviews.Author: rmurgas
Reviews.Content: We were in Toronto celebrating our first anniversary. Since we got to the hotel, we were impressed by the quality and personalized service. Starting with the doorman, and with the desk lady who was so helpful in telling us how to get the best out of our short visit. The hotel lobby was very nice and clean, with super high speed elevators. We stayed in a studio on the 21st level, with an spectacular view of the city and the CN Tower. The room was spotless, roomy and very cozy. Once we got to our room, we dropped our bags and took off to start walking around the city. When we got back, they have left a bottle of wine, an assortment of nuts and a greeting card signed by the entire staff wishing us a happy anniversary. This almost made us cry. We were about 3,000 miles away from home, and we felt the warmth of being with our loved ones. We cannot thank them enough. The hotel location is perfect. You are at walking distance from restaurants, the CN Tower, Rogers Centre, Shows, Shopping, Old Toronto, etc. Breakfast and Internet is included. Parking was included in our rate, but if you are staying in Toronto, you do not need a car. We had one because we were going t Niagara Falls, which is about 1 hour and 20 minutes drive. If our life journey takes us back to Toronto, we would not consider any other hotel than this one. AAAAA++++++

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TerriFountain
Reviews.Content: We booked the Residence Inn through the Marriot web site, it's cheaper. We were greated by very friendly door and desk staff. Our room was a 1 bedroom suite which was large, very well equipped and very clean. We chose the Residence Inn because of it's location and the reviews on tripadvisor, we we not dissappointed. The breakfasts are good and, although sometime it could be crowded, the staff coped well and cheerfully with restocking. One of the reasons we went to Toronto was to celebrate our wedding anniverary and we wanted to take in a show. The desk staff couldn't do enough for us, they booked two very good seats at the Jersey Boys show for our anniversary night and also gave us a card and bottle of wine, nice touch. We went to the bar on a few occasions and met Randolph the magician, already mentiond in previous reviews, we watched his tricks intently but couldn't figure out how he was doing it! we found him very entertaining. We also would like to mention Kevin the other bar man who was less flamboyant than Randolph but always quietly attentive and very professional. All the staff are friendly, which is not just your 'have a nice day' friendly but it really feels sincere. We very much enjoyed our 10 days at the Residence Inn and won't stay anywhere else when we next visit in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Everything about this hotel is brilliant”
Reviews.Author: mopette
Reviews.Content: Definitely one of the best family friendly hotels we have ever stayed in. From the day we arrived to the day we left, everything was perfect. We had a one bedroom suite which was fantastic with small children. The room was spotless, so well stocked, and quiet. Staff were always friendly, the free internet access worked superbly and the included breakfast was fantastic. As we were there for a full week, we used the onsite laundry facilities several times and they were a huge bonus - never any waiting and always clean and working. The location is great as everything is within walking distance or a short streetcar ride. I can see why this hotel ranks number 1 in Toronto â€“ it deserves it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Just-retired-couple
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were visiting Toronto, and wanted somewhere that we could relax after the Transatlantic flight. I'd found this hotel through Expedia, although I actually booked direct through the Marriott website as itw as actually cheaper that way. We wanted a downtown hotel, so that we could visit many of central Toronto's attractions, museums and so on. We couldn;t have made a better choice. From the moment we arrived, and left the hire car to be parked, our stay was simply easy. The room had space but was not stark; the kitchen was well set up, and the coffee from the coffee maker was really very drinkable. Breakfast was included, and offered a wide selection of choices, from porridge (many stars for offering this) to egss, bacon, sausages, and the ability to make your waffles just as you like. It has no proper restaurant or bar, but it was so close to such a range of these that this was a positive advantage - why try to do what others probably do better, and certainly better priced. The staff were unobtrusive, but very helpful at all times, and though the hotel was pretty full - we were there during the TIFF - everything was done smoothly and with no fuss at all. We stayed 3 nights, and I have stayed in suite hotels many times, but this was the best on three continents, and its value for money was good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome & Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jennicula
Reviews.Content: We went for two nights last December.. and it was GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “all good-location, rooms, breakfast,”
Reviews.Author: Eddie_the_Litho
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 3 days, 2 nights, did the 24 hour valet option for the extra $$. As much as I hate to pay to park, it was a nice convienence my wife, I and 2 daughters (7 &12). Good clean room , kitchen, etc. great for walking to most places.really good breakfast buffet in the morning. Pool was what was expected. nothing too big, but big enough for the kids to float around and be on top of other guest. The only mild negative was one of the 3 elevators was broken the whole time, which lead to some queues during peak time, but not a deal breaker. we enjoyed it. I think the hotel should look into some rooms with 2 queen beds as an option, instead of king in the bedroom with a pull out couch. just a suggestion.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant place - superb staff”
Reviews.Author: tescoqueen
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic place to stay in toronto. We stayed 4 nights with two kids aged 6, and it was superb. The rooms are spacious with a kitchen (no washing machine) and a huge bed. The bathroom has a seperate mirror/sink area so two can get ready at same time - great if there are 4 of you. Although the rooms are great, what really makes this place is the attitide of the staff....tey go above and beyond duty..every single one of them. If you have a problem, Charlene on reception is wonderful - she sorted something out fir us that really was nothing to do with the hotel at all. Brilliant service. The breakfast is the best free one weve ever had, and the seating issue seems resolved. All in all, superb hotel - stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Very good with a few hitches”
Reviews.Author: crossrock
Reviews.Content: This is definitely an above-average hotel with the following great features: -unusually friendly service -relaxed atmosphere -outstanding location -great value -comfortable beds with selection of pillows -good food -windows open in the rooms! -fully-functional kitchen with a big fridge -when you dial guest services, they answer right away! A few "average" aspects: -pool is nice but too small for laps and (over?)loaded with chlorine -business center is a tiny little room -fitness center is just a few cardio machines with some free weights -wireless connection not consistent enough for Skype voice calls Now for the bad news... When the hotel is full ... the cleaning & maintenance staff have to use the guest elevators due to overloading. 10+ stops going up and down can be REALLY annoying! Also, there's a 10-15 minute lineup for breakfast during the peak periods. Dealbreakers? Not really, but I would think twice before booking at Christmas-time or other packed periods. Otherwise, the courteous service generally makes up for the shortcomings and the place is very well managed. When you need something, they get right onto it.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location with great kitchens”
Reviews.Author: weatherheads
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in August. Excellent location next to the CN Tower. Lovely room with full kitchen - handy with young children - excellent deli round the corner which made preparing meals easier etc. - less stressful than taking youngsters to restaurants. Absolutely superb breakfast each morning. Courteous staff throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Entertainment District”
Reviews.Author: mlcw
Reviews.Content: I couldn't agree more with most of the reviewers posted. We stayed based on the recommendations through TripAdviser and were not disappointed. The hotel has a great location near Union Station, metro and trams, and there are tons of theatres in the area for music, musicals, etc. The CN Tower is also nearby. Rooms are spacious, clean, nicely equipped and very comfortable and quiet. The majority of the noise we heard came from water running when people shower or use the sinks which seem to be a bit on the noisey side. You will have a full kitchen and the bath is large enough with a separate sink/vanity area. The decor is modern enough and beds comfortable. The free breakfast is average at best and comes with a multitude of people and children. So, the hotel is certainly great for families or business people traveling with their families. It would seem that folks can fill up plates and take food back to their rooms, which I found a bit odd and distasteful, but that's apparently standard protocol here. All in all a very pleasant place to stay, aside from the zoo in the morning for breakfast. I understand there is free food between 6-7pm on certain evenings, but we chose not to partake. Therefore, I have no first hand information on these events. We would most likely stay here again should we return to Toronto in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: CJO71
Reviews.Content: The Residence Inn was great. Very central to lots of things but the people working there were what made the stay so enjoybale. Leyla at the front desk was so helpful in guiding us as to what to do and never without a big smile on her face. Franco at the valet was so friendly and helpful and since he was our very frist imprerssion of the Residence Inn it certainly was a good one. The breakfast was great but again the staff was wonderful. Kemika (sp) was so helpful and warm and it certainly made for an enjoyable breakfast time with our family. The rooms were clean and modern. The parking charge was the only downfall at $35 a day. It would be better to include it in the room price.

Reviews.Title: “Very good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: SydneyMary
Reviews.Content: We had a two bed suite in the hotel and found it to be very nice, the view from some of the windows was a little unforgiving, but I guess you can't have everything. The location was very good close to shops, restaurants and not far from the CN Tower. The staff were very helpful and the breakfast very good. Overall I would have no hesitation in recommending the Residence Inn Toronto Downtown/Entertainment District.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.”
Reviews.Author: 123me
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times since it opened. I love the location, and the kitchenette in the rooms makes any hotel stay so much more comfortable. Of course, one can never complain about complementary breakfast! The staff has always been super friendly and helpful, from the maintenance and housekeeping staff, to the front desk and valet. Every time I go to Toronto I look forward to staying there!

Reviews.Title: “top rated property has some limitations”
Reviews.Author: Sunbu
Reviews.Content: A four night stay for fun and a convention. Chosen in large part from ranking here. I would stay here again, but there are some limits to consider. As an honest reviewer, I must include the swill with the swell. ... On arrival, I was driving and couldn't spot the hotel entrance before circling the block a few times. (Hint, drive south on Wellington and stay in the left hand curb lane). There is only a small marquee and no one was outside. You have to onload at curbside, and at 4pm there were only three porter/valet parkers for the hotel. The lobby is so small that two families checking in at the same time would fill it. More about the public areas: There is a breakfast-reception area which sports free food every morning, plus buffet dinner on Monday thru Wed nights (Not on Thursday now). The food is very good! A frugal family could eat a big (good) breakfast and a decent early dinner here Mon-Wed and not spend another thing on chow. And unlike most free hotel buffets, the hotel allows and even encourages guests to take food back to the room. On the minus side of this, the area gets crowded, and one might share an elevator with folks balancing their heaping plates of food. One more thing about the crowded public spaces. Besides the lobby and food area, there is a small bar open until 11pm. All of these areas are served by only two one-person toilets. And, the poor concierge has her little desk jammed in between these two toilet entrances. In summary, one should not expect a high level of service, or elegance and formality at this hotel.
