If this were a blog I would expect to be flamed at this point. But in my defense, I will assert that I smile at everyone, enjoy the multi-kid families (who all also seemed smiling at their travels to this hotel) and tip happily. But there are so many pluses here. The rooms are large, very well equipped, clean, well decorated, quiet, with nice beds and linens. All of the staff are friendly. The maids arrive every morning to clean, and do the dishes too. The hotel is very close to baseball and convention center. The hotel information book recommends the Kit Kat, a happily crowded small mid-level Italian restaurant around the corner, which was so to our liking that we dined there three times. Try the mussels. For joggers, trot south on Spadina and then go west on the bike trail. As far as you want. I made it to Humber Bay parks, but I think you can run another dozen miles at least...The fitness center at the hotel has eight high-end machines, small pool and hot tub. So...other local hotels have the breathtaking lobbies and fuller service and this Residence Inn will be a better or worse choice for you, depending. Jim back in Ohio

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience ... Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: St._Louie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Residence Inn for three nights and found it to be a clean and comfortable! The staff were very helpful and attentive to any requests. The free buffet breakfast was pretty good ... but get their early! Request a room on the east side for a great view of the CN Tower at night! Some connecting rooms. Hotel is completely non-smoking. The location is a short walk to the CN Tower (recommend making reservations for a leisurely and rewarding dinner in the 360 Restaurant) and Rogers Center. You can get to the Distillery District (great restaurants and pubs) and waterfront for @$12 CAD with tip. Casa Loma is @ $15 CAD with tip. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel for Families with Children”
Reviews.Author: SoCalTraveler94
Reviews.Content: Based on recent reviews on TripAdvisor, we booked a room at the Residence Inn and were not disappointed at all. This is a great hotel. We loved the location, the room, the staff, the breakfast buffet and happy hour -- everything was terrific. The central location is close to the subway and walking distance to many of Toronto's vibrant neighborhoods. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but why rated #1?”
Reviews.Author: CarolF45
Reviews.Content: Based on the #1 Trip Advisor rating, I expected this hotel to be something special. It was okay, staff was nice, good location; I don't have any complaints, it just wasn't anything special. Walking aroung Toront, we saw lots of hotels that looked a lot nicer and in better locations. We could have booked a 4 star on Hotwire for a lot less money and I think it would have been just as good if not better.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with a good value”
Reviews.Author: CMLC
Reviews.Content: Though it is located at a small street and right in front of an electrical distribution plant, which is not the most attractive view, on the other hand we have a beautiful view of the CN Tower. Overall nice location. Nice staff, nice service, complimentary social meetings at night. We had even some free food. Not a real dinner, but it is complimentary!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, in a very convenient area”
Reviews.Author: joeintheuk
Reviews.Content: Two couples, we stayed in a 2 bedroom suite which was preferable to us than staying in two separate rooms. It was also cheaper than 2 separate rooms plus more convenient. One room had an ensuite, the other a bathroom right across the small hallway within the suite, so very similar to having your own facilities for each couple. Or if you had kids and they could share a bed (both rooms had a large double bed, I am not sure if any of the beds can be split into twins or there are some with twin beds?) you would find it better than having the kids in a different room, and much more spacious than one room with a couple of extra beds crammed in. We didn't use it much but there was also a very impressive kitchen facility so were you a family with kids this would be a great place to cater for yourself or just eat in with catered food (there was a menu provided of local places that would deliver). Very large refrigerator, plus cooker, microwave. Some evenings (not sure how many) there was free food provided from about 530 to 7 which could mean you could even skip dinner if you wanted, breakfasts were very good (and included in our room rate.) The breakfast area got pretty busy but we did always (just) manage to get a table, really its a little on the small side if the hotel is full as it was when we were there and I did see a few people having got their breakfast take it up to their rooms so you could always do that if you preferred it, or pick a time outside the "rush hour" of 830 through 9. In the immediate area is the CN Tower, a baseball park (Rogers Centre/BlueJays) a very nice 'clubby' area a couple of blocks away with clubs, restaurants, bars and a very good vibe. The Eton centre was about 20 minutes walk away. Other places like the RO museum and the renovated brewery area were a $15-$20 cab ride. Reception was friendly and check-in efficient, the rooms were kept very clean by a good maid service. I booked directly with the hotel on the Marriott website, we paid about $370 Canadian per night for our double suite, it was the same price at other websites I looked. There were cheaper hotels in Toronto but none that had as nice 2 bedroom suites that I could find. Our rate included breakfast for 4 adults, free valet parking for our stay, and some RO museum tickets. Compared to other places and taking the cost of extras such as breakfast and parking, that seemed like a good deal especially given the excellent location. There were some PC's provided with printing capability (we checked in online from them and printed out our return boarding passes) but at times internet access was so slow as to be useless and we had to come back a few hours later (annoying when you are trying to grab some good seats on a flight otherwise wouldn't really have mattered). Also a small gym and swimming pool neither of which were usually busy when I looked. I was to stay in Toronto again, it will almost certainly be here.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel & Staff”
Reviews.Author: Traybella
Reviews.Content: We attended the AC/DC concert at the Roger's Centre in January...the hotel is a stones throw away, maybe a 4 minute walk. We arrived early, about noon and as requested we had a top floor room facing the CN Tower. The room was immaculate, beautifully furnished and extremely comfortable. The beds are to die for, even the sofabed, none of us wanted to get up in the morning. The staff, from the valets to the Front Desk were very polite and friendly. The breakfast was wonderful in the morning with a great selection. I will never stay at another hotel in Toronto...the Residence Inn is it for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great room amenities”
Reviews.Author: snshn3
Reviews.Content: Wes stayed at this hotel for two nights and we had a great room overlooking the CN Tower. The location and the amenities of the hotel were great, really. The breakfast buffet was very generous and the staff was very accomodating. Even though we did not use the kitchen much, it was nice to have a refridgerator for late night snacks. I rate this hotel an A+

Reviews.Title: “The Best !!”
Reviews.Author: ali-alahmed
Reviews.Content: If you are planning to spend some days in toronto make Residence Inn Toronto Downtown your first chose. You will enjoy your stay from the moment that you check in till check out. Great location you will be close to most of the attractions in the city. Rooms are so nice and clean with fully equiped kitchen. The only notice that the place for breakfast dining was small and hardly can fit for to many people.

Reviews.Title: “Family Plan really worked”
Reviews.Author: paulpierce
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended for families with kids and teens. We enjoyed our stay at the Residence Inn and enjoyed the Niagara Falls too. The rooms were full equiped and really were confortable for us to enjoy our stay with numerous members. We were closed to Rogers Centre and to the CN Tower. The price was quite good for the four of us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JSMunn
Reviews.Content: Well run, modern hotel in convenient location. Nothing special but everything works smoothly from check in to check out, hotel is kept clean, free breakfast is not bad, and there's free snacks most evenings between 6 and 7. The staff really do make an effort. Free wireless and wired internet. I'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Mikey90
Reviews.Content: Comfortable and hassle free stay at a fabulous hotel! What we paid - $72 a night! What we got: Very friendly staff Clean and well planned rooms Spectacular view of the CN tower Free breakfast Just a 12 minute walk from the subway station All this for a very affordable price ! Can't beat that!! Only improvement I can see is that the parking rates could be made more competitive to other parking lots around the hotel. Regardless this is a great place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet and close to the major attractions”
Reviews.Author: Sarah2359
Reviews.Content: This was an awesome hotel. The hotel staff were polite, but didn't try to smother you. We had a king room overlooking the CN tower, Rogers centre, etc. It was clean and all the furniture was new and modern looking. The little kitchen was beautiful, it's a shame we didn't use it. It had a two burner cooktop, little diswasher, microwave. It would be great for an extended stay, but also handy for a short getaway. The breakfast was good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great -- average place, average stay, average hotel.”
Reviews.Author: alxfdz
Reviews.Content: When I read the reviews of this place, I thought "wow, I'm not going to look at any other hotels in Toronto, I've found the one." Well, I should have looked at other hotels. This hotel is good. O.K.? I am not going to say a single negative thing about it. The rooms are pretty. The service is good. The people are nice. The food for breakfast is good. All-in-all, the hotel is a solid Residence Inn experience. It does not, however, warrant anything above an average rating. Yes, it is new. Yes, it is sparkly. But, please, this is a Residence Inn, without Concierge Service (although the front desk does try -- knowledge depends on who is at the front desk), and without the other amenities of a "grand" hotel that would warrant a "five star" rating. Again, this is a good hotel. It is just not a great one. You get exactly what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Almost home from home!”
Reviews.Author: berges
Reviews.Content: Myself, husband and two teenage boys stayed here for 4 nights in April and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves! Our room was enormous and although we didn't use the kitchen it was very well equipped. The hotel seemed to be being cleaned constantly and my request for extra blankets and towels was sorted immediately. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful - booking restaurants etc. The boys loved the wi-fi and the computer room. Breakfast was well organised, the food good and plenty of choice - the waffles were our favourites! The only small negative was that the sofa bed was not particularly comfortable for the children - they were comparing it with other hotels during that holiday. All in all a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great service, great location.”
Reviews.Author: ioj27
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four days in downtown Toronto with a family, including two teenagers (girl & boy). The hotel is conveniently located within three blocks of Rogers Centre, which was important to us because we were attending a couple of baseball games while in town. The area is close to many, many nice restaurants as well. The hotel itself is nice, but a bit expensive. The benefits for us included the option for having a two-bedroom suite, which was excellent - clean, nice size, three TV's, small kitchen area, etc. This allowed us to buy some snacks and soft drinks and we kept them in the full-sized refrigerator. The only negative was the breakfast area. The food was good, American-style with eggs, sausage, waffle maker, etc. However, the area for sitting is very small. We had to fight for table space every morning. One morning we simply got our food and went back to our room. The service in the hotel is excellent. We were helped several times by the reception desk staff, who gave us good advice each time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service and beautiful room at a good price”
Reviews.Author: frugalm0m
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on tripadvisor and booked through Marriott directly (150CAD) per night. The hotel is conveniently located to sites (2 blocks from CN Tower and 6 blocks from Chinatown). The hotel has a fitness center, pool, hot tub and business center. The hotel is only 2 years old and everything (furniture, walls, decorations) is spotless and pristine. The room was large (L-shaped) with a bed area, living room area (pull out sleeper sofa, chair, 2 desks, large flat screen tv) and full kitchen. The kitchen had a full size fridge, cooktop, microwave and sink -- some rooms have ovens!). I don't cook when we travel, but I love a big fridge and microwave. The kitchen was equipped with cutlery, plates, pots, pans, etc.) It was well stocked and was cleaned every day! Amazingly, the hotel staff will shop groceries for you (at no charge!) if you leave them a list of items you desire (obviously, you pay for the groceries . . .). The breakfast was fantastic (scrambled eggs or omelette, sausage or bacon, yogurt, fruit salad, pieces of fruit, many cereals, granola, oatmeal, breads, waffle or pancake or french toast). The food is plentiful and well stocked for the entire time (they continue to fill the warming trays past closing time!) The eating area is kept tidy by a terrific staff of "busboys" who were very friendly and recognized us each day. On Monday, Tuesday and Wednesday evenings (6-7:30pm) the hotel hosts a reception for guests, which we thought meant cheese, crackers and crudites. We were amazed at the spread they provided: eg., lamb stew with rice, vegetables, salad, brownies and cookies; or chicken wings, steak fries, salad, crudites, cole slaw, potato salad, brownies and cookies. Some nights are BBQ night or pizza night! Last, the staff is unbelievably helpful and friendly. We travel a lot, and we had never received such great service. They gave us complete information for sites, directions and recommended restaurants. But more surprisingly, they often came out from behind the counter to help during breakfast and reception time. The general manager (I didn't know he was the general manager at the time) got the high chair for my daughter one morning! The assistant general manager cleared plates with the "busboys" to help clear tables during busy breakfasts. The camaraderie among the staff is evident, and the friendliness towards the guests was greatly appreciated!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything and fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: Frade
Reviews.Content: Easy walking distance to all the main entertainment venues, plus a short walk into the fashion, restaurant and shopping districts. Or, the underground is also close enough to walk to (few blocks). Some great restaurant just a few steps away. The room was far larger than we expected for a Downtown apartment. Full kitchen, lounge, bathroom... the lot. The free breakfast is nice. The usual spread, plus some bonus's like a waffle maker. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful, from the cleaners to the managers.

Reviews.Title: “All around perfect”
Reviews.Author: Moonspring
Reviews.Content: It is hard to outdo the other reviews, but we can't say different. We've been visiting Toronto for years, with and without kids, staying downtown and elsewhere, and this was easily the best hotel experience. The suite style room is always preferable to standard rooms. We also got a great package deal with extra goodies thrown in that usually would have increased the price (e.g., parking, gas cards). Decor is tasteful, modern, comfortable. Love the large flat screen and in-room wireless. Pool, jacuzzi and workout room all very good. Entertain district location a plus. Being close to both subway and train gave us easy access to the culture and neighborhoods we wanted to see.

Reviews.Title: “My Family Loved It!!”
Reviews.Author: SATWorld
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights on our Detroit-Niagara-Toronto vacation. Found it online, and was impressed by the photos. We were not disappointed!! Location- right around the corner from the CN tower-we could see it lit up at night. The hop-on hop-off red bus also stops right around the corner. Subway is about 4 blocks away. Lobby: Tight, as the building is narrow. They had two wonderful water dispensers with citrus slices-refreshing!! Room: well designed and efficient. Full Kitchen. CLEAN!! Breakfast: food was great, seating was tight, although well managed by staff. Guests appeared to be attempting to shovel as much food as possible on their plates. Staff: Wonderful, very helpful. Even my usually cynical hubby was impressed. Our first night, we went downstairs to get a map and sit in the lounge area. The staff was so helpful, giving my kids (10,13) cookies, etc. The manager even gave them an ice cream from the little shop. They were very impressed that my kids actually put away the games (they have several right by the fireplace) after they were done. (I think some of their guests have been not so nice-see breakfast comment). If we ever need to go to Toronto again, we would definitely stay here!! The staff made us feel so welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Steal of the century!”
Reviews.Author: fliime
Reviews.Content: Went to priceline.com and offered $50US, thinking I wouldn't have my offer accepted, what a shocker!!! It was..... Very modern, up to date furnishings, clean, great service (fast check in). For the average price of $179 and only paying $64 (including taxes/service charges), you won't find a better deal. 4* Make use of priceline!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't ask for better in Entertainment District.”
Reviews.Author: JoshuaandTanyaLee
Reviews.Content: We booked our suite through Priceline ($80 bid) and could not have been more pleased. My brother was staying around the corner at the Renaissance (another Marriott hotel); he bid $90 on Priceline for what he thought would be a more upscale hotel but ended up jealous of our place. Hotel is spotless, room was impeccably clean and spacious, staff was incredibly helpful and the location is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want, But........”
Reviews.Author: recklessfriend
Reviews.Content: The room in the hotel was awesome. It was better than any bachelor apartment that I have been in. You have a good size kitchen, table and chairs, desk, living area, big flat screen TV, comfy bed and a decent sized washroom. This room is perfect for anyone staying for longer stretches or visiting with friends. Lots of places to sit for a nice drink before going out for dinner, club or theater. The kitchen is stocked with a setting for 4 as well as pots and pan, dish clothes and cutlery. Free wireless internet with available plug in. I was amazed the only thing the room didn't have that I needed was a lint roller. The package I booked came with free valet parking and a gas card valued @ $25. Without this package the parking is $30 a night. Yikes. And valet parking is the ONLY option. You are within a couple of blocks of the theater which was precisely why we were in town. So thats very handy. BUT......... My 2 main complaints. Even though its only 2 blocks away from the theater district, its 2 sketchy blocks. This hotel is located on a dark creepy part of the street. Lots of undesirables hanging around. Complaint #2 is regarding the breakfast buffet. It is included with the rate but it is hands down the worst breakfast buffet I have ever had. We were there over the Xmas holidays and there were alot of families and the little eating area was swamped with people. I doubt its like this during a regular week. The staff could not keep up with the demand for plates, they were running out of most foods and juices. It was total chaos. And good luck getting a table. You are on your own there. Staff is suitably friendly and helpful at the desk. Overall, GREAT room, bad food and an overall feeling of creepiness on the street out front.

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best!”
Reviews.Author: Travel-Girl-19640308
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Residence Inn in the Entertainment District of Toronto and I simply couldn't stay silent anymore! Even the most cynical traveller would be hard pressed to find anything wrong at this property. From the moment we arrived at the front desk, for an early check-in, my friends and I were impressed. Mary, was more than pleasant and she had already arranged a complimentary upgrade from a studio to a one bedroom suite. The room was lovely, spacious and immaculate, however I had originally requested a King bed and this room had a Queen. When I called from the suite, Mary was only too happy to upgrade us once again to the two bedroom suite. Upon returning to the front desk for new keys, she had already swiped the cards and had them waiting. Pleasant and efficient! What more could you ask for? The two bedroom suite was HUGE and again, immaculate. Perfect for three gals who were in the city to enjoy some live theatre. After a matinee performance of Dirty Dancing (excellent!!!) we had a lovely dinner a Penelopes and returned to the hotel just in time for the tail end of the Manager's Reception. What a concept - the Manager, Beth, was actually AT the reception and mingling with the guests. She sat down at our table and we had a lovely conversation with her. We filled her in on what a fantastic hotel experience we were having thus far. Her pride was evident in both the property and her staff, as it should have been. After a wonderful night's sleep on comfy beds, we enjoyed an excellent hot buffet breakfast. If I HAD to find some way this hotel could improve, it would be this minor suggestion, and one that mainly comes from an environmentally friendly standpoint: The shower curtain liners are too short, or the bars for the shower curtains have been hung too high. The result is a pool of water on the floor that is unavoidable when you shower. I would guess that at least one towel from every occupied guest room is used just mopping up the floor. What a huge savings in laundry over time if this small problem could be eliminated. I hesitate to even write one negative thing in this review, however I am confident that Beth and her staff will accept this criticism in the spirit it is intended and endeavour to correct the problem. I am returning to Toronto in February for another theatre performance and will most definitely be staying at this Residence Inn again. Can't wait!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Bet for Both Families and Business Travelers Alike”
Reviews.Author: rootbeer3283
Reviews.Content: The Residence Inn Downtown Toronto is the best bet in the biggest city in Canada! It boasts a brand new building, new furniture, friendly desk staff, in-room amenities, and is one of the few city hotels that has a pool. This review will be a long one, so I will break it down to the best of my ability. Also, feel free to look at the pictures I have included with this review also. Location: The Residence Inn (Marriott affiliated) Downtown/Entertainment District Toronto is nestled within the Financial, Entertainment, and Fashion districts of Toronto. The property is located on Wellington Street, which is a one-way street that goes in the West direction. Other streets connected to Wellington within sight of the hotel are Spadina and John streets. One block north, and connected to both of these streets is King St. West, which has many many different bars, restaurants, and attractions such as a theater that was showing the Sound of Music during our stay (End of December 2008 - Beginning of January 2009). The hotel is fairly easy to find, but there is not much of an overhang in front of the hotel, so if you arrive by a car and there are a few others arriving at the same time, you may be a few yards/meters away from the entrance of the hotel. Arrival and Check-in: As you arrive (we arrived by car, so this is the only experience I can solidify), you must park your car on the left side of the street near the curb in front of the hotel. A bellman will greet you (or as in our case, you may have to go into the hotel to grab the attention of one) and will load up your suitcases and belongings onto a cart. He then gives your keys to another person who parks your car (parking is only valet, at a partially reasonable $30 CAD a night). Check-in was as breeze, as was asking a few questions about the surrounding area. The desk staff had maps and would draw out where the location of the hotel was and would show you how to get to the location you were wanting to go to. Then the bellman took up our bags to the room with us. There are 3 elevators in the hotel and 22 floors total. When the hotel is busy (on New Years Eve, it was 100% full and waits were around 5-10 minutes) the waits get a bit long, but when it is normal, you usually only have to wait 1 or 2 minutes. We were on the 19th floor, room 1914. The Room: Our room was the One-Bedroom Suite. It was very well laid out, one of the biggest city hotel rooms I've ever stayed in. You could probably fit about 2 or 3 roll away beds inside the living area easily. The living area had a sofa-bed with a lounge chair. It also had a 32" LCD TV and a desk and chair, along with a sitting area with two chairs. Connected to this space was the full kitchen. It had a toaster, full size 2-door Refrigerator/Freezer, small dish washer, 2 hot zone stove top, and a conventional microwave. The drawers and cabinets had everything you could need to cook and eat - bowls, pots, small and large plates, glasses, wine glasses, silverware, etc. They also include dish soap and a powder packet for the dish washer. The queen bed was separated into another room, by a door. It had a 32' LCD TV in it and night stands, one holding a fairly nice alarm clock (no iHome though). The one bathroom in the whole "suite" was in the bed room, which was a bit of a hassle since someone was sleeping on the sofa bed and had to come in to use the bathroom. The sink area is also separated from the toilet and shower, which I believe is the Canadian style. Also, another annoying thing was that the fan came on with the light for the toilet/shower room which woke us up every time someone used it during the night. The queen bed was more on the soft side, which we liked so it was perfect. The sofa bed was- well, lets just say, like any sofa bed, uncomfortable. Also, the sheets that were stowed away in the closet for it were damp, so we called down for new ones (which were brought up promptly). The Hotel's Breakfast and Surrounding Area: As mentioned in many of the reviews of this hotel on Trip Advisor, the hotel's breakfast area, dubbed the "hearth room" is very small for a hotel of this size. I do have to agree with that statement as well. Although not very much of a burden, the breakfast in the morning is very busy non-stop. Each day of our stay, there was always a good 5-10 people up at the buffet area waiting to get food. The good thing was was that for our stay, they lengthened the break fast hours so instead of having it from 7:30 AM to 9 AM, they held it until 11 AM (12 PM even on New Years Day!) which helped a lot. As I mentioned before, the hotel was 100% full New Years eve and so the hotel planned ahead and swapped out small tables and replaced them with much bigger tables to accommodate the larger crowd, consisting of many college aged people whom were dressed like they just got out of bed (pretty funny actually, but don't worry, they all checked out New Years Day). Anyways, the breakfast, while the same each and every day, was for the most part very good. They offered the typical scrambled eggs, sausage (had bacon once), home fries, cereals, fruit and oat meal, and pastries. They also had a waffle iron in which you can make your own Belgium waffles (they even had strawberry topping for them which you could add to your waffle at your discretion). They also had milk, and four juices to choose from. Around the hotel, there were a few choices for food. We ate at this Indian restaurant called Aroma, which was very good (located on the intersection of Kings St. West and John St., a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Also, there is a very good flat style gourmet pizza restaurant, Pizza Rustica, a short walk in the West direction down Wellington st. and crossing it at the first street you come to. Also, right next to that, is a small convenience store which sells many food items as well as magazines and DVDs. This is the same store that the hotel uses to get groceries for the guests at the hotel (the Residence Inn allows you to give the desk staff a list of groceries you want, and they will get them for you for only the price it cost for the items you wanted). On a side note, the CN tower is a easy walk two blocks away at most from the hotel. The Pool, Gym, and Computer Area: All located on the second floor of the hotel are the Pool, Gym, and "Business Centre." While small, the pool is very nice and although I did not swim in it, I heard that it was nice. It also has a small jacuzzi right next to it. right next to the pool is a gym. The gym has two treadmills, two bikes, and a cross trainer along with weights. It has a television on the wall, but on the two bikes, there are integrated televisions so you can watch your own program. Right next to the gym is the "Business Centre." It is basically a small small room that has two adequate computers with internet access so you can check your email and other various things. The room also has a printer. If those two computers were occupied, there was also another computer in the hearth room, next to the bar area. A side note here is that you must be 16 or older in order to use the computers and I believe it is the same for the gym or there has to be an adult with the child. You also need your room key card to use any of these. Check Out: Our experience was quick and painless (aside from an additional room phone charge misunderstanding, which was easily subtracted from our bill) and got us on our way quickly. The bell man was just as attentive as he was when we arrived at the hotel. We paid $179 a night Canadian a night which was a great deal, through the hotel's website. Overall: This hotel was great and I will definitely recommend it to anyone who is going to travel to Toronto. It isn't #1 on TripAdvisor in Toronto for nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JulesKW
Reviews.Content: Had tickets to a concert at the Air Canada Centre and started looking for a hotel. Chose the Residence Inn Toronto Downtown/Entertainment District for its price and rating here on Trip Advisor. Location was great--convenient to theatres, restaurants and shopping and fairly easy to get to off the expressway. King suite was large and nicely furnished and had a nifty view of the CN Tower. Had pleasant interactions with staff. Room super clean and building as a whole seemed to be in good shape. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a nice metropolitan city.”
Reviews.Author: Babyjan
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel to spend the second part of our honeymoon. The studio suite was beautiful - spacious, lovely bed, right temperature etc. After being in Niagara Falls for 3 nights, we arrived here with the plan to relax after a lot of touristy stuff in Niagara. We could not have been in a nicer hotel to relax. Location wise, it is a two minute walk from the Rogers Centre. We had a brilliant night at the Hard Rock there enjoying the baseball. We also did part of the tour bus tour. I forget the name of the company, but they were rubbish - never again. The only downside to the hotel was that they recommended the tour. Its a boat & bus tour, don't do it. I loved walking around Toronto. It is not a tourist spot, more a nice city to live. That was the feeling I got from it anyway. Saturday morning was unreal - so quiet for a big city. Overall, a nice relaxing stay in a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rabbit74
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Residence Inn downtown, and I was not disappointed! I usually stay at the Courtyard, or the Eaton Centre Marriott, as I am faithful to the brand, but I wanted a hotel in the entertainment district this time. I had no problems with check-in and the room was spacious and spotless. My only "issue" is that they don't offer a self park option, and Valet parking is the only way. They do give you unlimited in and out privileges, but I prefer not to use valet. Just a minor inconvenience to me, that's all. I did find the breakfast area extremely busy, but I know the hotel was nearly full because there was a Madonna concert at the ACC that night, so I wasn't surprised. Also, I noticed that there was a Cora's just around the corner, so in a pinch, that would have been fine too. All in all it was a very enjoyable stay, and the location is second to none if you have business at either of the stadiums, or the convention centre. I will definately be going back in December for 2 nights, as I have business in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: weezee42
Reviews.Content: Helpful friendly staff, beautiful rooms, and hot breakfast. Wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: NY11373
Reviews.Content: I got the Residence Inn via Priceline for about 1/4 of the going rate. The location is walking distance to CN Tower and the entertainment district. The St. Andrews Subway station is a 5 minute walk. Check in was very quick and I was given a room in a quiet corner of the 6th floor. Although not a great view, I am not at a hotel to look out the window. My room was decent size and spotless. It had a full kitchen with all appliances and cookware. A plasma 32" TV with many channels was a nice touch while lying in the comfortable bed. The biggest bonus was the compliementary free breakfast complete with eggs, sausage, waffles, fruit, yogurt and cereal to name a few. At checkout, I was asked how my stay was and they took the local call I made off the bill. I would definately recommend this hotel while visiting Toronto, espeacially families who could save on breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: John E
Reviews.Content: Really great location, within walking distance of the major attractions of Toronto & right next to the CN Tower/Rogers Dome/Ferry port We booked a double room & we're disappointed by the size. The kitchen was kitted out to a substantial level & we loved the complimentary popcorn which we prompted 'popped' in the microwave & scoffed on arrival Basic gym & pool/sauna are available if you get bored of Toronto, we used them a couple of times to relax/wake up Service was excellent from all the staff, they were helpful & polite as you'd expect We didn't try to the complimentary breakfast but the bar & bar snacks were of a high qaulity! Excellent hotel & great location for a short or long stay in Toronto

Reviews.Title: “We use to love it, but not anymore”
Reviews.Author: StephanieinOntario
Reviews.Content: We use to stay at this hotel as we loved the suites, the breakfast in the morning, and location. Perfect for a family of 4. HOWEVER, things have changed. Our most recent stay was a disappointment. We booked and payed full price through the hotel website. Asked for a 2 bedroom, but none were available. So I asked to be on a waiting list, since we booked it far in advance. No 2 bedrooms available when we arrived, but we could PAY for a cot each night, she said. I forget how much it was, but it was over $30 a night! I said no thanks. It would have been nice if they had included that, since they knew I wanted a 2 bedroom and was given a 1 bedroom, but oh well. $ 300 night, plus the numerous taxes and valet parking... close to $400 a night. The room. Sofa bed had nothing on it, and they knew we had to use it. I called ahead of time. I called for extra sheets and pillows. They just dropped it off and didn't offer to help. Breakfast was WAY too busy for the size of the space. This hotel is too big for what it has to offer. They even tell you take your breakfast to your room, as there isn't enough space. We had to wait in line for awhile. Not the staff's fault, but the eating area is way too small. Valet parking only. $30 a day. When we went to get our car, we were told to go to the desk, not to call ahead, as they have no space to leave your car when they bring it up. There is NO parking or " stop area" at the front of the hotel. So we got our car and it was COVERED and I mean COVERED in bird feces. We couldn't see out of the window, so he turned on the wipers and smeared it all across. It was obviously left under a bird perch or something. It was ridiculous. But he just left it like that. Didn't even offer a paper towel or anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Long Stays”
Reviews.Author: rorokimtor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott Residence Inn Toronto Downtown (at 255 Wellington St. W) 9 nights while in Toronto for a business trip. 9 nights is long enough for any accommodation to get stale, but I found that coming home to the Residence Inn was a pleasure every night. I've stayed there twice before and enjoyed it each time. Every room I've stayed in comes with a full kitchen (fridge, dishwasher, stovetop, dishes, utensils) and at least two work spaces (great when I travel with my wife). I did quite a lot of work in the room - I found the wireless internet a little slow at times, but nothing disastrous. Each room also has a sitting area with a funky chaise-lounge couch and a recliner - the large flatscreen tv swivels so that you can watch it from your sitting area or from the comfy king-sized bed. It was great having a comfortable sitting area and nice tv - on nights I didn't feel like going out, I could entertain easily in my room. The hotel does not have room service but they provide you with plenty of order-in options. They'll even go grocery shopping for you if you want - the cost of the groceries appears on your bill but the shopping service itself is free. And there's a little "market" in the lobby with snacks and such (very overpriced but handy in a pinch). The layout of the room made it easy for me to unpack and keep my things organized - I really appreciated the ample storage space in the room and in the bathroom. The room was always clean and fresh - I have bad allergies that are made worse by Toronto's occasional smog, but the climate-controlled room cut down on the amount of Benadryl I usually have to take. I appreciated that the cleaning staff cleaned around my things without disturbing them. The front desk staff were always very helpful and the staff at breakfast were very friendly. Breakfast is included in the room rate - your usual hot and cold hotel buffet but enough variety that I could have something a little different every morning. The front door/valet parking staff were super as well - always got me where I needed to go! From a location point of view, there were lots of coffee shops and restaurants to choose from - it was a short walk to theatres and movies and only a block from two major streetcar lines. Overall, I would highly recommend the Residence Inn to any business traveller.

Reviews.Title: “They've raised the bar!”
Reviews.Author: puilam
Reviews.Content: We are originally from Toronto and decided to stay in the entertainment district for a weekend of fun. We chose this hotel because it had the added full kitchen, and for a family, it's ideal. We chose the studio room and got one on the 14th floor with a fabulous view of the CN Tower. Well, the Marriott chain has outdone itself with this Residence Inn location. I believe it is newly built which is why the room is spotless and not showing any wear yet. Although the hot breakfast buffet is pretty standard fare you can't complain - complimentary breakfast is better than none. Everything about the room was amazing: upgraded lighting fixtures, super-comfy bed with high thread count sheets, granite (or something like granite) counters in the kitchen and bath, upgraded work desk and table, large bathroom, flat panel TV (that swivels almost 360 degrees), easy to control room temperature settings, nice kitchen appliances and kitchenware (not the cheap stuff). Super comfortable - truly a home away from home. We're used to less than stellar service from Torontonians in the service industry, but the staff here are friendly, well trained, and efficient. A total surprise for us! Maybe Toronto is changing its ways. The only complaint is the thin door and huge gap at the bottom of the door which makes any hallway noise seem like it's coming from your own room. I usually save 5 star ratings for very high end hotels but this one deserves it! Other notes: 1) stay away from the buffet breakfast between 9-10am, it's like a zoo and can get very crowded 2) the complimentary wi-fi service is good but slow at times 3) parking is $30/night; but valet service is fast and friendly

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Taheg
Reviews.Content: Had a really enjoyable stay, front desk staff very friendly especially Brian who was a star. Had a two bedroom suite and it was more than spacious, one queen and one king. VERY comfortable beds, didn't want to get out. Actually we looked forward to going back to our room so we could lie on our respective beds and chill in front of the huge flat screen TV that was in each bedroom (as well as the lounge, 3 TVs!) - fabulous. The suite was well equipped and had everything to make our stay comfortable. The breakfast was very good with a wide choice to suit everyone, there was cereal, fruit, scrambled egg and bacon, muffins or if feeling adventurous, you could even make your own waffle. We really enjoyed our stay and will be recommending the hotel to anybody that is going to Toronto. It's in a great location, has great staff, lovely rooms and a nice breakfast to keep you fuelled for all the walking. Toronto is a great city and staying at the Residence Inn Downtown made the experience even more enjoyable. Have a great stay if you decide to go, and say hi to Brian!

Reviews.Title: “Good base for Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Jojicat
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days in a one bed suite. Disappointed that as a Marriott cardholder we were only put on the 4th floor so had no view except building site. Woken at 6.30am by building works which didn't help. Breakfast of good standard with decent choices. Good decor in room and high standard of cleanliness but could have done with a bigger bath.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel; close to sites”
Reviews.Author: capturedplanet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn Toronto Downtown for 3 days. The staff was superb as was the room. The complimentary breakfast included a big selection of hot items and pastries. Two downsides to this hotel is that 1) this is a hotel frequented by families and 2) the elevators are extremely slow. One had to eat early in order to avoid the breakfast room becoming crowded with loud and extremely energetic kids. We checked in to the hotel around 11 am and the kids breakfast scene was in full swing. The amount of people plus the two already slow elevators made it take a long time to get to and from your room. Notwithstanding this, the location of the hotel + the cost make it a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and large rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Swedish_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite up on arrival instead of the studio we had booked. We also had a weekend package price so this was truely a great value for the price to stay here. A hot breakfast is included it was standard hotel breakfast nothing more or less. The room had a bedroom, a lounge, bathroom and a kitchen. It was large and spatious. Nice colours and design. As the hotel is still rather new everything also still looks very clean. The rooms have complimentary wireless internet. One of the best things with the hotel is its location. It was extremely easy to walk down to the main sights like CN Tower, Harbourfront and even downtown to Hockey Hall of Fame and the Union Station. We would strongly recommend this hotel for tourist visiting Toronto since its so convenient to get to all sights from here.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: gerapau
Reviews.Content: Our family (my wife, our two boys and I) really enjoyed our stay at the Residence Inn. From the time we arrived to the time we left the staff were very happy to answer any questions and responded quickly to any requests. We were originally booked into a 1 bedroom suite (1714) but the boys were disappointed with the view (we were looking at another building only a few meters away). I went to the front desk and asked if there were any rooms with better views available and was shown to room 1013. From this room you could see part of the CN Tower from the bedroom but it still wasn't what we were hoping for. The desk staff then mentioned that they really didn't have any 1 bedroom suites with views of downtown (what we were looking for) but offered to show us a king suite. As soon as the kids looked out the window in room 1710 they decided that my wife and I didn't really need a separate bedroom. You could see both the downtown core as well as the CN Tower. The room had a king sized bed as well as a pull out sofa that was big enough for out 10 and 12 year olds. The room was very spacious and had a 32 inch flat screen TV which swiveled so you could watch TV from either the sofa area or the bed or both. The TV was HD capable but didn't actually have any HD channels (I know it was HD capable because I hooked up my HV video camera to it to look at some of the videos I took while in Toronto). The suite provided a well equipped kitchen with fridge, cook top, microwave and dish washer. Our room had a small table for 4 (funny thing is that the original 1 bedroom suite we were shown only had a table big enough for 2). We all ate every morning at the provided breakfast buffet in the lobby (it was surprisingly good). The hotel itself is well situated being very close to the theatre district, the CN Tower and Sky Dome and a number of restaurants. We enjoyed the 15 minute walk to the waterfront a couple of times. Overall we had a great visit and would definitely put the Residence Inn at the top of our short list the next time we visit Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ,great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MRS.TRAVELS.OFTEN
Reviews.Content: Right downtown,very close to theater district. Great price ,huge room. our price included free valet, a $25.00 gas card and Break feast included scrambled eggs,sausage,potato s,fruit ,cereal, yoguart , english muffins, donuts etc. BEDS ours was a king quite comfortable , lrg rooms with full kitchen-nice clean Bath rooms. staff friendly .One bad thing --walls are very thin you hear everything . Get a room 20 floors or higher and facing south east you will see the the CN tower . we were not that fortunate our room was 2004 and we faced north and saw the Holiday Inn on king st west. all in all great place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Residence Inn”
Reviews.Author: NDFAN03
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in a 1 BR suite. The room was great. The entire staff at the hotel was the nicest we've ever encountered. Our only complaint was that the breakfast area is fairly small and it was very crowded. Next time we go to Toronto this will be our 1st choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: midwestgirl8888
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in August. It was a great location. We had a room on the 21st floor with a view of the lake/city. It was quiet. The service was excellent and attentive. The room was large with the amenities as described on other reviews. We didn't use the pool or the fitness center but it seemed about what I expected. Husband and kids had breakfast every morning and really liked the selection. They had a wait about 10 minutes as they went at the height of breakfast. You gotta expect that sort of thing with 22 floors of room and a free breakfast, I think. Overall, I would definitely stay here again. The Valet was fine although I wasn't thrilled my car was not in a covered lot but eh, no big deal. (It was parked in the lot just around the corner)

Reviews.Title: “Can't imagine a better pick for a small family on vacation!”
Reviews.Author: catfish77
Reviews.Content: This hotel deserves its TA rating. The location affords a short walk to varied food choices (King Street), CN Tower and Rogers Centre (baseball), and the Lake (Harbourfront, urban beach, and ferries to the Islands). The free breakfast was quite good every morning. The closer you get to 9:00 am, the greater chance you have to stand in line briefly, but the staff keeps the process from devolving into a convention of starving vultures. Tables are quickly cleaned and the food is replenished frequently. One morning, the smiling receptionist reminded me not to leave my precious camera unattended on our table. (Another day, our alert maid told us we had left our room door ajar the day before and showed us how to close the door all the way. DUH!!) A few tips: 1. Most maps won't show it, but there's an easier way than Blue Jays Way to walk to the Tower. From the hotel's street corner, look southeast and you'll see the CN and the ball park. Walk that way abnd you'll cross the RR tracks via a pedestrian bridge. 2. There's a small, 24 hour grocery store on the corner of Blue Jays a block north of Rogers Centre. 3. Wellington is a one-way street, but it's not congested. 4. Don't repeat my stupid tourist trick. The first morning, I didn't see a newspaper bin. I asked at the front desk, where I learned about the papers in the breakfast area. There was a selection of four (including USA Today). And they were free. Nice. Our dollars were well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: katkat17
Reviews.Content: Wonderful room, we stayed for 3 nights. Great kitchen area, dining table, sofa, 2 chairs, comfortable bed and bathroom. All very clean, staff great and we could see the CN Tower from our window. No problems getting around, we walked to most places and also had a pass for the "hop on hop off" bus. Breakfast was great, especially the option to take it back to your room. The lemonade available in the lobby area each afternoon was also very welcome after a day of walking. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Scrappy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Residence Inn for a week while we did the tourist thing around Toronto. The room was very nice, though the carpet was a bit dingy. We loved that it had a kitchen with a full-sized refrigerator and ice-maker, coffee maker, microwave and two-burner stove, as well as plates, glasses, cutlery and pots and pans. We didn't cook for ourselves, but it was nice to know that we could if we wanted! Bathroom was nice; everything seemed new. We had a great view of the CN Tower. Bed was nice and firm; we slept very well. TV was one of those widescreen TVs that automatically switches back to widescreen format every time you turn it on, which was annoying. Our room had a door to the adjacent room, and there were kids staying in there and we could hear them shrieking while they played, but otherwise it was very quiet. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Elevators got a little too busy in the early evenings, and breakfast was a bit of a zoo, but the food was pretty good. No room service, but the phones had local takeaway places on speed-dial, and they provided a magazine listing nearby restaurants and their menus, so we didn't go hungry. The location was perfect, centrally located to everything we wanted to do, and just a block away from Second City. They had fruit-infused ice water in the lobby every day, which was very refreshing after a hot day walking around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Needs restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Betabloke
Reviews.Content: pro's Big rooms, clean, friendly staff. con's 30CA$ for parking, no room service, no restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful break”
Reviews.Author: stretch8674
Reviews.Content: Just back from an great seven night stay in the Residence Inn. We picked this hotel for it's location to the CN Tower and other attractions and also because of it's excellent previous reviews and we were not disappointed. We were greeted after a very long day of travel by Bryan, a very friendly staff member on the front desk, who gave us lots of tips on where to eat out visit etc and a room with an excellent view. The room itself was a very good size and well laid out with all you could need, one downside for us was the bed was a bit on the firm side but not a major issue. The free wifi access was invaluable in assisting us in planning some of our trips. Both breakfast and the lifts (we were on 20th floor) do get busy after about 8.30, but the staff are very quick to assist you and it's fine to take breakfast back to your room if you prefer. This was our first trip to Canada and would definitely recommend visiting Toronto and staying at the Residence Inn.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrelandCarol
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3 nights from 29th July, two adults and two children, we found the rooms to be very clean, well done to the cleaning staff, and the furniture was very modern. The breakfast was very good, the staff were not the most friendly i have ever come across, it was a bank holiday and I,d say most of them were students, the barman was very friendly though. The hotel is situated very near to the CN tower and a short walk to the lake, for the shopping areas you need to take a taxi, only about 5 minutes though. The rooms having cooking facilities which is very usefull when you are traveling with children, we had a fridge microwave, two cooking rings and a dishwasher, all cooking utensils were supplied also.......I would highly recommed this hotel....

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, quiet, quiet!”
Reviews.Author: FishBulb500
Reviews.Content: We booked a one-bedroom suite at this hotel based on the reviews on TripAdvisor and were pleased to find it was all true! All the staff were incredibly friendly; whenever we stepped into the elevator, if any staff member was there also they would smile and say Welcome, and ask how our stay was so far. The cleaning staff were utterly outstanding. I wanted to pack them into my suitcase and bring them all home with me. Kind, efficient, excellent! Our room was perfect in every way, including the view, and I was truly surprised as to how quiet it was! We're fairly certain the floor was concrete under the wood subfloor, which made for a very quiet stay. We barely heard a peep from anyone else. The decor of the rooms was fresh and nice, and the kitchen was clean and well-equipped. The bathroom was a tad small but it certainly fit one person at a time. The pool and hot tub are smaller than they seem in the pictures and you need to know the floor of the pool area has about 1/10 inch of water within a 12" - 18" perimeter around the pool. However, we spent many evenings there and so did other families, and we all had a blast. Just don't expect a large space and don't wear your socks to the area. There is free breakfast every morning and also free dinners some nights, which was a wonderful bonus. The bartender, Randolph, is also a magician and entertained our young son greatly. The location of the hotel was awesome; a couple of blocks away from the CN Tower, Rogers Center and the subway. Toronto's transit system was impeccable and we were glad for the close proximity of the subway to the hotel. There are also a number of small grocery stores within a block or two of the hotel so you can easily stock your kitchen. The whole area was great. Oh, and if you're there before September 2008, the Diesel Playhouse around the corner is featuring Evil Dead: The Musical. A must see, if you liked the movie franchise! Have I mentioned how friendly and accommodating the staff were? It cannot be said enough. They were really something. Two small caveats: 1) Local phone calls cost $ 1.50 each. We didn't know this. After 9 days we'd racked up $ 30.00 in phone calls! No biggie, but it would have been nice to know this beforehand. So now you know. 2) The mattress on the sofa bed was the kind of mattress I have on mine at home; the kind you utilize in order to keep company from staying too long. It was thin and the springs made it lumpy. I made the bed using the cushions from the couch also, and my son liked it then. Otherwise, if a larger person sleeps on it (larger than a 7-year-old) you might want to request extra comforters and towels for padding. Neither of these concerns put me off my rating of 5 stars for this hotel. I will gladly stay here again and have enthusiastically recommended to everybody I talk to. I'm glad to have found this place; it made an awesome trip into a perfect trip. I have such good memories of this vacation and a big part of it was thanks to this hotel. We stayed for 9 days and an unbearable hotel for 9 days would be, well, unbearable. This was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: mecclest
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Residence Inn for 2 nights in late March while in Toronto visiting friends. We chose it because of the positive Trip Advisor reviews, its newness, and the good rate we found. The hotel didn't disappoint - it looked new and modern throughout, and the rooms are great. Rooms Since it's a Residence Inn, the standard rooms come with more than the average hotel room: a kitchenette and 2-seat table, a small sitting area (couch, chair, and coffee table), plus the usual king-sized bed, and a large bathroom. The flat-screen television rotated so it could be watched from the couch or from the bed, which I thought was pretty cool. Everything was spotless and very new-looking. Hotel Front desk - staff was very friendly and helpful, and we checked in and out with no trouble at all. They also gave us maps and reliable directions for getting to the main sites. We used the gym one morning - small room with two treadmills, two bikes, an elliptical, and some free weights. The usual hotel gym setup, with a tv hanging from the ceiling. Equipment was clean and all in working order. We didn't use the (indoor) pool, but the gym looks right out on it. Pretty small, but it looked like there was hot tub too. Breakfast - part of the room rate, so we had it the morning we left. Nice layout of breakfast standards: scrambled eggs, bacon, pastries, as well as cereal, yogurt, and some fruit. Most noticeably, the servers at breakfast were very friendly and helpful, even though they were very busy with a room full of hungry, sleepy guests. Location Pretty good for tourists. Nothing really within a block of the hotel, but only a few minutes walk to the CN tower, the waterfront area, some nightlife, and we even walked to the Distillery district - about 25 minutes, but pleasant even on a cold day because the sun was out. Parking As I recall, the hotel charges $30/day for parking, and the garages nearby are similarly priced (and sketchier), so this can add a significant amount to your bill, just be prepared. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay. A modern, spotless, and comfortable hotel, with friendly service, in a good location, at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Ann-70
Reviews.Content: I booked three rooms at this hotel after reading so many positive reviews about this hotel. I had made previous arrangements to stay at the Reanaissance Toronto and I am not dissapointed about making a last minute change to the Residence Inn. The hotel is situated just a couple of blocks from the Blue Jays stadium and within walking distance to the best restaurants and shops in Toronto. Even though the rooms are sparkling new, they serve a complete breakfast and have all the amenities for a leisure or business travel the best asset this hotel has is its staff. The Front Desk personell is very accomodating, the bell persons act as concierge and the maids take care of the rooms like it was there home. Kudos to Marriott and the General Manager of this hotel. You made my entire family's vacation this year. THANK YOU!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms; perfect for families with children”
Reviews.Author: anonymous01
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the Residence Inn downtown Toronto. The hotel is quite new. The room/studio was perfect with a fully equipped kitchen; comfortable king bed, large bathroom, flat screen TV, dinning table, sofa, fridge, microwave, stove etc. The hotel is therefore perfect for families with children. And we got the impression that most guests were families. Breakfast was disappointing, but maybe that was because of the crowded breakfast room with screaming children. The location is central to most popular tourist attractions. However as it is located near the financial district we believed it is not the best area to stay in Toronto. We preferred the Yorkville area for its restaurants, museums and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Awesome Awesom!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tundra14
Reviews.Content: Alright, my fiance and I were heading to Toronto for a concert last fall and needed a place to crash. Went on Priceline and got this place for US$55.00. Priceline rating of 2.5 stars, we figured no problem. Conveniently located close to A.C.C. When we arrived though, WOW! What a surprise. From what I understand the hotel is relatively new so everything was sparkling. We requested an upgrade to a King suite room and got it no problem, no charge. The Room was jaw dropping. Full size suite, with fullsize kitchen, fridge, stove, microwave and even dishwasher. They even had a popcorn bow for us to use! 32" flatscreen t.v. located at the foot of a gorgeous, plus king size bed and a nice sitting area with sofa and loveseat. It gets better. We were alerted that Thursday there was a "managers" party in the main "restaurant area" for all guests. We attended prior to the concert and were greeted with a catered dinner by a local European style Pizzeria cafe. Thin crust pizza with salad and all the fixins'. We felt guilty about the free eats so we started ordering Martinis and the bartender was excellent at entertaining us! The morning was just as good with a full time hot buffet breakfast, AGAIN COMPLIMENTARY! - scrambled eggs, pancakes, waffles, even fresh fruit! We must say, that even at triple the price we paid, this hotel was one of the BEST! I parked within a short walk down the street at the open lot across from Gretzky's restaurant, but if I recall, the hotel did have valet parking for a bit more of a cost. Definitely a great place to stay, especially if you were travelling with a family and wanted to eat it.

Reviews.Title: “Briliant place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: caj4
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Residence Inn based on previous reviews. We stayed for 10 nights , and we were given a room directly opposite the lift on the 21st floor. Unfortunately we could hear the comings and goings of residents at all times of the night , so we asked on the 2nd morning to be moved. Explained the problem to the reception staff who moved us without question to another room on the 22nd floor. They were fantastic, and the rest of our stay was brilliant ! The room was very spacious, extremely clean and if we return to Toronto, we will stay there again. There was a slight queue for the breakfast buffet in the morning, but again the staff dealing with that were also excellent. In all, the Residence Inn is very well located , very friendly and helpful staff, and excellent rooms !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.”
Reviews.Author: AnotherHoustonian
Reviews.Content: Great location, great hotel. The rooms are absolutely fabulous. They are stylish, new, modern and spotless. The location is next to the entertainment district which makes it an easy walk to shopping, restaurants, theatre, etc. Check in is friendly and efficient. Everything about this place exceeds my expectations. I would place this hotel against its posher competitors any day of the week. Stay here. You will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again!”
Reviews.Author: Researchlover
Reviews.Content: I research hotels alot before I travel, and this one was almost as presented by others. The check in staff were friendly, even though they tried to charge me for a cot that was supposed to be free. The room was very nicely laid out and appointed. Its easy to fill the full size fridge from the corner grocery store to save money. Tip for parents...get the one bedroom suite, its worth it! My one gripe was the room could have been a bit cleaner. It looked clean initially, but upon closer inspection it needed a little more sprucing up. Candy wrappers in the pull out bed, and black finger prints on the white door. Nothing major, but just a little let down. The pool was smallish, but my kids loved it. It was usually empty except for us. The exercise room was very new, and had some nice equipment. The internet access room needed more terminals as it was usually busy. Free breakfast was great ,as there was a variety of food. The line varied upon our breakfast arrival time from deserted, to extremely crowded. Overall, I liked the great attitude of the staff and you can't beat the location. I walked with 2 young kids to the CN tower, the Centre Island Ferry and other attractions. (Bring a stroller though for younger kids, as the blocks are too long for them). I would stay here again, though this place does not have the upscale feel ot the Soho Metropolitan, just down the street. (Its much more expensive though)

Reviews.Title: “You will be lucky to find better in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: gglg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a studio king suite at the Marriot Residence Inn. It is located downtown, a 2 minute walk from the CN tower, a feature of Toronto not to be missed. A variety of quality and reasonably priced restaurants are within a block of the hotel. The hotel breakfast buffet is inclusive in the room rate and features an excellent range of cold and hot breakfast choices. The hotel's rooms are outstanding -large, clean with modern furnishings and in our case, a kitchenette. The king bed was very comfortable. The view of the CN tower from the window was a nice feature. The hotel is very good value for money. The hotel staff and desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Don't bother looking too much further than the Marriot Residence Inn- you will be lucky to find better in all respects in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Hotel in Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: SnowbirdOntario
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay in a nice two-bedroom suite at the Marriott Residence Inn Toronto Downtown. With convenient road access and close to all the attractions (especially the entertainment district venues, and Rogers Centre (skydome)), this was an excellent hotel choice for us. The check-in process was smooth and very friendly. There was special water and coffee available in the lobby area for arriving guests. Our two-bedroom unit on the fourteenth floor (highest that they have two-bedroom units on) was really more like a condo, with two bedrooms -- one with a king bed, big desk, and ensuite bath, and one with a queen bed and ensuite bath. In our unit, the room with the king bed had a window with an outside view towards a wall of an adjacent building and the room with the queen bed had a nice more open view looking out over the condo building across the street. (Some rooms will have a view of the CN tower.) An open kitchen/dining/sitting area arrangement with another window keeps everything open and allows everyone to be together when they want to be. The kitchen was well equipped with full size appliances and all the conveniences of home. They will even shop for groceries for you if you want! The sitting area included a sofa-bed and a chair. The dining area had a table with four chairs. Each bedroom and the sitting area had a large flat-screen TV. Coffee maker/coffee provided in-room for your convenience. Complimentary high speed wireless internet access is available in-room. Business centre has a couple of computers for access for those who did not bring a computer with them. Nice pool and exercise room in-hotel. A very nice buffet breakfast is available (included) each morning. It includes hot and cold items (waffle iron, eggs, sausages, cereals, toast, fruit, coffee, tea, juice, etc). It is served in a big restaurant type room adjacent to the lobby. In the early evening (about 5:30pm-7:00pm) Monday to Thursday the hotel puts on another complimenary "snack/light dinner" buffet with a range of items depending on the night -- Italian, Chinese, Greek, BBQ, Mexican, etc. It is served in the same area that the breakfast is served, but the room is set up more "family style", rather than individual tables. It includes non-alcoholic beverages and the bar is open to purchase alcoholic drinks. We did not try it the night we stayed, but it sure looked like a lot of guests were making this their evening meal. Especially handy for families. The night we stayed there, the evening buffet was provided by Pizza Rustica, a nearby restaurant venue, with salads, pasta, pizza, garlic bread, etc. The hotel posts the evening buffet schedule on the fridge in the room, but they do not explain how it works very well. We called down and it was then explained to us. I think we'd try this next time we stay. Parking was a bit of an issue for us since we are not keen on valet parking ($30). We parked in the underground parking garage associated with the office building next door with an entrance on Windsor St. With no in-out privileges, the cost did add up. It was $4/half-hour all the time, with a $13 max 6am-6pm, $10 max for evening event parking, $5 overnight, and then it starts again. Overall we had a great stay. Very clean and new hotel. Nice people. Lots of restaurants and venues within easy walking distance. We'd definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: toocoolfornc
Reviews.Content: We were here for Three nights Canada day weekend 2008. Here are the good things: Great location-one block from Rogers Center and CN tower. Short walk to restaurants on King Street and shopping on Queen Street. Staff- extremely helpful desk staff (especially Nadine). Answered all questions, gave good directions. Room- we had a large king bed studio. Full kitchen. Pull out sofa. Seperate shower and sink rooms. Programmable safe in closet. Very clean and well maintained. Valet parking-On weekends cars stay and eat free( free valet parking, and free gas cards). The parking attendants were the best I have ever seen. We only used our car a couple of times since you can walk to so many places. Breakfast buffet- Excellent food. Dining area was not very big and it got crowded, but it was a holiday weekend in Canada and there were a lot of families staying here.] Here are the bad things: It rained a couple of times. Don't think that was Marriotts fault but it's the only complaint I can think of. We stay at Marriott Hotels quite a bit. Four different ones this year. One of our nights was free with our reward points. You pay more for these hotels but I think the service they provide is worth the money. This was one of the best hotels I have stayed at in a long time. The service was top notch and the building itself was in great shape. I recommend this place to anyone going to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in the heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: gvr001
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property for 2 nights while attending a meeting in the nearby conference center in the second week in June. The property is conveniently located 2 blocks from the CN Tower, Baseball stadium, and Convention center. It is a short (10-15 minute) walk to the University of Toronto, China Town, and Queen street. If you are on business or vacation, it's nearly impossible to beat this location. There were only a few small quibbles with the property. The onsight parking is valet only, and the charge is $30/day. The lobby area is quite small, and there is almost always a small wait to speak with one of the desk attendants. However, I must say that it was nice that they hold your bags prior to checkout without a charge, and that your car is retrieved promptly by the valet attendants. Otherewise, the property is fantastic! The breakfast buffet is free, and features several hot items and excellent coffee, fruits, and bagels, and is easily worth $10-$15. The exercise area and pool are very nice, with each piece of equipment coming with it's own TV. The rooms are very nice - Each one has an LG flat screen TV with a nice kitchenette that is more than adequate. The mattress and pillows were very comfortable, and the rooms were cleaned in a timely manner. Given the size of the rooms, they are actually very good value compared to several of the other downtown hotels. I would definitely considering staying in this property again if visiting Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Residence Inn continues to be my hotel of choice downtown!”
Reviews.Author: smarteepants23
Reviews.Content: I have visited this hotel twice in the past 6 months (once on New Years Eve and once June 7th) and can safely say it will continue to be my first choice when staying downtown! This hotel is an excellent value for bigger groups but also very reasonable for singles and couples as well ($200 a night taxes in). Rooms are spotless and each has a great kitchen/sitting area/washroomâ€¦.much larger than the average hotel room! Check in/out was easy and friendly each visit. The beds are very comfortable, there is a great flat screen tv, and the modern styling of the rooms are very attractive! This hotel has a great location only a couple blocks from the subway and right around the corner from the CN Tower and Rogers Centre. One extra benefitâ€¦.buffet breakfast is provided complimentary each morning of your stay (something for everyone!). I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to anybody! Enjoy Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Residence Inn is THEEE place to stay, loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: tony412
Reviews.Content: The MRI is in the perfect location. We parked our rental at the hotel and didn't use it once. Everything is within walking distance. Less than 2 blocks to Rogers Centre and CN Tower, Tons of restaurants, bars and clubs in the streets that follow, although the MRI is on a quiet street (which is good). The hotel itself is in excellent condition. Very modern and clean. The rooms also very modern. Bathroom is one of the nicest I've used at a hotel. The bed was comfy with nice, quality, clean pillows and sheets. Not much use for the kitchenette with a short stay but defiitely nice also. Granite countertops, icemaker in freezer, everything you need to cook or eat a meal. LCD tv was nice to have if even for only a few minutes of watching. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful to tourists such as myself. They provided suggestions, directions and maps. The hotel also provides a complimentary buffet breakfast which was not only good quality but good to the checkbook. I could not have asked for a better hotel to stay at. Whether you are looking for nightlife, sightseeing or both, I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting downtown toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to the Staff”
Reviews.Author: G2
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the room, restaurant and location but wanted to comment on the wonderful staff. This was a consistently upbeat and professional group all the way from the great front desk team who looked after us over 5 days (especially when we experienced some medical emergencies) to the restaurant staff, cleaning crew and super front door guys. The staff at the Residence are a real "family" and made our visit a most positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, this hotel ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: AnnG_and_SteveP
Reviews.Content: We paid in advance for a King Studio room, and were very pleased with how well equipped it was. Fantastic bed, lots of space, well kitted out with a modern kitchenettte, iron and ironing board, safe,small gym and heated pool on the 2nd floor. The inclusive breakfast set you up for the day, and we particularly liked the oatmeal porridge. The hotel is 5 mins from the CN Tower and the Rogers Stadium. We walked everywhere and the grid street layout of the city makes it easy to get from A to B. This part of the downtown area is undergoing quite a bit of construction work, but the hotel is well sound proofed and you don't hear it. Very helpful team on reception and the whole place ran like clockwork. We would definitely opt to stay in another Residence Inn as it was great value. We had 6 days in Toronto, and fitted in the Niagra and all the major city sights. Not expensive to eat out, and we felt very safe whilst we were here. Good for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a city break”
Reviews.Author: Carol_A_N
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Residence Inn from 6-10 June 2008 for 4 nights. We had a 2 bed suite on the 14th floor which had everything you need even had large dishwasher and a huge fridge/freezer which came in handy for ice cream as there was an heatwave on whilst we were there. Could not fault it at all. Hotel is in a great location, plenty of resturants nearby , not too far to the train station. I think this is probably the best hotel we have stayed in when doing a city break. Would definately recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great all rounder”
Reviews.Author: FoxsmumMelbourne
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 7 nights, sharing with work collegues. We had a conference at the Metro convention centre which was a 5 minute walk away. We`had a two bedroom suite. This was huge, with 2 bathrooms, a great kitchen and lounge. There were 3 plasmas in the apartment! Breakfast was included in the room rate and was above average. Wish they had the bacon every morning though! I did a lot of shopping while I was there and although the shopping is a long walk, it is not far on the very easy to use subway. There are loads of great restaurants within walking distance too. Staff were lovely. Cannot fault them. Extra Toronto tips: Canoe restaurant is pricey but excellent with great views Niagra is a good day trip. If you ARE NOT a US or Canadian citizen then you DO NOT pay duty/tax on anything you buy at the outlet mall on the US side of Niagra. Worth the trip. If you want to watch a blue jays game in comfort, have a meal at the restaurant in the Renassiance Hotel - minimum $50 a head spend but a ticket costs almost this much and you can look down into the baseball diamond from the restaurant, Need to book though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: ErinDwyer
