Reviews.Content: Hotel employees were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast buffet was plentiful, but not exciting. Room was lovely and nice view of CN tower. Great location near Blue Jays and theaters.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: ReluctantTraveler
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights here in May 2008. We had a beautiful room on the 20th floor with a city view, but still could see the CN Tower and the lake. Our room was huge -- about twice the size of our room in a comparable Residence Inn in Vancouver. We had a king bed, a queen sofa bed. full kitchen, table with 4 chairs, desk with work chair, two recliners and still had room to move around. The hotel is conveniently located and within walking distance of the convention center, transportation, and lots of restaurants on King Street. They provide a beautiful breakfast every morning, but if the hotel is full, it gets crowded in the lobby. Likewise, the wait for an elevator can be long. I also would have appreciated housekeeping services earlier in the day. The maid usually arrived at 4:00 p.m. We paid $30 per day for valet parking with in/out privileges.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to live in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: Ar_Bmore
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a conference in Toronto and stayed at this environmentally friendly hotel for a week (yes they recycle etc). We picked this hotel after reading all the +ve reviews on TA and boy did we pick well! Throw in free internet access and a free breakfast buffet and you just can't beat this superb deal. Here's the skinny on our stay: Rooms/Suites: We stayed in a King suite and it was outstanding! They have it stocked with everything from utensils, mugs for coffee and even a dishwasher. Tastefully appointed with contemporary decor (LCD tv etc.) and the housekeeping staff are just excellent. Location: Excellent - super convenient to everything downtown, the convention center and all kinds of shopping and public transport. Service/staff: Excellent ('nuff said). Family friendly and road warrior friendly. We had a lot of colleagues staying at ritzier hotels with nowhere near the quality of service or rooms like the Residence Inn. Staying here is a no-brainer and I hope this review saves you the headache of reading a 100 more reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: NanComm
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel based on the many good TA reviews for a Mother/Daughter weekend the end of April. Very much up to the usual Marriot standards - new, spiffy, clean, welcoming staff,etc. We had a studio room with a pull out couch which was comfortable. Staff was great. Location is wonderful - which was fortunate as there was a transit strike for the weekend. So we were able to walk around the block to go to Second City, and there were many restaurants also within a block. We ended up taking a cab in the morning to the St Lawrence Market, but easily walked back after. I would def book here for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: za travel
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights. Great staff, great service, great rooms. Excellent wireless. Every staff member was friendly and helpful. I can't think of any negatives for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: Love-to-travelOttawa
Reviews.Content: We were travelling with our 2 young boys and thought the accomodations were perfect for us. We had a one bedroom suite and requested a cot so that our boys had their own beds in the living area (there is a sofa bed as well). We were also surprised that there were no sheets on the sofa bed when it was time for the kids to go to bed, but there were sheets and blankets in the closet for the bed. We didn't ask for the staff to make it for us. The hotel is in a great location. Our young boys loved being able to walk to the CN Tower and to a Blue Jays game. The staff was great - they were very pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was great too - something for everyone and certainly made the price of the room a bargain. The valet parking was great. We were in and out of the hotel many times over the weekend and they were very professional and had our car waiting for us quickly each time it was requested. Overall, a great hotel in Toronto and a real bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: mont990
Reviews.Content: What more can I say that has not already been said!! Great Hotel, Great Staff and an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunate but I had problems...”
Reviews.Author: olivebaby
Reviews.Content: Okay so I'd like to start out by saying that the hotel pictures posted on their website are accurate (description of sizes not so!). We picked this hotel because it was rated as the #1 Hotel in Toronto....plus it is new and that is always a bonus! I also found the rates a bit high. We were traveling for business and pleasure. We booked a 4 night stay and requested a high floor with a decent view...about 2 weeks ahead of time. Upon check in we were told that there was a note to be upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite if available...of course this excited us, my son was ecstatic! Unfortunately there wasn't one available, but we could check the next morning for an upgrade. We were sent off to our room only to find out that they stuck us in the tiniest room with a view of some sort of fan system (absolutely no sunshine)....oh and the room was on the lowest floor possible!!! The room had empty candy wrappers all over the room (at this point I am now thinking that the room is not as clean as it appears)! Of course I am now very disappointed that I gave up a great deal to stay at the Sheraton Centre (Club Level). I phoned the Front Desk and was told that they really didn't have any rooms with great views...if you stand outside of the hotel it is very clear that they do in fact have a great view and it is of the CN Towerâ€¦apparently this is not considered a great view. They did say that they could move us to a room that was a bit larger (if a guest is staying for 4 nights why would you put them in the smallest room possible anyways?)â€¦I opted to stay considering I was told that the chances of us getting upgraded to a 2 bedroom the next day was likely. Later that evening (11ish) we were getting ready for bed only to find out that the sofa bed was bare with no sheets or pillows in sight? Supposedly you need to request this service? If there is 3 people staying in the room and there is one bed and one sofa bed, where do they think the 3rd person is going to sleep? We ended up waiting about Â½ hour before getting the sheets and pillows. The next day we got the run around and then were told by one of the managers that the Guest Service Agents should not have said that we could be upgraded because of the rate we booked at, she wanted us to pay over a $100 extra per night to get upgradedâ€¦we were very disappointed! I really didnâ€™t want to stand and argue about the service I was receiving thus farâ€¦so I took the room they offered the day beforeâ€¦shockingly to find out the room was twice the size of the room they stuck us in (and with a city view on a high floor)â€¦again I canâ€™t explain how disappointed we felt to know that they tried to stick us in a sardine can on a 4 night stay, I would have been very happy to check into this room! Also beware of the Valet they will park your car in the public parking lot up the road!!! Now the nice thingsâ€¦the free breakfast & pool area were good. And the staff was friendlyâ€¦but the management team lacked in customer service!!!

Reviews.Title: “GORGEOUS HOTEL!! Beautiful room.”
Reviews.Author: kikileighc
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel! It is the nicest, by far, that I have ever stayed in. My boyfriend and I stayed here during my graduation at the Toronto Convention Centre. It was a bit pricey but the cheapest in the area (which was surprising because it was gorgeous). Many of my friends stayed here during the same night and we all were very impressed. The room: the bed was HUGE and so comfortable! Flat screen TV in front of the bed, full kitchen, sitting area, great bathroom and large vanity. The best part was probably the breakfast. It was a free continental, but not like any youâ€™ve ever seen. It was a delectable buffet, complete with hot and cold foods, even fresh waffles. It was a great location. We came back from the bar and made popcorn (provided by the hotel) in our microwave. :) The staff was really nice. I would recommend it to anyone staying in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: se2121
Reviews.Content: Stayed here mid January 08 for two nights. I'm partial to Marriott hotels to begin with but this new hotel was excellent. The location is wonderful. We had a rental vehicle which we never used once to get around the city. You are only several blocks from Chinatown, the CN tower, and all the sporting stadium/arenas. The hotel staff was the friendliest I have ever seen at a Marriott and were very helpful in providing information on good restaurants, good bars, and directions. The hotel itself is wonderful as I stated because it is new. THe fitness area is sufficient for a quick workout, don't expect a real gym. The indoor pool was suprisingly large and the hot tub wasn't as warm as I would have liked but that's just a personal issue. The room was large and the bed was great. For anyone that has stayed at a Residence Inn, it is a typical Residence Inn. The evening snacks and cocktail reception were excellent. For someone who wants to have a small meal, it would be sufficient for your dinner. One night we had Indian food which was great and the other night was "Sports" night so it was just hot dogs but good enough. The breakfasts were also supprisingly decent for a free buffet. Overall for the location and hotel ammenities, I would recommend this hotel to everyone. It is not a luxury hotel but it was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pointless_parasite
Reviews.Content: Well I'm not the slightest bit suprised that this is rated the #1 hotel in Toronto. I spent one night here due to a problem with my room at another hotel, and it turned out to be a blessing. The reception staff were very friendly and efficient, despite the fact that I had foolishly lost the covering letter explaining everything. Clearly I was tired after a long day of travelling and they sensibly prefered to get me into my room and get another letter faxed over. I was absolutely shocked to find that this hotel is only rated as a mid-priced 3 star. I have stayed in four and five star hotels that are not a patch on this place in terms of room size, cleanliness and facilities. The Residence Inn is also one of the few hotels in Toronto to offer complimentary breakfast as standard, which also turned out to be good quality. Absolutely wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great business destination property”
Reviews.Author: h_in_WA
Reviews.Content: Property is around one year old. Room larger than average (corner room was great), contains kitchenette with some pots/pans/utensils (not enough fi you're a cook like me, but you can burn a dinner with some good effort if you buy all the ingredients), fridge, place settings etc. I think that they will also shop for you. Breakfast is standard and not outstanding. The big draw is the daily GM Reception - actual food (one night was chicken wings and veggies, just like a bar), and sometimes the GM will buy the first round (apparently Canda law forbids an open bar, or so I'm told). Exercise room is small but adequate if all you need is an elliptical, recumbent and regular cycle, tradmill and freeweights. Business Center (2 PCs and a printer) is open 24/7, as is the fitness room. Staff is very helpful. I would stay again. -hm

Reviews.Title: “Excellent new hotel”
Reviews.Author: symbiosis379
Reviews.Content: I obtained this hotel on Priceline for a one-night stay during a leisure trip to Toronto. Upon walking into this hotel, I knew I had scored a great deal. The young woman at the front desk (Erin) was one of the friendliest people I have met at a hotel. She quickly checked me in and gave me a room on the 14th floor. When I walked into my room, I was immediately impressed. It was a large studio suite with modern decor, and it was well-appointed with a full kitchen, spacious bathroom, and flat-screen LCD TV. High-speed internet access is free. The view out of my room was an unobstructed panorama of the CN Tower and Rogers Centre. Since I was only staying for one night, there are many conveniences of the hotel that were lost on me, but in fact were there, like the full kitchen and complimentary hot breakfast. However, I'm sure any business traveler would be very pleased with this extroardinary Residence Inn. I wish I could have stayed longer, but I had already made plans to stay with friends at another hotel for the rest of my visit to Toronto. Unfortunately, even though it ranks higher in star level, I was not nearly as impressed (but that's in a different review). I recommend this hotel to anyone visiting downtown Toronto. It's just a few blocks from the central business district and subways.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time Around”
Reviews.Author: Kelly088
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a one night stay at the Residence Inn for the second time in the last couple of months. We went with another couple and we booked the 2 bedroom suite. It was extremely large which gave us all privacy. The staff are incredible!!! As this is a new hotel, the rooms are spotless and very chic. The valet parking is a little expensive, but as the location of the hotel is perfect, you will not have to drive anywhere once you arrive (especially if you are going to the theatre). The best part about the hotel is the "homey" feel. It is so comfortable you will not want to leave. We will definately continue to stay at this hotel everytime we visit Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel within walking distance of everything”
Reviews.Author: Jaegerchick
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at this hotel from 10th - 14th December 2007. It was a really nice hotel with everything being brand new. I had requested a high floor and we were lucky enough to have a room on the 21st floor (2114). The rooms are large and spacious, with a separate bedroom & bathroom. The bed itself was extremely comfortable! I cannot fault this hotel at all. The staff were really helpful and courteous at all times. The breakfast was great, a range of cold & hot items so it set you up for the day. I would like to say a big hi to Randolph who looked after the bar in the evenings. He was really informative and helpful, great fun as he always had loads of amusing stories & jokes to tell us, and all in all a really nice guy. A credit to the Marriott hotel. My husband & I walked miles around the place, did all the tourist bits such as CN Tower (had dinner up there for my birthday), went to St Laurence Market Square, Eaton Square etc, China Town, Little Italy etc. Great chinese food in China town, really cheap and good food! We did a day trip to Niagara Falls with Niagara Tours (they do a basic tour just door to door for $60, I am sure that was the name of the company that we used). It's on a Greyhound coach. It was booked through the hotel and we paid $95 each for the trip, as we upgraded on the coach to include the tour itself through Niagara on the lake, the stop at the Helicopter place, my husband did it and said it was really good, plus the trip to the Imax Theatre). It was well worth the extra $35 each from the basic trip.Normally the trip is $105 but we got a discount for already being on the coach from the hotel. The driver was extremely informative, and helpful. We went through Niagara on the lake, spent plenty of time at the falls themselves, which are quite something even in December. This trip was really memorable and I really recommend doing it. We did the journey behind the falls, which gave some great views of the falls from the side etc. The hotel does getogether's in the early evening, offering free nibbles, soft drinks etc, to try and get everyone together. We went onto Montreal for a few days, so do look at my review for that as well. If anyone wants any further information don't hesitate to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Nice fitout, Good food”
Reviews.Author: AussieInVancouver
Reviews.Content: This Marriott Residence Inn is brand new and very well done. The rooms are large, comfortable and stylish with great beds and linens. The staff are helpful and the included breakfast good quality. The hotel is right in the heart of Toronto's entertainment district, blocks away from theatres, bars, restaurants, the CN tower, the Rogers Centre (Blue Jays), Air Canada Centre (Leafs and Raptors) and Union station for transportation. Definitely recommended for business or personal travel.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: sabretooth316
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, I would echo all the positive comments on here. We stayed in a 2 bed/2 bath suite. It was massive, almost like my dream apartment! 3 30" LCD Tvs and so spacious! Excellent value. The hotel is also close to the nightlife district in Toronto as well as the CN Tower and Union station. Front desk were on the ball and were eager to help us make the most of our stay, whether it be by recommending places to go or booking a car to take us to the airport. Finally, the breakfast was so varied and delicious! Top marks.

Reviews.Title: “thumbs up!!!”
Reviews.Author: slumberdudes
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific hotel. We relied on Trip Advisor and booked a number of rooms for 2 nights in September 2007. Hotel staff is excellent. Attentive and willing to assist with any questions or issues that arise. Hazel was a gem. Hotel is new and clean. Rooms - especially 2 bedroom suites, are large and very comfortable. The suites are a deal as the beds are big enough for 2 to sleep comfortably and the pull out sofa can accomodate 2 people. The kitchens allow you ample room and kitchenware to cook - micro, dishes, big fridge, coffee pot etc. Perfect set up if you don't want to eat all your meals out. 2 large bathrooms in the 2 bedroom suites with ample towels and bath products. TVs are flat screen and good. Hot breakfast is nice. Evening happy hour has some good snacks and if the Tin Whistle Brewery is hosting FREE BEER!!! 2-3 blocks from Rogers Centre, CN Tower and walking distance to good restaurants and entertainment. If traveling with kids this is a good choice because of the spacious suites, kitchens and breakfast. The regular studios were also very nice and good size. Upon our return to Toronto this will be our first choice of hotels!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but needs some help”
Reviews.Author: Ceallaigh
Reviews.Content: The staff was wonderful--friendly, helpful, always smiling. The hotel was clean, room was spacious (king studio). The breakfast in the morning is real food with decent variety, although it's crowded. We were never in the hotel for the evening receptions, so can't comment on them. The kitchen has a full-size refrigerator, but the king studio has two burners on the counter and a microwave--no oven. If you are in Toronto to go to plays, Second City and the symphony, this hotel is right there within walking distance of everything. It's five blocks to the subway, but only a block and a half to a cable car that will take you to the subway. The Airport Express bus doesn't come to this hotel--leaves you at the Holiday Inn on King about a block and a half away. HOWEVER, during our nine days there, we had use of all three elevators only three days. There is no service elevator, so the staff was always using the guest elevators--they were very accomadating--if there were guests, the staff got off without a word, but it was very inefficient and I always hated that they couldn't get their work done because 1) not all the elevators worked and 2) they didn't have an elevator of their own so they could get where they were going without having to wait. We tried to use the laundry in the hotel and there was no soap in the vending machine. There was no soap anywhere in the hotel. Again, the staff was wonderful--they went to a store and bought a box of Tide for us and then left a nice little gift in our room as an apology that we had to wait 1/2 hour to do our laundry. It's not a big thing and we're not downgrading the hotel for it, but it's a symptom of a bigger problem, I think--lack of planning. It's a comfortable, clean hotel, reasonably close to public transportation, in the heart of the entertainment district, with some problems that need to be worked out.

Reviews.Title: “horrible service”
Reviews.Author: Dira
Reviews.Content: I was treated very horribly by the staff at this hotel, I would not recommend it to anyone no matter who you are. Maybe its because they are new they don't know how to treat guests but I can tell you this much they ruined my entire stay and never bothered to do anything about it,until I took action. I am disappointed that a Marriott would act like this, but atleast now you know that they are not capable of effectively dealing with problem resolution during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Victim of its own sucess ?”
Reviews.Author: hnswst
Reviews.Content: No doubt due to the reviews here the Residence Inn is very popular, and deservedly so. Maybe we were just unlucky, but there were only two lifts working during our stay, which led to some long waits. One evening there was only one lift working, and the power went off briefly. So, yes, it's as good as everybody here says it is, but Marriott need to keep their eye in the ball

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Awesome Room”
Reviews.Author: janices7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Residence Inn Toronto for 3 nights. Upon checking in, they upgraded us to a 1 bedroom suite which was huge. It has a full kitchen, dining table and living room with flat screen TV and windows with a view of the harbor and city. The separate bedroom had a super comfy bed and its own window with city views and the bathroom had a large vanity with a separate shower/toilet area. The room was fabulous and clean. The hotel is in the entertainment district which means there are tons of restaurants, shops and shows/comedy clubs within walking distance. In addition, the CN Tower and baseball stadium are within a few blocks and the entire harbor is about a 10 or 15 minute walk. We took the double decker hop on-off bus tour of the city which had stops within a block of the hotel so we saw the entire city as well as Casa Loma (which is definitely worth a visit) on a 2 day pass. We used the Grayline bus company, but I would never use them again. The buses were always 20 to 30 minutes late and they even went right by us even though we were standing at the stop waving when he flew by. Everyone that was on the Yellow Double Decker bus tour seemed to be much happier and the buses looked newer than the old run-down red gray line buses. Several nights during the week that had free late afternoon drinks and appetizers in the lobby with food like fajitas, pizzas, pastas etc. The breakfast buffet was out of this world with make your own Belgian waffles, eggs, bacon, sausage, toast, muffins, bagels, breakfast potatoes, juices, coffee and more. We would definitely stay at this little gem in Toronto again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidf37
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. 5 Minutes walking distance to both the Rogers Centre and CN Tower. Also walking distance to all the nightclubs in the entertainment district. Rooms are brand new and kept spotlessly clean. This property is also reasonably priced with the AAA discount. I can't think of a single negative thing to say about this property.

Reviews.Title: “The three "C"s comfortable, clean, convenient”
Reviews.Author: momxthree
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Residence Inn and were thrilled with our experience. The rooms were the cleanest I've ever seen and the staff went above and beyond to ensure that our needs were met. Great room, great staff, great hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Deservedly Ranked #1 in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: MaturemanL
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed twice at the Residence Inn in Downtown Toronto at the beginning and end of a 3 week tour of Eastern Canada and New England. The hotel is new or at least newly refurbished and anyone who spends time in hotels knows how rare this is! We were 2 adults + 1 child and we stayed in a studio suite which proved to be very spacious,great kitchen with coffee machine,dishwasher,micro,full size fridge etc. The room had a large screen LG Plasma TV and the bed was a huge Kingsize ! Lobby is small as is usual for Residence Inns and the breakfast room was overcrowded on a weekday morning. Indoor pool was fabulous together with a jacuzzi and a full size exercise room with treadmills,weights etc. Every room has high speed internet cable and just of the pool is a small "business" annex with 2 computers hooked up to the internet if you didn't bring a laptop. Location is superb - right in the entertainment neighbourhood,2 blocks from the CN Tower and the Rodgers center. Staff was extremely helpful for any request we made and especially the doormen and bellboys went out of their way with the luggage,ordering taxi's etc. A wonderful hotel and definitely my first choice for any stay in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: baffinboy
Reviews.Content: Ended up staying at this hotel for a night but will definitely stay there again next time I'm through Toronto. I found the room to be very nice, big and clean. The staff was most helpful and friendly. I did try to go to breakfast in the morning but was there during the last hour and the line up was very long. It didn't seem to move at all while I waited so ended up giving up before I could get in but the breakfast did look good. My only complaint was that it was a hot day there and the air conditioner didn't seem to keep the room that cool. This hotel was one of the most reasonable in it's class and location and probably the nicest. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to reputation :-)”
Reviews.Author: Kevin-Teresa
Reviews.Content: Myself & my wife recently stayed at the Residence for four nights based on the reviews other travellers had posted on Tripadvisor. Had originally been booked into the suites at 1 King West but jumped ship as their reviews plummeted and am soooo glad we did. Found the accommodation excellent, the staff surprisingly helpful, genuine and friendly....was not forced in the least and the location spot on. The CN Tower and Rogers Stadium are about a 5 min walk away, theatres, restaurants etc are equally convenient. This is not a stuffy hotel....it is relaxed, friendly, well equipped and value for money. With regard breakfast, it can get busy but was not the mayhem we had anticipated and was plentiful and lip smacking good. My only criticism and it is minor was that the air conditioning was noisy but could be either turned to low or off completely. The fridge did tend to take on a life of its own during the night and was also noisy but then again I am a light sleeper and overall its a thumbs up from us. I would happily recommend this hotel to any fellow travellers in the full knowledge that they would NOT be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel”
Reviews.Author: britfan3273
Reviews.Content: Beautiful new rooms with all the amentiies. Very clean and spacious. Generous buffet complimentry breakfast included with stay. The only thing was, is that there were no vending machines, no where to get food late at night except for the market across the street, which was also closed. Othere than that, absolutely no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Good stuff!”
Reviews.Author: RedHeadGo
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! It is located within walking distance of various arenas, restaurants and bars and very walkable to the trolley or subway (is about 10 minutes). There is a parking garage on the alley behind the hotel, where we parked for a much better rate than valet, if you leave the lobby and walk to the right of the hotel, it is in the alley to your immediate right. The check-in staff was quick and professional and assigned us a room just as we requested. Our room was incredibly nice, just as everyone had stated in their reviews. As you walk in there is a full kitchen with all the amenities including a toaster, glass top oven range, fridge, microwave, dishes, paper towels, dish soap, everything you would need to cook a meal. There was a nice desk with chair (no free high speed, which was incredibly disappointing, as I thought all Residence Inn's had free high speed). There was also a fold out sofa, another chair and some tables (including a kitchen style table), so there was plenty of room to spread out. The studio suite had a nice large king sized bed that was high off the ground. Only peeve is that it was literally a foot from the windows. Noise wasn't terrible from the outside (since we were so high up), however we did get woken up a few times throughout the night with sirens and things. We didn't hear much of any inside noise, except for a few people in the hallway, so the construction must be good. There was a nice mix of feather/poly pillows on the comfortable bed and the linens were clean. There is a fantastic LG TV that had a ton of international channels with CC, it was in analog mode, but still looked quite nice. There is a large closet with ample hangers and nice new iron with ironing board. Ample drawers for your things. The bathroom was a good size and including a vanity outside the toilet/shower area. Nice soft towels. Was clean and had good water pressure. The free breakfast was wonderful, eggs, sausage, waffle maker, yogurt with toppings, oatmeal, toast, Danish, juices, coffee, etc. The wait was crazy the first morning and there was a line, I just wanted to take something to the room, and didn't want to wait. The next morning, luckily, no line. They provided a tray so I could carry my goodies to the room, was excellent. There is a business center next to the pool, was a bit too small with two PC's and printers, and the ink was out while we were there. Too many kids using it for e-mail and since it was tucked away, there was no regulation. Indoor pool looked nice. Didn't get a chance to see the exercise room. There is a Tim Horton's right around the corner (thank goodness!) and we ate at a Quizno's one night out of desperation. The snack shop in the hotel is not great, they really need to add more snacks (candy, chips, pretzels, etc.). Luckily there is also a grocery store across from the hotel. My two complaints with Toronto, a lot of the places we went to (including the subway) aren't taking credit cards just yet, so bring a lot of cash with you. Second, some of the locals don't tend to tell you how long of a walk you are getting into. A few blocks to me usually means like 3-4. We were sent on a few wild goose chases that ended up being 1-2 miles. Just be sure you map out where you want to go and understand the walking you are getting into ï�Š Overall, this is a clean, newer hotel in a decent part of town. It is in a quiet area of the city, which can equate to boredom, so make sure you have some activities planned. Bring lots of cash, and your walking shoes!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: PeterOregon
Reviews.Content: An outstanding, new hotel, well located downtown: fair room prices; large suites with all necessary amenities and nicely decorated in a modern style; luxurious linens and comfortable beds; friendly staff; generous breakfasts along with varying evening snacks and drinks. A real gem, equivalent to other hotels that charge twice as much.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful gem in Entertainment District”
Reviews.Author: jennalulu
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at the Residence Inn for the Toronto Film Festival, and were extremely pleased with our stay. Check in was a breeze, the rooms were completely clean and decorated in upscale modern furnishing, with flat screen tv's in both rooms (one queen, one king) and the living room, dishwasher, full fridge, microwave and cooking range. Pullout sofa bed was comfortable, and there were more than enough pillows and blankets for everyone. We brought our free breakfast buffet items up to our rooms both days, as it seemed a bit busy, and some of our party was still getting ready to leave for the day. This didn't seem to be a problem. A fantastic gem right around the corner from great shopping and eating, as well as many of the major theaters. Two small issues. During the first morning, apparently two of us were using hair dryers in each of the bathrooms at the same time, and must have blown a fuse. We mentioned this to the front desk when leaving for the day, and it was fixed upon our return. Also, there is no on site parking. We chose to go around the corner from the hotel and parked in a basement lot, which seemed reasonable for $40 CAN for two nights. When we went to get our car out on Sunday morning, the lot was locked, but the attendant showed us how to open the doors. We were one of about 6 cars left in the lot. Probably won't park here again, although it wasn't too much of an inconvenience. There was an open lot available for parking around the corner from the hotel. This won't deter us from staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: nowzer
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly new hotel when we stayed there. There were a couple of construction quirks still going on at the time. They were still working on the sidewalk in front of the door and the whirlpool was very cold. The room was great. Location was great, especially if you were going to a ballgame. Staff tried to be helpful but some of them were new to the area also. Loved the evening snack. One night it was so good we made it a meal. The only problem was breakfast was crowded, there wasn't enough seating and the staff was having trouble keeping up with plates and silverware. The food was great, it was the best oatmeal I 've ever had and that is saying something. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing city centre hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Andrew_and_Natalya
Reviews.Content: Why, why, why canâ€™t we do this in England. Youâ€™ll see weâ€™ve given this hotel 5 stars and Iâ€™ll explain the main reason why. Â£70 a night including breakfast in peak summer season and itâ€™s slap bang in the centre of Toronto with the Rogers Centre and CN Tower less than 5 minutes walk away! Also, there are loads of restaurants nearby and the theatre district â€“ see Evil Dead the Musical, thatâ€™s all Iâ€™ll say on the matter. The rooms are huge, I donâ€™t think youâ€™ll really appreciate this until you arrive. Even if you donâ€™t intend to self cater the kitchen is great as you can store drinks and snacks in the enormous fridge and make tea in the microwave. There are some other things that make it great â€“ recent films and entertainment via your TV that are not an absolute con to watch, good sized bathrooms, a large safe, loads of hangers (sounds silly but so many places donâ€™t), free popcorn, free tea and coffee and internet access in the lobby, the list goes on. Some minor quibbles - the swimming pool complex was a bit disappointing for a hotel of the size and the breakfast room was too small to accommodate the hundreds of people who descended 15 minutes before breakfast finished!! However, these are minor things. English hotels take note, this is how you do a city centre hotel, Iâ€™ve stayed in rubbish hotels in small towns in England that have cost twice as much.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!!!”
Reviews.Author: gypsyeyes73
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Residence Inn late August. It was built this year (2007) and the rooms are immaculate, we got a one bedroom suite on the ninth floor and it was very tastefully decorated, just beautiful, the rooms look exactly like the pictures. It was in a great area as well as I was not afraid to walk around in the evening with my 5 year old daughter. WIthin walking distance of Via rail, CN tower, airport shuttle (in front of Fairmont royal york). Hotel staff was so friendly and the hot breakfast in the morning was delicious (tip: go early to avoid crowds, but if it is crowded, ask for a tray and bring the food to your room). The pool is about 4 feet deep all around so if you go with a young child, be sure to bring some sort of floaty device for them. I can't say enough about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it......”
Reviews.Author: sworl
Reviews.Content: I am about to echo the previous reviews, but I am writing one anyway. We just stayed there for two nights, I had booked a 1 bedroom suite, as that was all that was available at the time of booking, when we arrived, I asked if a 2 bedroom was available since there were 4 of us, and there was (I kind of figured there would be, somehow I didn't believe there were none available). Anyway we got it at the same rate as the 1 bedroom, and it was fantastic. We each had a bedroom, my kids shared the room, great tv's in each room, flat screen tv's. There is a living room with a sofabed, full kitchen with dishwasher, stove and full fridge, with dishes, cutlery, pots and pans, etc. Everything you need for a long stay. The location is good, close to the entertainment district, with varied choices of restaurants on King Street West, many ethnic restaurants so quite a good choice of food selections. Close to Skydome too and not far from restaurants at Front near Simcoe Street either. The only downside is the parking fee which is $30 a night for valet parking, a bit steep and since the hotel is so new, staff working the valet parking seemed a bit disoriented, but I am sure that will change. The staff at the front desk and at the breakfast room and at the bar were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was good but the room fills up quickly, so be there early or you will have a short wait before you are seated. We didn't try the snacks at the manager's reception - but it sure smelled good (they were serving pizza the evening we were there). It is a lovely hotel, the room is beautifully decorated and the location is great. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, be it a family or singles. IT WAS GREAT !

Reviews.Title: “Not my first choice”
Reviews.Author: casemnor
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here a couple times for business travel and it is an ok place. The hotel is new so the rooms are fairly well appointed, but I must say, I've stayed in 4 different rooms and the AC is exceptionally loud in each of them. Had some minor issues with amenities (skimpy on the towels, service issues such as a non-functioning socket) took several requests to amend. I didn't even bother to complain about the door to the bathroom that wouldn't shut due to previous water damage. Elevators can be slow during rush times. Breakfast can be a bit fo a zoo. On the weekends, the breakfast is just impossible withpeople carting plateloads of food from the buffet and long lines. The location is a bit of a pain as it is on the westside of town and a bit of a schelp to the heart of the business district, and about a 5-10 minute walk to the closest subway. Good choice for families b/c of free breakfast and snack in afternoon, and given the plethora of children...a child friendly crowd. (One principle reason for staying here this last time around was that my 2 year old came up for a week, and I wanted a place where I wouldn't worry that a stray tantrum would ruin someone's romantic getaway). My preference is to stay elsewhere, somewhere closer to yonge, but I wouldn't refuse to stay here again. One thing for management to note: One of the young chaps that works the evening shifts was often observed out of eyesight of the front door having a smoke with young (possibly underage) teenage girl guests. Parents beware.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonTravelbug
Reviews.Content: There's not a huge amount I can add to other reviews, as this hotel is as great as everyone says, but thought I would add my comments to keep it at no 1 in Toronto! The location is great for the CN Tower, which you need to get to fairly early to avoid the queues, and the SkyDome, if you get the chance to go a baseball game. It's not too far to the subway, but it worked out to be around the same price to get a cab from the city centre than 2 subway tickets, which was great when you have tired feet and lots of shopping bags! You can easily walk to good restaurants and entertainment from the hotel. The only slight downside was the breakfast, in that it was very busy and a (lukewarm) buffet. If you prefer a cooked to order breakfast, Cora's on Blue Jays Way is just around the corner and serves the most incredible pancakes, along with the usual breakfast fare - excellent food, but beware of the queues on game days - there was a queue right down the street about lunchtime. As others have said, the rooms are incredible, housekeeping perfect and the use of free internet in the business centre (if you dont have a laptop) is great for checking your email and checking in online with BA (which is such a great idea). Sadly didn't have a chance to use the pool, but it was very clean and had a whirlpool. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the nicest hotel we have EVER stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: punkparents
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for it's excellent location near the Metro Toronto Convention Centre. It is an all suites hotel and the room we had was fabulous. It was very clean and well supplied. There was a King sized bed in the seperate bedroom that was like sleeping on a cloud! The kids loved the fact that there were two tv's! Beyond the fabulous room was the extras that came along with our $209.00 a night. A FULL hot breakfast buffet every morning and a cocktail reception each night. The indoor pool is great and the hot tub was very relaxing after a long day at our convention. The most memorable part of our stay was the impecable service. The Marriott team is to be praised for their attentivness and politeness. Everyone from the Valet that meets you at the door to the team at the Front Desk are the most professional group that we have encountered to date (and we have stayed at MANY hotels over the years). Thank you, Marriott, for making our trip to Toronto the best.

Reviews.Title: “5* quality”
Reviews.Author: bear79
Reviews.Content: I was so excited when I arrived at this brand spanking new hotel. The King Studio was bigger than my 1br flat in London!! The room included a kitchen with everything you'd need, including dishwasher, ice machine and microwave. You get 1 bag of microwave popcorn in your room and there is even a 'popcorn' button on the microwave. They've thought of everything! The bed was super comfy and the air conditioning was much quieter than other hotels I've stayed in over the past couple of months. Breakfast had quite a good selection and there were no issues with taking a plate of food to your room to enjoy. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough! Toronto's a great City and I hope to get back to the Residence Inn again one day. (NB: We paid $140 (including tax) a night which was dirt cheap for the quality of this hotel)

HotelInfo.Name: Residence Inn by Marriott Toronto Downtown / Entertainment District
HotelInfo.Address: 255 Wellington Street West, Toronto, Ontario M5V 3P9, Canada
